story:
We are Turncoat Syndicate. We write, preform and record Rock and Roll.  With your help, we also release Rock and Roll. Please, take a moment to view the video above to get a feel for our current project.  If you like what you see and hear, we would be forever grateful for your help in achieving our goal. We want to finish an album that we believe you will love. Let's do this together. Be a part of making this album and enjoy some killer rewards as a sincere token of our appreciation. 
All our best,
Dan, Pat, Will & Mat (Turncoat Syndicate)

story:
What happened


Sometimes life moves us unexpectedly in unpleasant ways that make us vulnerable but ultimately help us grow. Medicine Web is a music project developed by Dakota Gonzalez and Liberty Weaver who met at the Singing Alive Cascadia gathering in August of 2015. We immediately began flying in love and with the musical medicine that was flowing between us. We were moved deeply to develop this music and begin sharing it as soon as possible.

The 3000 miles between us didn’t stop the power of this love and music. With what little money we had, we organized a weekend visit in October when the portal to the Medicine Web was cracked open and fully revealed. At the end of November, after 6 weeks of sharing music back and forth via phone, text and email, Dakota drove the 3000 miles across the country for our second visit and first show in Portland, Oregon. It was well-attended by loved ones and the music medicine was shared in an intimate and loving way.

Days later, on the morning of Dakota’s scheduled departure to St. Louis, we were awoken by the news that his car windows had been smashed. His Ukulele Bass and all of our microphones were stolen, a value of about $1100. One of the mics was of particular sentimental value, as it was the microphone that Dakota’s father, Raymond Gonzalez, was singing into when he had a lethal stroke last year :,(. Needless to say, it was a rough day that moved us deeply to consider our path as musicians and call on the grace of our higher selves to serve the musical medicine to the fullest.

We were faced with the opportunity to share our vulnerability and sadness with our close friends and loved ones by asking for help. Dakota spent all of his gas money getting the windows of his car fixed so he could drive back across the country safely. He is on track to make it just in time for our next show in St. Louis on December 20th. But without his bass and our mics, we may be playing an acoustic show.


What We Need


For the time being, we need to get back on our feet and to do so we need to raise $1100 to replace Dakota's bass and all 5 of our microphones and cords that were stolen. We need to keep the heartbeat of Medicine Web pumpin' so booties can keep shakin' through the darkest time of year!

We are determined to keep our spirits up to allow the musical medicine to continue flowing through us. This experience is likely to produce more juicy tunes, but with such a new project we haven’t even gotten a chance to record the music we’ve written so far. We need to raise money to replace the equipment that was stolen so that we can play our scheduled shows in the next two months and show up with some semblance of professionalism so as to raise money to do these recordings.

This is where you come in. If you can help us with even a small donation, we will not only be forever grateful but you’ll be the first to receive a download code for our first recordings... or other awesome perks. Check 'em out!


What We Learned


This is where we humble ourselves to our naivety. We learned some things the hard way. If we are going to continue on as traveling musicians we need to invest in a more secure vehicle without so many windows, buy a safe, bring our instruments inside whenever possible, get insurance on our property and be more careful and aware in general.


Visions for the Future


We have big dreams... and we believe in them. Our plan so far has been to save up money to record our first 14 songs (written in the three months of knowing each other!), do a small spring tour down the west coast to seed our project in the Cascadian mind, then sell our cars and buy a (safe and secure) touring rig so that we can hit the road in June and weave the Medicine Web around the country. We have a lot of re-configuring to do with our musical equipment and somehow fit the recording of an album in there along the way. We are fools on this path, but fiercely determined and believing 100% in this music as our powerful and purposeful offering to the better health and wellness of the world.


Our larger vision entails bringing the intention of musical medicine gatherings all over the world (or participating in existing ones in line with our values), assembling multi-modal healing spaces with a focus of sharing music including folk song circle-singing inspired by Singing Alive. We want to see people gathering worldwide to connect and lift each other up through the sharing of healing touch, natural remedies, art, activism, empowerment projects, permaculture projects and overall weaving the web of medicines that we all are. Ultimately we hope to be the stewards of land and a community that nurtures and develops this culture of medicine weaving. We are aimed at supporting a system of living that works for 100% of humanity and 100% of all other life on Earth. May it be so.


Blessings and thank you for reading our plight and dreams in this ever-weaving wonder of life <3

story:
My idea

I am a music producer, and i love both ASMR and Music, so i thought, why not  combine them?
I aim to create relaxing music based on ASMR elements such as clicking sounds, whispers, and much more.
The video is an example of what is to come. It absolutely does not have the same quality that my future projects will have, since i do not yet have a binaural microphone:

What i need

I need a binaural microphone to create my own ASMR sounds to have in my songs.
With it, i will be able to create custom high quality sounds to use in my songs
It costs 500$, which is why i've made this fundraiser.

story:
Short Summary
I am an MC with a love of conscious rap, from Auckland city, who makes positive art.  I try to learn and grow through the process.  I want to share what I'm learning with you all.  I've been rapping seriously for 13 years and I released my first studio project (an EP) in 2009/2010.  I've released an album in 2014 and two EP's last year (in 2015).  Everything I do comes straight from the heart and I only try to help people, including myself, with my art.

I'm trying to presell album t-shirts and CD EP's here in this project.  It's a simple dream, just trying to pursue music as a fun thing and as a side vocation.  This is important to me as I believe I have something unique to say and people will relate to my work.
   
If you contribute, you will help me make more art for you.  This is something I love doing and I hope you, the people, love hearing, thank you for your support.  It's not easy being an artist in 2016 but I muck in, and muck through things to bring you my best efforts so you can vibe with me.  I need to do music to get through, and I hope you guys can see the value in that.


What We Need & What You Get - The Breakdown:
If I get the first 170 bucks down that is the first 25 CD's pressed, probably 50 bucks will go on preprint preparation, any further money will go into paying for the last of the mastering for this project and beats and recording time for the new album.  This is really the gift that keeps on giving.  Any t-shirts ordered will be printed on demand, these will be 'Bodhichitta EP' album art t-shirts in white.

My unique perks are that I will smile every time someone supports this, I'm really only in it for the art and to live.  I have no desire to buy a mansion or anything like that.  I just want the art to reach the people it needs to reach.

If I don't reach my entire goal I will still get the tees and CD's pressed, it may just take me a little while longer to do it.

The Impact
My project is valuable as a contribution to my life as an artist, and to the world.  The aim is to help people vibe and feel cool, something I feel is very important in today's sometimes intense times.  This is positive, insightful music, and as such it hopes to help you when you listen to it, like it helps me to create it.
   
I possess a successful track record with projects like this.  Everyone who paid for Esoligh merch or CD's etc in the past has got what they paid for, and some just got sent stuff for free because I was feeling generous :).  All previous EP's and my LP have been shipped and sold to a number of people of different walks of life and it was a really positive mutually beneficial experience.

Risks & Challenges
Obstacles are simply funding and everything else I will take in my stride :).

I succeeded in delivering all previous orders and pledges with honesty and aplomb.  I don’t expect anything for free, and this shows through in how I run my music as fun business.  Everybody gets paid who needs to and everyone who trusts and supports me receives their goods.

My plan for solving these challenges is to work hard and make it happen!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute but you still want to help, please help me get the word out about this project, let some potentially interested people know about my campaign!  This is a positive energetic movement.  Just trying to help move the world forward.

Use the Indiegogo share tools if you like!

story:
Since 2013 I have been collecting keys that were no longer needed or wanted, perhaps keys to things that don't work or don't exist anymore, or keys that had been found: any number and size/shape, as long as they were no longer needed or wanted. More than 20 people donated over 300 keys to the project. 


Keys are so symbolic - of possession, freedom, privacy, safety, power and oppression. Everyone who gave me keys had stories to tell about the keys they were donating. Some belonged to an old car or an old house. Some had been found in new houses and some belonged to buildings or objects that no longer exist. Everyone who donated keys had held on to these precious objects even though they were no longer useful, because of the memories they contained and in some cases because they felt it would have been wasteful to throw them away. I am so grateful for all the donations and stories that have helped to form this project. 


I am currently in the process of recording the keys, used as percussion instruments with digital processing. The resulting recorded composition will be in two parts, and will be launched early in 2016. 


This campaign is for pre sales of 100 copies of a 7" vinyl (with digital download) containing the completed Precious composition.

Support of this campaign will also include a free ticket to the launch of this project, at a venue in Melbourne in February 2016. 


(A short preview track from the early stages of the composition may be heard here: https://hearthis.at/natgrantmusic/key-demo/)

story:
Business First Renegotiated: 

Business First Renegotiated is the next project by singer and rapper L.Euro to produce and bring real music for real people

I’m L.Euro, a singer and rapper, and, as someone who truly loves music and rhythm as an art of universal communication of thoughts and principles, I am excited to be on my way to launching my next project – “Business First Renegotiated”.

I’m really going for a powerful and meaningful beat here. I want to rap the change with music that is a mix of art, inspiration and purpose, made to entertain my listeners so that they can dance and enjoy the changing power that my music is intended to have in their lives.

You know, while I believe that obviously everyone is entitled to enjoy whatever kind of music they like, it is no secret that our days are full of poorly composed and produced music, with a tendency for massive hits to be massively promoted by major record companies with too easy and repetitive beats, pointless lyrics and spiritless sounds, all based on mega-visual-video-productions which distract and impress more than they make people feel the true flavor of music with a soul. Anyway, if you like that is great and I certainly do not see that as problem.

However, if you really enjoy original, thought-provoking and dance-igniting powerful music made and sung by someone who loves creating it as much as you love to enjoy it, then we not only share the same taste and culture – we share the same goal.

So I invite you to please help me to produce and distribute my music, to produce my music videos, and to handle the costs with press, promotion and management, so that I can organize everything to be on tour, hopefully soon bringing my flow to a place near you.

Please take a look at my rewards to see how you can have early access to my music while powering my project, and please share this campaign page with those you know who may also be interested in supporting and enjoying real music for real people.

Thank you and I hope to be singing and dancing with you and all the project’s supporters real soon!

story: Hi everyone! It's been over four years since I've brought you anything new, and I'm excited to finally be able to do so. On this new EP my band and I have recorded four new tracks for YOU, our fans! I hope that you will help us fund this project, and join us at our EP Realease show on December 11th at the Isis Music Hall!

story:
Enemy AC130 Above Full Length Album

It's been a long time since I've made music for AC130. The last track I released was 4 years ago back in 2012. Since then I still get people emailing and messaging me almost every day asking when there will be new music. I put AC130 on hold so I could focus on my full band (Burn It To The Ground) but I feel that the time is right to give you guys what you want. For the past few months I've been planning and working on a full length AC130 album. I had originally planned to record and mix everything myself with all of my old gear just like I usually did back in the day. But I think you guys deserve better than that and I want to make this album sound better than anything I've released previously. In order to do that I'm going to need your help. I'm going to be putting all my effort into making this album sound incredible for you. In the album reveal video above you can hear a demo clip of a song that will be on the album. At the bottom of the page you can check out some of my old songs. I hope the teaser clip gets you guys excited for the full album!

What Your Funding Will Be Used For

As I stated before, I want this album to sound as good as it possibly can. In order to do that I'm going to need access to better gear than I have now. I don't want to skimp out on any aspect. If I end up exceeding my funding goal I'd also like to get some guests on the album as well as a few other extras. Every cent of funding will be used to make this album sound as perfect as it can possibly be. 

How you can help

If you don't have the cash to pre order and still want help out, you can share this on facebook, twitter, instagram, or any other social media outlet. Every share counts and will help me get closer to reaching my goal. I can't do this without you guys and anything you can do to help out would be greatly appreciated. 

Regarding Shirt Sizes

If you purchase one of the shirt packages please be sure to message me directly with what size of shirt you need.




Physical Disk


White AC130 Shirt


Black AC130 Shirt

story:
Treehouse Sanctum is making a new album?  

Yes...yes we are.  And its awesome.

In fact, we need your help to finish it and to ensure it gets the publicity it deserves.  Like a Boston fan on gameday, we are wicked stoked to share these sonorous grooves with you and want you to be a part of the process as we prepare to release it.   Check the video for a sneak peek at aforementioned grooves!

Last year we released the single, Pilot & Crew, and it was played on radio stations from LA to London.   From that release we were invited to join Mumford & Sons, and The Flaming Lips last Fall and encouraged to record more.  We have our sophomore album fully tracked and edited.  We've paid for everything to this point but now we need your help to cover some of the final costs surrounding mixing, mastering and marketing.   

We're not your needy girlfriend, but with your partnership we will get this album finished in no time.  All of the heavy lifting is done.  We're almost there and every little bit helps.  So spread the word, tell a stranger or a friend.  Post it on your MySpace page.

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down for you fine folks as to what we need, where the funds will go and what you get in return for being our partners in this!

Where the funding will go:

  • $1650 to finish mixing
  • $750 to Master the album so it is radio / placement ready
  • $350 for video artwork to help push our first single on the album
  • $700 Artwork & Packaging 
  • All remaining funds, and any over the goal amount to go toward working with a publicist to help get our music in front of music industry professionals that can push this out to a broader audience.
What you get:
  • So many perks!!!  From T-shirts, to silk screened posters designed by our very own lead guitarist & graphic design wizard, Jeremy Gleason; to house concerts and being our VIP at a show.  Heck, join the band for a song on stage if you know the song!  There's more, check out the perks section.
  • Got an idea for a perk?  Send it to us while the campaign is in process and if its in our wheelhouse, we'll add it!

The Impact

We had a very successful crowdfunding campaign to help us finish our first album, Shake the Shadow.  We've built on the success of that album and expanded our band into the current lineup of five virtuosos plus Sam.   The new album is more rock n roll than our debut while still focusing on harmonies and groovy rhythms.  We love making music and remaining independent.  Without label oversight we can truly make music that is focused on a sound we've honed; one that keeps the music 2 legit to quit.  

We will be focusing on music placement with this new album.  We've learned a lot since our first release and have partnered with several placement agencies, radio programs and publicists to help our music get out to a broader audience.

Challenges

Being an indie band means we rely on our fans as much as ourselves. 

All of the tracking (recording), editing and most of the mixing is complete.  The remaining pieces are finalizing the mixes and then sending it over to be Mastered, pressed and packaged.

Up next on our list of to do's or challenges are finalizing album name, cover art, and packaging options.  Additionally we are working with Publicists in NY & LA to send these songs out for ad / film placement consideration.  The music industry is rapidly morphing and we are excited at all the doors opening up for us.  This is happening!

As Gene Kranz said, failure is not an option.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us get the word out.  
  • Share this campaign link on you social media. 
  • Tell your coworkers, your favorite barista, that guy standing behind you. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

WE LOVE YOU LONG TIME!
story_txt:
Treehouse Sanctum is making a new album?  
Yes...yes we are.  And its awesome.

In fact, we need your help to finish it and to ensure it gets the publicity it deserves.  Like a Boston fan on gameday, we are wicked stoked to share these sonorous grooves with you and want you to be a part of the process as we prepare to release it.   Check the video for a sneak peek at aforementioned grooves!

Last year we released the single, Pilot & Crew, and it was played on radio stations from LA to London.   From that release we were invited to join Mumford & Sons, and The Flaming Lips last Fall and encouraged to record more.  We have our sophomore album fully tracked and edited.  We've paid for everything to this point but now we need your help to cover some of the final costs surrounding mixing, mastering and marketing.   
We're not your needy girlfriend, but with your partnership we will get this album finished in no time.  All of the heavy lifting is done.  We're almost there and every little bit helps.  So spread the word, tell a stranger or a friend.  Post it on your MySpace page.
   What We Need & What You Get Breaking it down for you fine folks as to what we need, where the funds will go and what you get in return for being our partners in this!
Where the funding will go:  $1650 to finish mixing
$750 to Master the album so it is radio / placement ready
$350 for video artwork to help push our first single on the album
$700 Artwork & Packaging 
All remaining funds, and any over the goal amount to go toward working with a publicist to help get our music in front of music industry professionals that can push this out to a broader audience.
What you get:
So many perks!!!  From T-shirts, to silk screened posters designed by our very own lead guitarist & graphic design wizard, Jeremy Gleason; to house concerts and being our VIP at a show.  Heck, join the band for a song on stage if you know the song!  There's more, check out the perks section.
Got an idea for a perk?  Send it to us while the campaign is in process and if its in our wheelhouse, we'll add it!
   The Impact We had a very successful crowdfunding campaign to help us finish our first album, Shake the Shadow.  We've built on the success of that album and expanded our band into the current lineup of five virtuosos plus Sam.   The new album is more rock n roll than our debut while still focusing on harmonies and groovy rhythms.  We love making music and remaining independent.  Without label oversight we can truly make music that is focused on a sound we've honed; one that keeps the music 2 legit to quit.  
We will be focusing on music placement with this new album.  We've learned a lot since our first release and have partnered with several placement agencies, radio programs and publicists to help our music get out to a broader audience.

    Challenges Being an indie band means we rely on our fans as much as ourselves. 
All of the tracking (recording), editing and most of the mixing is complete.  The remaining pieces are finalizing the mixes and then sending it over to be Mastered, pressed and packaged.
Up next on our list of to do's or challenges are finalizing album name, cover art, and packaging options.  Additionally we are working with Publicists in NY & LA to send these songs out for ad / film placement consideration.  The music industry is rapidly morphing and we are excited at all the doors opening up for us.  This is happening!
As Gene Kranz said, failure is not an option.  
    Other Ways You Can Help We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Help us get the word out.  
Share this campaign link on you social media. 
Tell your coworkers, your favorite barista, that guy standing behind you.  Use the Indiegogo share tools!   WE LOVE YOU LONG TIME!

story:
Chers vous,
qui m'aiderez peut-être, sachez que ...

C'est toujours difficile en tant qu'artiste de financer l'enregistrement de son propre EP (mini-album) sans avoir accès à une bourse. Bien souvent, il nous faut une carte de visite (des enregistrements de bonne qualité, photos, sites etc ...) pour que l'on s'intéresse à nous lors des inscriptions dans les concours, ou lorsqu'on veut être sélectionné(e) dans un festival ou autres. 

C'est toujours difficile de demeurer intègre et motivé(e) dans notre création, lorsqu'on fait de la musique un peu moins accessible aux oreilles des gens qui s'accoutument à ce que l'on entend à la radio. 

C'est toujours difficile de demander à un(e) réalisateur(trice), à un(e) technicien(ne) de son et à des musiciens, de travailler pour notre projet sans argent à leur promettre, sans rien à leur offrir, mis à part la passion qui nous tient chacun en vie. 
Même scénario pour les photos et le graphisme du dit projet ... 

C'est toujours difficile de faire dupliquer son EP alors qu'on a même pas eu de budget pour les étapes précédentes.

Pourtant l'artiste ne veut pas faire d'argent avec son EP, il veut simplement le faire écouter, et le partager. En fait, la plupart des artistes émergents qui s'auto-financent veulent se rembourser pour que leur EP ne leur coûte rien au final. 

Humblement, je vous demande une aide financière. J'entre en studio du 27 juin au 1er juillet et j'estime avoir besoin de 4500 $ pour financer mon EP de 5 chansons. Je vais offrir le téléchargement gratuit de celui-ci à tous les donateurs !

Détails:

- Location du studio (250$)
- Technicien de son (750$) 
- Réalisateur (750$) 
- Musiciens (1000$)  
- Mixage (500$)
- Matriçage (300$)
- Photos (200$)
- Graphisme (200 $)
- Duplication du EP (500 $)

Équipe du projet:

Francis Major (Prise de son)
Guillaume Guilbault (Réalisation)
Mandela Coupal-Dalgleish (Batterie)
Étienne Dupré (Basse)
Mathieu Bérubé (Guitare)
Élyze Venne-Deshaies (Clarinette)

Merci infiniment de votre soutien !
Mélanie

story:
Who Are We?

We are Duo van Vliet, and we take our name from Don van Vliet, more commonly known by his avant-garde rock persona Captain Beefheart. We aim to preserve and honour his love of experimentation and genre-mashing.

More specifically, we are Ian Anderson (Scottish viola) and Rafał Łuc (Polish accordion). We met while studying at the Royal Academy of Music, London, forming Duo van Vliet in 2011. Our love of interesting programming and contemporary music brought us together as a duo, and is the driving force behind this album: we want to present interesting, themed music from across the centuries together, from the very old to the very new. (Short individual biographies at bottom of page.)

How Can You Help Us?

We are asking for you to contribute to an incredibly important moment in our development as a duo: the release and launch of our first studio album. Being able to release it will have a massive impact on our future ability to attract audience, receive invitations to perform at festivals, and to commission composers to write for us.

We have recorded all the tracks, had photos taken for the artwork by photographer Bartek Sadowski (Vladimir Ashkenazy, Lukas Podolski), and found a fantastic label in Orchid Classics (Brodsky Quartet, Jennifer Stumm). We now need to raise £1500 to cover production costs of the album (both physical and digital), the PR campaign (including getting reviews placed in national publications), and the album launch recital in London.

Any money raised over our £1500 target will go towards commissioning composers in the future.

Listen to 3 of the tracks on our Soundcloud page: https://soundcloud.com/duovanvliet

The album is based around Britten’s Lachrymae, which in turn is based on the two Dowland songs on our album: If My Complaints Should Passions Move and Flow My Tears. This theme of tears is then extended through Rory Boyle’s Such Sweet Sorrow for viola solo, while the other tracks on the album by Adam Porebski, Gavin Higgins and Toshio Hosokawa were then chosen to compliment and add shape to the disk. (Full track listing at bottom of page.)

Is That It?

No! This album is just the beginning: working with Orchid Classics will raise our profile and allow us to reach more of an audience, in turn allowing us more recitals. We will then build our profile and funds so we are able to commission more and more composers to write new and fascinating works for us. We have many bold plans for the future, and we need your help to take the first steps.

____________________________________

Ian Anderson holds the position of Principal Viola with Scottish Ballet, and regularly appears with IMOGEN (Berlin-based chamber music collective) and the London Contemporary Orchestra. He writes and plays rhythm guitar for new alt-rock band yllwshrk, who will release their first single in July, and their first EP in August.

Rafał Łuc has been described as “the perfect accordionist” (Krzysztof B. Marciniak) and “a phenomenal experience” (Jeremy Summerly). In 2015 he released his first solo album of music for solo accordion and electronics, entitled acc++ca. Along with solo work, he performs with ensembles such as London Sinfonietta, Aurora Orchestra, Britten Sinfonia and CHROMA.

____________________________________

Full track listing:

Dowland, John (1563-1626): If My Complaints Should Passions Move

Britten, Benjamin (1913-1976): Lachrymae

Adam Porębski (b.1990): ReVerse 2* (winner of 2013 National Composition Competition Poznan, Poland)

Rory Boyle (b.1951): Such Sweet Sorrow for solo viola*

Gavin Higgins (b.1983): Kathedrale for solo accordion*

Toshio Hosokawa (b.1955): Into the Depths of Time

Dowland, John (1563-1626): Flow My Tears

* Duo van Vliet commission

story:
- T-Shirt for the price of hamburger? Really?
- That's right. He we go!

Worldwide shipping

This is a NONPROFIT EVENT for everyone worldwide who like metal, rock, punk music or anything else, that's not considered as or referred to pop music. Just one day for us. Together as one :)

I do my best and want to do something useful and big for our subculture. I'm not a millionaire and can't pay for promotion, so please, support it, I know you can, because it doesn't require much to do that but it's very helpful.

HELLo!

Let me introduce myself. My name is Anton and I live and breathe music since I could remember myself. Thanks to my Dad for bringing Deep Purple into my life. And then the story began. Now I listen to many bands of various genres from jazz to death metal, collect CDs, go to concerts. And now my Dad discovers the new bands to him with my help. He's 53 and it's great to see him listening to black metal. So a few weeks ago I came up with an idea: why won't we gather on some day, no matter what age, to show unity of people, for whom rock, metal, punk music and other sub-genres mean more than just a fashion or pop culture.


The idea is simple:

23-07-2016

You pull an ANTIPOP DAY t-shirt, go out in your city (bar, club, concert, etc), meet each other (t-shirt will help it), talk about music, future plans, recollect the past, drink beer or just enjoy the summer Saturday evening.

LET'S ROCK THIS DAY AND HAVE FUN!


Gifts:

To warm up I would offer to find out who's crazier about music, posting photos under hashtag #antipop from concerts, hangouts or something esle associated with music and you. The top 5 photos with largest number of likes, shares, retweets from Instagram, Twitter, Facebook will get a free t-shirt. Deadline is on 31st May.

So it's time to prepare some special gifts. After ANTIPOP DAY, we're posting aftermath photos under hashtag #antipopday and on 30th July we'll find out who have hung out more than others on that day. And 3 persons will get free concert tickets in their city or nearby.


Costs:

1) I found a printing company in Vilnius, Lithuania. They will print 1000 t-shirts for as low as 3,6€ http://www.pirum.lt/lang_en/pradzia.html

It will be a high quality black 100% cotton t-shirt with a printed logo.

For men: Stedman ST2100 model (185 g/m²)

For women: Stedman ST2600 model (155 g/m²)

http://www.stedman.eu/index.php?lang=en#products

2) Masterplan font license from Billy Argel costs about 30€ http://www.billyargel.com/st/masterplan-font.html

3) 15 free t-shirts to give away are 54€

4) 3 concert tickets for the best ANTIPOPers will cost about 150€


To sum up, 3,6*1000+30+54+150=3834€

+10% Indiegogo and PayPal fees and https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/204456408-Fees-Pricing

finally, it will be 3834/0,90=4260€ or 4,26€ for a single t-shirt

as a contribution amount should be rounded, so I added 0,69€ package costs to round it to 5€


Shipping rates will be calculated depending on your country (~250 gr) http://post.lt/en/help/price-calculator/parcels + package is 0,69€ (it's already included in a perk amount) + 10% Indiegogo and PayPal fees. Shipping rates should be also rounded, according to Indiegogo rules.

I can ship a t-shirt with Standard cheaper option without tracking (on your responsibility) or Registered with a track number.

The item will be shipped from Lithuania (as the price is very low, so I guess you won't be charged with any customs fees, but if you're outside European Union, so better check it out).


Contacts and links:

Facebook event page (let's discuss it and your suggestions are appreciated) https://www.facebook.com/events/1563868537268118

to contact me: https://www.facebook.com/antonratkevich

Twitter: https://twitter.com/ANTIPOPDAY

Main countdown to event: http://www.antipopday.com


P.S.

As so this is a NONPROFIT EVENT and I do it just for passion. If you feel that it's an interesting idea, so SUPPORT EVENT, get the word out, share it or invite your friends. Your support matters more than you think! Thanks a lot for that.

Take care of yourself and Long Live ANTIPOP DAY!!!


Note!!! T-shirt size chart you may find here http://www.stedman.eu/out/media/pdf/Stedman-ST9...

story:
Greeting and Summary

Hello, friends! If you are receiving the link for my new Indiegogo campaign, that means I consider you a true supporter of my musical endeavors. As of now we don't plan to take this campaign to Social Media and are going to keep it email list based. Most of you have known me quite a while as the Blues Rocking troubadour from Santa Barbara, CA. Others of you know me as the guitarist for the Alan Parsons Live Project. 

My Indiegogo campaign is going to help fund my next studio record in addition to acting as a Pre-Sale for the new album.  It's important for me to get a new studio album out in the next 6 months to keep the Alastair Greene Band ball rolling down the tracks. The last CD, 'Trouble At Your Door', was very successful as far as reviews, radio play, and raising our profile as a Blues Rock band to be reckoned with are concerned.  It definitely got us on the Blues Rock map and also helped secure a booking agent, which is huge step for us. 

Our next studio record is going to be another important part of our trajectory as an act, and we need to make sure we pull out all the stops on this one. This will be the most important album yet as far as keeping our forward momentum going strong! 

What We Need & What You Get

As most of you know by now, making a record involves a lot of steps. I am going  to raise $10,000 to cover recording, mixing, and mastering costs and potentially some promotional costs. The process includes the following steps:  

Step 1: Recording at Coyote Road Studios with Sean McCue as engineer. Sean recorded out last CD and did a fantastic job. We're thrilled to get back in the studio with him! 
Step 2: The record will be produced and mixed by David Z. We're SUPER excited to have David on board as he has produced so many great Blues and Rock records. David mixed our last CD, and it was a great experience working with him. 
Steps 3, 4, & 5: The music will then need to be mastered, CD art will need be created, and then the CD needs to be pressed up! We are hoping to secure another distribution/promotion deal with a record company with this effort. As you may remember, our last CD, 'Trouble at Your Door', came out on Eclectic Groove Records. This will be my 5th studio CD under my name, and I'm confident I can get everything done with this funding goal.
 We are making the perks packages very simple, yet creative. Higher donation levels include a HUGE THANK YOU in the liner notes for the CD. Those folks will also be getting to hear some of the demos I've recorded (before or after you donate) and I will be posting pictures and videos for donors during the recording process. The entry level donations get you a signed copy (or multiple copies) of the new CD when it's complete. 
Any and all of the funds we raise will be going to our goal, even in the event that we come up short. 

The Impact

Your contribution will obviously mean a lot to the band and me. I also want it to mean a lot to you and give you a great feeling knowing you've helped and continue to help an artist who is hell bent on saving the world with 6 strings and a hunk of wood.

Each album I've put out has topped the previous one and has continued to help to elevate our status as a band as well as my own personal status as a guitar-slinger, singer, and songwriter. We are confident this trajectory will continue with the new album. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks for completing this project are slim to none. Of course, if NO funds are raised, then we'll have to kick the can down the road a little while longer, but we are going to make this record, ladies and gentlemen! There is always a risk that scheduling can prevent a recording from being released in a timely fashion. I have endeavored to find blocks of time that we can record and get this project done. I anticipate recording sessions to take place at the end of May. We also have blocks of time reserved in late June and late July. We are going to make this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

We ask that you DO NOT share this on social media or via large email lists. HOWEVER, if you do have a friend you think would be interested in getting on board feel free to forward this information on.

Pre-Sale CDs will still be available after the 'fundraising portion' deadline for our  campaign ends. Hit me up if you have any questions!

Most of you have known me quite a while as the Blues Rocking troubadour from Santa Barbara, CA. Others of you know me as the guitarist for the Alan Parsons Live Project. 


My Indiegogo campaign is going to help fund my next studio record in addition to acting as a Pre-Sale for the new album.  It's important for me to get a new studio album out in the next 6 months to keep the Alastair Greene Band ball rolling down the tracks. The last CD, 'Trouble At Your Door', was very successful as far as reviews, radio play, and raising our profile as a Blues Rock band to be reckoned with are concerned.  It definitely got us on the Blues Rock map and also helped secure a booking agent, which is huge step for us. 

Our next studio record is going to be another important part of our trajectory as an act, and we need to make sure we pull out all the stops on this one. This will be the most important album yet as far as keeping our forward momentum going strong! 
What We Need & What You Get
As most of you know by now, making a record involves a lot of steps. I am going  to raise $10,000 to cover recording, mixing, and mastering costs and potentially some promotional costs. The process includes the following steps:  
Step 1: Recording at Coyote Road Studios with Sean McCue as engineer. Sean recorded out last CD and did a fantastic job. We're thrilled to get back in the studio with him! Step 2: The record will be produced and mixed by David Z. We're SUPER excited to have David on board as he has produced so many great Blues and Rock records. David mixed our last CD, and it was a great experience working with him. Steps 3, 4, & 5: The music will then need to be mastered, CD art will need be created, and then the CD needs to be pressed up! We are hoping to secure another distribution/promotion deal with a record company with this effort. As you may remember, our last CD, 'Trouble at Your Door', came out on Eclectic Groove Records. This will be my 5th studio CD under my name, and I'm confident I can get everything done with this funding goal. We are making the perks packages very simple, yet creative. Higher donation levels include a HUGE THANK YOU in the liner notes for the CD. Those folks will also be getting to hear some of the demos I've recorded (before or after you donate) and I will be posting pictures and videos for donors during the recording process. The entry level donations get you a signed copy (or multiple copies) of the new CD when it's complete. Any and all of the funds we raise will be going to our goal, even in the event that we come up short.    The Impact
Your contribution will obviously mean a lot to the band and me. I also want it to mean a lot to you and give you a great feeling knowing you've helped and continue to help an artist who is hell bent on saving the world with 6 strings and a hunk of wood.
Each album I've put out has topped the previous one and has continued to help to elevate our status as a band as well as my own personal status as a guitar-slinger, singer, and songwriter. We are confident this trajectory will continue with the new album.    Risks & Challenges
The risks for completing this project are slim to none. Of course, if NO funds are raised, then we'll have to kick the can down the road a little while longer, but we are going to make this record, ladies and gentlemen! There is always a risk that scheduling can prevent a recording from being released in a timely fashion. I have endeavored to find blocks of time that we can record and get this project done. I anticipate recording sessions to take place at the end of May. We also have blocks of time reserved in late June and late July. We are going to make this happen!   Other Ways You Can Help
We ask that you DO NOT share this on social media or via large email lists. HOWEVER, if you do have a friend you think would be interested in getting on board feel free to forward this information on.
Pre-Sale CDs will still be available after the 'fundraising portion' deadline for our  campaign ends. Hit me up if you have any questions!

story:
Welcome to our Live Album Indiegogo Campaign!

We are so excited to announce that we're recording our first live album!

We’ve been singing songs to lift spirits and soothe souls in churches, coffeehouses, festivals and conventions for over a decade now. Our music is spiritual without being sectarian, coming from folk, gospel, bluegrass and roots traditions. We try to sing thoughtful, encouraging songs that will make people feel a little better after hearing us than they did before.

Lately, we've been writing and performing more and more original music. Now, after recording four albums of mostly other people’s music, we'll be making an album of original songs, and we’re going to record it live! YAY! Seth Connelly, who recorded all our other CDs in his studio in New Hampshire, will come to our Rochester NY home to perform with us and record it all live. We'll be joined by Perry Cleaveland on mandolin and fiddle. We hope to have the new album available for release in November 2016.

The cost for us to record, mix, master and produce the album, along with artwork, manufacturing, shipping, promotion and all the little details that go into making a CD comes to $7,800. And that's where you come in! As independent musicians who usually play small venues for modest fees, we find the upfront costs of producing a new album a big obstacle! Indiegogo helps dreams  become realities by giving fans and friends opportunities to support independent musicians and receive some cool benefits (and good karma!) in return.

We’ve put together some packages of incentives including CDs, original artwork, chances to attend recording sessions and CD release concerts, a house concert in your home, or a customized song recorded just for you! We hope you'll check out our perks and consider supporting the production of our live album. Whatever you can do will be a big help to us! If this isn’t a good time for you to contribute, please help us spread the word about our campaign!

Thank you so much for your encouragement and support!

Love,
Leslie and Steve
leslieandsteve.com

story:
The above video is "Let It Breathe", a X.ado original performed at "Break It Down Boston" at MIT on April 16th, and one we will record and include on our CD.

Thank you for choosing to support X.ado in our CD Recording and Giving project!

X.ado's purpose and mission is "To Sing For Christ", and we make lasting memories by singing for various audiences around then world--sharing Christ's love through song. But what if we could leave something more substantial with every audience, so that they could continue to be inspired and encouraged even after we're done performing? This is our vision in recording a CD. We want to be able to keep the hope of Christ ringing in the ears of our audiences, as well as give them a special physical gift to share with others.

Every dollar of this donation will go towards the project: $500 for further recording, $1,000 for mixing/finalizing, and $1,000 for raw material.

We realize this is an ambitious amount to ask from our already extremely generous supporters. However, this project is of utmost importance in our mission as an a cappella group. Many groups on campus record albums, and we as members of the body of Christ are especially responsible for spreading His love continuously through a more permanent embodiment of our music.

Thank you again for your support: through praying, donating, or sharing this project with others. Feel free to reach out to us at xado@dartmouth.edu.

In Christ's Love,

X.ado

April 2016

https://www.facebook.com/DartmouthX.ado/?fref=ts

story:
:: para ler em PORTUGUÊS click aqui::       ::para leer en CASTELLAÑO click aqui ::

> about TEMPLE TREE

TEMPLE TREE is an offering, a prayer, a collection of songs that my antennas picked up from the great spirit radio, that got in tune with inspiration from all the guest musician friends.

All the 21 songs in this double album are prayers. To love, to nature, to the elements, the divine, the force, to gods and goddesses, healing sounds for the future generations. Some are very old mantras that got to me in a particular vibration.

It is being recorded since spring 2015 in rishikesh (in), pushkar (in), barcelona (cat), london (uk), santa cruz (ca, usa), porto (pt) & aljezur (pt). Most of it is already done. There are songs in portuguese, spanish, english, sanscrit, punjabi and some words in other languages (hindi, lakota, wirarika, kichua, mapuche…).

Now is the time for the MIXING, the MASTERING and the PRINTING of TEMPLE TREE to take place. This CROWD FUND has been set up with the intention of collecting SUPPORT to help pay for the final stages of this independent production. The goal is to have the work ready and printed to send under the crescent moon of July, in this year 2016. TEMPLE TREE will be made out of 2 CDs: TEMPLE and TREE.

In this new moon of April, a renowned moon for planting healthy seeds,I open this call for support to this sung prayer in the form of a music double album, so it can spread its vibration into the 4 corners of this land in these times of turbulence and transformation. 

I plant this TEMPLE TREE seed in the sacred ground calling in for your support, 

& the permission of the sacred fire & the 7 directions.

Blessed be (y)our way,

Grateful,

m*


> about the guest musicians + the recordings + packaging

It's an honor to have such a special guest list of talented people on the record, from such a wide range of places and variety of skills.

I want to thank each and every one of you once more: for your talents, time and readiness to participate in this project.

Binod Kahtuwal (np), Dav Prasad Singh (in/uk), Faruk Suleman (in), Denise Gitalí (br), Gui Mendonça (br), Netti Kumar(in), Jess Hendricks (us), Jitendra (ar), Juani Naum (ar), Junior (pt), Kaled Mohamed (eg), Karen Lugo (mx), Mariana Root (pt), Marcus Rocha (br), Massimo Carbon i(it), Othon Mataragas (gr/uk), Pedro Colares (br), Prem Sudeva (it), Prem Supria (br), Suria(be), Tiago Rochinol (pt), Vinod Devera (in), Herbert Quiteros (pr), Sebastian Garcia Ferro (ar), Francisca Cortesão (pt), Juan Miró (cat), Lyla June Johnston (usa)… and maybe more ;)

I am very grateful to Massimo Carboni for his time, advice and guidance, and for lending the top quality tools with which most of the album was recorded. Once again, thank you.

The graphic design has been co-created by the super creative and fun Saulius Leudovicus and me. There will be drawings, photos, texts and surprises on this double album's three-panel eco-package.

> about music + me + TEMPLE TREE

My name is Mariana, I was born in Portugal and I've been singing since before I started talking. As there is a musical predisposition in my blood family I also studied music when I was young.

Through my life I've discovered and explored singing as my main way of offering and connecting to the divine force. I've been listening and singing in different sacred circles, from tipis to malocas, from vision quest to sat sang halls, around the world for a while.

In different circumstances, after listening to me live, people have come up to me and asked how could they listen to my songs again, and that was the reason why I decided to record a first album, “Roda dos Ventos”. After 3 years of more singing and new songs that is also on of the main reasons that makes me want to release this second one, TEMPLE TREE, into the wild ;)

As my heart family is around different places of this planet, the Internet is a good vehicle to spread the word and the news about this TEMPLE TREE.

And with a “little help from my friends” as the Beatles say, it makes it more magical and easier to manifest.

> about TEMPLE TREE Numbers and the CROWD FUND

MIXING 21 tracks, 250 euros per day at the studio, 7 to 14 days = 1750 to 3500

MASTERING around 50 euros per track x 21 tracks = 1050 euros

PRINTING of 1000 copies of a double album (2 CDs in eco-packaging, with booklet)  = around 2500 

Total: somewhere between 5300 to 7050 euros

> about the ways YOU can participate

> choose a perk that suits you from the choices above

> if your not on paypal or into internet money exchange, let me know by e-mail, fb, whatsapp, phone or over a tea, we will find a way; I will save a fresh album specially for you.

> propose a nice exchange for the album (massage, therapy, your music, organic veggies, a nice meal… you name it)

> tell your friends, share this campaign on your wall’s


Português

> sobre TEMPLE TREE

TEMPLE TREE é uma oferenda, uma oração, uma colecção de cantos que as minhas antenas sintonizaram da rádio do grande espírito, que se harmonizaram com a inspiração d@s amig@s músic@s convidad@s. 

Cada uma das 21 músicas neste álbum é uma oração. Ao amor, à natureza, aos elementos, ao divino, à força, às deusas e deuses, sons de cura. Algumas são mantras muito antigos que me chegaram numa determinada vibração.

Está a ser gravado desde a Primavera de 2015 em Rishikesh (in), Pushkar (in), Barcelona (cat), Londres (uk), Santa Cruz (ca, usa), Porto (pt) & Aljezur (pt). A maior parte das gravações já foi feita. Há músicas em português, castelhano, inglês, sânscrito, punjabi e também há palavras em hindi, lakota, wirarika, kichua, mapuche...

Agora é o tempo de fazer a MISTURA, o MASTER e a IMPRESSÃO de TEMPLE TREE acontecer.

Este CROWD FUND está a ser lançado com a intenção de recolher APOIO para ajudar a pagar estes gastos.

É uma produção independente. O objectivo é ter o trabalho pronto e impresso para enviar na lua crescente de Julho deste ano de 2016. TEMPLE TREE será composto por  2 cd´s TEMPLE e TREE.

Nesta lua nova de Abril, conhecida por ser boa para semear,

faço este  chamamento de apoio a esta oração cantada na forma de àlbum duplo,

para que possa espalhar a sua vibração aos 4 cantos desta Terra, nestes tempos de turbulência e transformação.

Semeio este TEMPLE TREE em solo sagrado, convocando o vosso apoio,

e pedindo licença ao fogo sagrado e às 7 direcções.

Bênçãos no nosso caminhar,

grata,

m*

> sobre @s músic@s convidad@s + as gravações + a embalagem

É uma honra contar com uma lista tão especial de gente talentosa, de tantos lugares diferentes.

Agradeço uma vez mais a cada um@: pelos dons, pelo tempo e disponibilidade para participar neste projecto.

Binod Kahtuwal (np), Dav Prasad Singh (in/uk), Faruk Suleman (in), Denise Gitalí (br), Gui Mendonça (br), Netti Kumar(in), Jess Hendricks (us), Jitendra (ar), Juani Naum (ar), Junior (pt), Kaled Mohamed (eg), Karen Lugo (mx), Mariana Root (pt), Marcus Rocha (br), Massimo Carbon i(it), Othon Mataragas (gr/uk), Pedro Colares (br), Prem Sudeva (it), Prem Supria (br), Suria(be), Tiago Rochinol (pt), Vinod Devera (in),Herbert Quiteros (pr), Sebastian Garcia Ferro (ar), Francisca Cortesão (pt), Juan Miró (cat), Lyla June Johnston (usa)… e talvez mais ;)

Muito agradecida ao Massimo Carboni, pela sua ajuda, o seu tempo, conselhos e por me ter emprestado as suas ferramentas topo de gama que gravaram quase tudo. Outra vez, grata.

O desenho gráfico está a ser feito entre o criativo e divertido  Saulius Leudovicus(lt) e eu. Haverá desenhos, fotos, textos e surpresas no tríptico-capa deste álbum duplo.

> sobre música + eu + TEMPLE TREE

Chamo-me Mariana e nasci em Portugal. Comecei a cantar antes de saber falar. Há uma tendência musical na família e estudei música quando era pequena. Durante a vida, fui descobrindo e explorando o canto, como a maneira principal de me conectar ao sagrado. Há bastantes anos que em vários lugares do planeta, tenho ouvido cantar e tenho cantado em diferentes círculos sagrados, de tipis a malocas, de temascais e buscas de visão a salões e sat sangs.

Depois de me ouvir ao vivo, várias pessoas me perguntam como podem ter acesso à minha música. Essa foi a razão que me fez gravar um álbum “Roda dos Ventos” em 2013. Três anos mais de cantares e cantos fazem-me querer lançar TEMPLE TREE.

Sendo que a família de coração está repartida pelo planeta, a internet é um bom veículo para espalhar as boas novas sobre TEMPLE TREE.  E com ajuda tudo se torna mais mágico e fácil de materializar. 

> sobre os números de TEMPLE TREE e este Crowd Fund

MISTURA  de 21 temas, 250 euros por dia em estúdio. 7 a 14 dias = 1750 a 3500 euros

MASTER à volta de 50euros por tema x 21 temas = 1050 euros

IMPRESSÃO de 1000 cópias de um àlbum duplo ( 2 cd´s numa capa especial em papel ecológico)  = cerca de 2500 

Total:  à roda de 5300 a 7050

> sobre as formas em que TU podes participar

> escolhe um "perk" que te ecoe das várias hipóteses oferecidas

> se não tens nem queres ter paypal, avisa-me por fb, whatapp, mail, telefone, sms, à mesa, e encontramos outra maneira; eu guardo um album para ti.

> propõe uma troca interessante (massagem, terapia, a tua música, vegetais da horta…)

> diz aos teus amig@s e divulga esta campanha no teu mural...
Castellano

> sobre TEMPLE TREE

TEMPLE TREE es una ofrenda, un rezo, una colección de cantos que mis antenas sintonizaran de la rádio del grand espirito, y que se harmonisaran con la inspiracion de l@s amig@s músic@s convidad@s. 

Cada una de las 21 musicas en este album es un reso. Al amor, à la naturaleza, à los elementos, al divino, a la fuerza, à las diosas e dioses, sonidos de cura. Algunas son mantras mui antiguos que me han llegado en una determinada freqüência.

Está siendo gravado desde la primavera de 2015 en Rishikesh (in), Pushkar (in), Barcelona (cat), Londres (uk), Santa Cruz (ca, usa), Porto (pt) & Aljezur (pt). La maioria ya estan hechas. Hay musicas en português, castelhano, inglês, sancrito, punjabi e também palabras en hindi, lakota, wirarika, kichua, mapuche...

Ahora es el tiempo de hacer que la MIXTURA, el MASTER e la IMPRESSION de TEMPLE TREE acontesca.

Este CROWD FUND esta siendo lansado com la intención de angariar el APOIO para ayudar a pagar estos gastos.

Es una producion independente. El objetivo es tener el trabajo pronto e impresso para enviar bajo la  lua crescente de julio deste ano de 2016.

TEMPLE TREE será compuesto por  2 cd´s TEMPLE y TREE.

Em esta  luna nueva de Abril, conocida por ser buena de siembra,

hago este llamado de apoyo a este rezo cantado en forma de album duplo,

para que pueda compartir su vibración a los 4 rincones de esta tierra, en estos tiempos de turbulencia e transformación.

sembro TEMPLE TREE em suelo sagrado, haciendo un llamando a vuestro apoyo,

e pediendo permiso al fuego sagrado e a las 7 direcciones.

bendiciones en nuestro caminhar,

gratitude,

m*

>  sobre l@s music@s convidad@s + las grabaciones + e el envase

Es un honor tener una lista tan especial de gente talentosa de tantos lugares diferentes.

Agradecer una vez mas a cada un@: por sus dones, su tiempo e su disponibilidad para participar de este projecto.

Binod Kahtuwal (np), Dav Prasad Singh (in/uk), Faruk Suleman (in), Denise Gitalí (br), Gui Mendonça (br), Netti Kumar(in), Jess Hendricks (us), Jitendra (ar), Juani Naum (ar), Junior (pt), Kaled Mohamed (eg), Karen Lugo (mx), Mariana Root (pt), Marcus Rocha (br), Massimo Carbon i(it), Othon Mataragas (gr/uk), Pedro Colares (br), Prem Sudeva (it), Prem Supria (br), Suria(be), Tiago Rochinol (pt), Vinod Devera (in), Herbert Quiteros (pr), Sebastian Garcia Ferro (ar), Francisca Cortesão (pt), Juan Miró (cat), Lyla June Johnston (usa) … e talvez mas ;)

Grazie tantissimo a Massimo Carboni, por su ayuda, su tiempo, concejos, e por prestar sus herramientas de alta qualidade que grabaran casi todo. Uma vez mas, muchas gracias.

El diseño gráfico lo estamos haceindo entre el criativo e divertido Saulius Leudovicus(lt) e yo. Habrán dibujos, fotos, textos e surpresas en el triptico-capa deste album duplo.

> sobre musica + yo + TEMPLE TREE

Me llamo Mariana e nasci en Portugal e creo que empece a cantar antes de hablar. 

Hay una tendência musical em mi família e estudei musica de pequeña. Durante la vida fui descobriendo y explorando cantar como la manera principal de me conectar a la fuerza divina. Hace tiempo que  al rededor del planeta escucho e canto en distintos circulos sagrados. De tipis a malocas, de temascales de busca de vision a salones e sat sangs.

Em distintas circunstancias depuse de haver escuchado cantar la gente me preguntava como tener acesso a mis cantos e de ai salió el “roda dos ventos” em 2013, ahora 3 años después de cantar e de muchos cantos nuevos esta sigue siendo una de las razones para soltar TEMPLE TREE así al universo.

Como la familia de corazón está por distintas partes de est@ planeta, el internet es um buen medio para lanzar el llamado y compartir las noticias de TEMPLE TREE.  E com el apoyo de la comunidade se torna mas magico e mas fácil de manifestar.

> sobre los numeros de TEMPLE TREE y este Crowd Fund

MISTURA  de 21 temas, 250 euros por dia en studio. 7 a 14 dias = 1750 a 3500 euros

MASTER al rededor de 50 euros por tema x 21 temas = 1050 euros

IMPRESION de 1000 copias  de un album duplo ( 2 cd´s en capa especial en papel ecológico)  = around 2500 euros

Total : algo entre  5300 a 7050 euros

> sobre las formas en que TU puedes participar

> elige un "perk" que te vaya bien de las  várias hipótesis oferecidas

> se não tienes, nem queires tener paypal, o pagar por internet,  avisa me por FB, whatapp, mail, telefone, sms.  Encontraremos la maneira, e yo te guardo uno expecialmente para ti.

> propone un intercambio interessante (massage, terapia, tu musica, verduras de la horta…)

> di le a tus amig@s y difunde esta campaña en tu muro.
