Binod Kahtuwal (np), Dav Prasad Singh (in/uk), Faruk Suleman (in), Denise Gitalí (br), Gui Mendonça (br), Netti Kumar(in), Jess Hendricks (us), Jitendra (ar), Juani Naum (ar), Junior (pt), Kaled Mohamed (eg), Karen Lugo (mx), Mariana Root (pt), Marcus Rocha (br), Massimo Carbon i(it), Othon Mataragas (gr/uk), Pedro Colares (br), Prem Sudeva (it), Prem Supria (br), Suria(be), Tiago Rochinol (pt), Vinod Devera (in), Herbert Quiteros (pr), Sebastian Garcia Ferro (ar), Francisca Cortesão (pt), Juan Miró (cat), Lyla June Johnston (usa)… and maybe more ;)


I am very grateful to Massimo Carboni for his time, advice and guidance, and for lending the top quality tools with which most of the album was recorded. Once again, thank you.
The graphic design has been co-created by the super creative and fun Saulius Leudovicus and me. There will be drawings, photos, texts and surprises on this double album's three-panel eco-package.
> about music + me + TEMPLE TREE
My name is Mariana, I was born in Portugal and I've been singing since before I started talking. As there is a musical predisposition in my blood family I also studied music when I was young.
Through my life I've discovered and explored singing as my main way of offering and connecting to the divine force. I've been listening and singing in different sacred circles, from tipis to malocas, from vision quest to sat sang halls, around the world for a while.
In different circumstances, after listening to me live, people have come up to me and asked how could they listen to my songs again, and that was the reason why I decided to record a first album, “Roda dos Ventos”. After 3 years of more singing and new songs that is also on of the main reasons that makes me want to release this second one, TEMPLE TREE, into the wild ;)
As my heart family is around different places of this planet, the Internet is a good vehicle to spread the word and the news about this TEMPLE TREE.
And with a “little help from my friends” as the Beatles say, it makes it more magical and easier to manifest.
> about TEMPLE TREE Numbers and the CROWD FUND
MIXING 21 tracks, 250 euros per day at the studio, 7 to 14 days = 1750 to 3500
MASTERING around 50 euros per track x 21 tracks = 1050 euros
PRINTING of 1000 copies of a double album (2 CDs in eco-packaging, with booklet)  = around 2500 
Total: somewhere between 5300 to 7050 euros
> about the ways YOU can participate
> choose a perk that suits you from the choices above
> if your not on paypal or into internet money exchange, let me know by e-mail, fb, whatsapp, phone or over a tea, we will find a way; I will save a fresh album specially for you.
> propose a nice exchange for the album (massage, therapy, your music, organic veggies, a nice meal… you name it)
> tell your friends, share this campaign on your wall’s


Português
> sobre TEMPLE TREE
TEMPLE TREE é uma oferenda, uma oração, uma colecção de cantos que as minhas antenas sintonizaram da rádio do grande espírito, que se harmonizaram com a inspiração d@s amig@s músic@s convidad@s. 
Cada uma das 21 músicas neste álbum é uma oração. Ao amor, à natureza, aos elementos, ao divino, à força, às deusas e deuses, sons de cura. Algumas são mantras muito antigos que me chegaram numa determinada vibração.
Está a ser gravado desde a Primavera de 2015 em Rishikesh (in), Pushkar (in), Barcelona (cat), Londres (uk), Santa Cruz (ca, usa), Porto (pt) & Aljezur (pt). A maior parte das gravações já foi feita. Há músicas em português, castelhano, inglês, sânscrito, punjabi e também há palavras em hindi, lakota, wirarika, kichua, mapuche...
Agora é o tempo de fazer a MISTURA, o MASTER e a IMPRESSÃO de TEMPLE TREE acontecer.
Este CROWD FUND está a ser lançado com a intenção de recolher APOIO para ajudar a pagar estes gastos.
É uma produção independente. O objectivo é ter o trabalho pronto e impresso para enviar na lua crescente de Julho deste ano de 2016. TEMPLE TREE será composto por  2 cd´s TEMPLE e TREE.
Nesta lua nova de Abril, conhecida por ser boa para semear,
faço este  chamamento de apoio a esta oração cantada na forma de àlbum duplo,
para que possa espalhar a sua vibração aos 4 cantos desta Terra, nestes tempos de turbulência e transformação.
Semeio este TEMPLE TREE em solo sagrado, convocando o vosso apoio,
e pedindo licença ao fogo sagrado e às 7 direcções.
Bênçãos no nosso caminhar,
grata,
m*
> sobre @s músic@s convidad@s + as gravações + a embalagem
É uma honra contar com uma lista tão especial de gente talentosa, de tantos lugares diferentes.
Agradeço uma vez mais a cada um@: pelos dons, pelo tempo e disponibilidade para participar neste projecto.
Binod Kahtuwal (np), Dav Prasad Singh (in/uk), Faruk Suleman (in), Denise Gitalí (br), Gui Mendonça (br), Netti Kumar(in), Jess Hendricks (us), Jitendra (ar), Juani Naum (ar), Junior (pt), Kaled Mohamed (eg), Karen Lugo (mx), Mariana Root (pt), Marcus Rocha (br), Massimo Carbon i(it), Othon Mataragas (gr/uk), Pedro Colares (br), Prem Sudeva (it), Prem Supria (br), Suria(be), Tiago Rochinol (pt), Vinod Devera (in),Herbert Quiteros (pr), Sebastian Garcia Ferro (ar), Francisca Cortesão (pt), Juan Miró (cat), Lyla June Johnston (usa)… e talvez mais ;)
Muito agradecida ao Massimo Carboni, pela sua ajuda, o seu tempo, conselhos e por me ter emprestado as suas ferramentas topo de gama que gravaram quase tudo. Outra vez, grata.
O desenho gráfico está a ser feito entre o criativo e divertido  Saulius Leudovicus(lt) e eu. Haverá desenhos, fotos, textos e surpresas no tríptico-capa deste álbum duplo.
> sobre música + eu + TEMPLE TREE
Chamo-me Mariana e nasci em Portugal. Comecei a cantar antes de saber falar. Há uma tendência musical na família e estudei música quando era pequena. Durante a vida, fui descobrindo e explorando o canto, como a maneira principal de me conectar ao sagrado. Há bastantes anos que em vários lugares do planeta, tenho ouvido cantar e tenho cantado em diferentes círculos sagrados, de tipis a malocas, de temascais e buscas de visão a salões e sat sangs.
Depois de me ouvir ao vivo, várias pessoas me perguntam como podem ter acesso à minha música. Essa foi a razão que me fez gravar um álbum “Roda dos Ventos” em 2013. Três anos mais de cantares e cantos fazem-me querer lançar TEMPLE TREE.
Sendo que a família de coração está repartida pelo planeta, a internet é um bom veículo para espalhar as boas novas sobre TEMPLE TREE.  E com ajuda tudo se torna mais mágico e fácil de materializar. 
> sobre os números de TEMPLE TREE e este Crowd Fund
MISTURA  de 21 temas, 250 euros por dia em estúdio. 7 a 14 dias = 1750 a 3500 euros
MASTER à volta de 50euros por tema x 21 temas = 1050 euros
IMPRESSÃO de 1000 cópias de um àlbum duplo ( 2 cd´s numa capa especial em papel ecológico)  = cerca de 2500 
Total:  à roda de 5300 a 7050
> sobre as formas em que TU podes participar
> escolhe um "perk" que te ecoe das várias hipóteses oferecidas
> se não tens nem queres ter paypal, avisa-me por fb, whatapp, mail, telefone, sms, à mesa, e encontramos outra maneira; eu guardo um album para ti.
> propõe uma troca interessante (massagem, terapia, a tua música, vegetais da horta…)
> diz aos teus amig@s e divulga esta campanha no teu mural...




Castellano

> sobre TEMPLE TREE
TEMPLE TREE es una ofrenda, un rezo, una colección de cantos que mis antenas sintonizaran de la rádio del grand espirito, y que se harmonisaran con la inspiracion de l@s amig@s músic@s convidad@s. 
Cada una de las 21 musicas en este album es un reso. Al amor, à la naturaleza, à los elementos, al divino, a la fuerza, à las diosas e dioses, sonidos de cura. Algunas son mantras mui antiguos que me han llegado en una determinada freqüência.
Está siendo gravado desde la primavera de 2015 en Rishikesh (in), Pushkar (in), Barcelona (cat), Londres (uk), Santa Cruz (ca, usa), Porto (pt) & Aljezur (pt). La maioria ya estan hechas. Hay musicas en português, castelhano, inglês, sancrito, punjabi e também palabras en hindi, lakota, wirarika, kichua, mapuche...
Ahora es el tiempo de hacer que la MIXTURA, el MASTER e la IMPRESSION de TEMPLE TREE acontesca.
Este CROWD FUND esta siendo lansado com la intención de angariar el APOIO para ayudar a pagar estos gastos.
Es una producion independente. El objetivo es tener el trabajo pronto e impresso para enviar bajo la  lua crescente de julio deste ano de 2016.
TEMPLE TREE será compuesto por  2 cd´s TEMPLE y TREE.
Em esta  luna nueva de Abril, conocida por ser buena de siembra,
hago este llamado de apoyo a este rezo cantado en forma de album duplo,
para que pueda compartir su vibración a los 4 rincones de esta tierra, en estos tiempos de turbulencia e transformación.
sembro TEMPLE TREE em suelo sagrado, haciendo un llamando a vuestro apoyo,
e pediendo permiso al fuego sagrado e a las 7 direcciones.
bendiciones en nuestro caminhar,
gratitude,
m*
>  sobre l@s music@s convidad@s + las grabaciones + e el envase
Es un honor tener una lista tan especial de gente talentosa de tantos lugares diferentes.
Agradecer una vez mas a cada un@: por sus dones, su tiempo e su disponibilidad para participar de este projecto.
Binod Kahtuwal (np), Dav Prasad Singh (in/uk), Faruk Suleman (in), Denise Gitalí (br), Gui Mendonça (br), Netti Kumar(in), Jess Hendricks (us), Jitendra (ar), Juani Naum (ar), Junior (pt), Kaled Mohamed (eg), Karen Lugo (mx), Mariana Root (pt), Marcus Rocha (br), Massimo Carbon i(it), Othon Mataragas (gr/uk), Pedro Colares (br), Prem Sudeva (it), Prem Supria (br), Suria(be), Tiago Rochinol (pt), Vinod Devera (in), Herbert Quiteros (pr), Sebastian Garcia Ferro (ar), Francisca Cortesão (pt), Juan Miró (cat), Lyla June Johnston (usa) … e talvez mas ;)
Grazie tantissimo a Massimo Carboni, por su ayuda, su tiempo, concejos, e por prestar sus herramientas de alta qualidade que grabaran casi todo. Uma vez mas, muchas gracias.
El diseño gráfico lo estamos haceindo entre el criativo e divertido Saulius Leudovicus(lt) e yo. Habrán dibujos, fotos, textos e surpresas en el triptico-capa deste album duplo.
> sobre musica + yo + TEMPLE TREE
Me llamo Mariana e nasci en Portugal e creo que empece a cantar antes de hablar. 
Hay una tendência musical em mi família e estudei musica de pequeña. Durante la vida fui descobriendo y explorando cantar como la manera principal de me conectar a la fuerza divina. Hace tiempo que  al rededor del planeta escucho e canto en distintos circulos sagrados. De tipis a malocas, de temascales de busca de vision a salones e sat sangs.
Em distintas circunstancias depuse de haver escuchado cantar la gente me preguntava como tener acesso a mis cantos e de ai salió el “roda dos ventos” em 2013, ahora 3 años después de cantar e de muchos cantos nuevos esta sigue siendo una de las razones para soltar TEMPLE TREE así al universo.
Como la familia de corazón está por distintas partes de est@ planeta, el internet es um buen medio para lanzar el llamado y compartir las noticias de TEMPLE TREE.  E com el apoyo de la comunidade se torna mas magico e mas fácil de manifestar.
> sobre los numeros de TEMPLE TREE y este Crowd Fund
MISTURA  de 21 temas, 250 euros por dia en studio. 7 a 14 dias = 1750 a 3500 euros
MASTER al rededor de 50 euros por tema x 21 temas = 1050 euros
IMPRESION de 1000 copias  de un album duplo ( 2 cd´s en capa especial en papel ecológico)  = around 2500 euros
Total : algo entre  5300 a 7050 euros
> sobre las formas en que TU puedes participar
> elige un "perk" que te vaya bien de las  várias hipótesis oferecidas
> se não tienes, nem queires tener paypal, o pagar por internet,  avisa me por FB, whatapp, mail, telefone, sms.  Encontraremos la maneira, e yo te guardo uno expecialmente para ti.
> propone un intercambio interessante (massage, terapia, tu musica, verduras de la horta…)
> di le a tus amig@s y difunde esta campaña en tu muro.

story:
About This Project

I’m a little person (5’2) with a big vision - to change peoples' minds about what is important in life through great music, books and videos. I own a little indie studio called Featherhead Media, and the Change My Mind full-length CD and book are the first out in a series of inspirational materials that are planned. http://www.featherheadmedia.com/

The idea behind Change My Mind: you can listen to it just to be entertained - the songs are beautifully positive and flowing- but there is a deep message in the album for those who want to receive it. And this is the message:

“Although there are many things that are important in life, perhaps one of the most important is knowing that you are unconditionally loved by someone. When you know that your worth comes from being loved and not by what you do, you are secure and happy.”

So, get that love, whatever it takes, no matter what. It is there and it’s available to you. This album shows a way to listen to your heart and come home to unconditional love.The 12 songs take you on a journey from a person who protests the status quo that causes stress and starts listening to her hungry heart to a place where she finally rests in an unconditional love from above. 

Change My Mind will encourage you in these ways:

- By helping you dust off your talents and get them going - no matter how young or old you are. If I can do it, you can do it too! 

- By hitting you with some powerful lyrics that will lift your eyes up out of your situation and help you focus on the solution

- By pointing the way to an unconditional love that is available to us all, every one. This will have a tremendous impact on everything you think or do in a positive way.

And by giving you positive and dance-friendly original music from my heart to yours.

About the Change My Mind Album:

Change My Mind will take you on a journey from a stressful life to one based on unconditional love. You will find a “smorgasbord”, (Swedish word for a table full of all sorts of great dishes) of country, pop, rock, and gospel, and ballads on this album - all with a flow that soothes the soul. We will release the album digitally during 2017. If we reach our goal, we will print physical CD:s as well.

About the Change My Mind Book

The book will give some practical tips on how to deal with stress, on how to listen to your inner man and how to take steps to see yourself through the eyes of unconditional love. The idea is to create an e-book but, if we raise enough funds we will print physical copies.

About the Change My Mind Music Videos:

I am almost completely done with three music videos from the Change My Mind CD, (to get see these videos before they go public is an important part of the perks). The music videos are to the songs Just How Good (Psalm 23) filmed in a sheep pasture; Don’t Worry (John 14) filmed by a lake and Come to Me (Mathew 11)filmed by the ocean.

About me:

             

Born in New York, living in Southern Sweden, I started songwriting when I was ten and toured with a band in the greater New York area in my teens, singing and playing guitar, flute and banjo. I was in an elite choir in high school and was offered a Scholarship at a music college when my dad put his foot down and said I should do something else - anything else, that would “bring in the money”. So, I gave up and chose another path than music and lost faith in my musical abilities for years. But I kept on singing and songwriting….. Back then you couldn't record your own album the way you can today - but the new technologies available today have made Change My Mind possible.

I am the songwriter, producer, singer, multi-musician and the "glue" for this CD. But without the “band” I could never have gotten this done.

About the “Band”:

We aren’t really a band, but a project made up of 10 musicians/soloists from three different countries. Because of their expertise, Change My Mind is evolving into a beautiful patchwork of different genres with a professional sound.

Per G Imsen - a humble man, gifted pianist and audio engineer who is not only a great musician but a great friend. Albin Ekman - probably the best fiddle player in Sweden and he is VERY tall - over 2 metres! Johan Malmberg - banjo, member of the Original Five, an amazing bluegrass band from Malmoe. Jesper Nordberg: A mere 19 yrs. old and already a PRO at the bass, Jesper is addicted to coffee but who isn’t these days… Anna Löwenmark - the beautiful and powerful solo singer of the Gospel track  “Every Day” has a powerfully positive personality and this shines through the whole song. Rebecka Wendesten hopped in over a night and hit up the solo on the song “Don’t Worry” just right in a few takes. Very few can do that and do it so well. I stand amazed. Marko Jelaca is the versatile jazz drummer playing hip hop, rock and country beats on three tracks.  (His first album, where he played the drums and produced it, won him an award for best jazz album of the year in Spain). Dan Holmström has a way with the saxophone that fits my style perfectly. He, too, is a professional jazz artist and is always doing a concert somewhere soon. P O Larson: dobro, has his own production company in the Northern part of Sweden his solo on the song Those Eyes is magic, simply magic. And then there is me, Elisabeth Kitzing: song, background vocals, guitars, loops, keyboards, mixing, flute and percussions.

Our Needs & Your Rewards

Why is this campaign important? This campaign is to help us get the necessary funds to do the mixing, mastering and digital distribution of the CD and to proofread, set and publish the book(e-book format). This is our primary goal. The more funds we get in the better and the faster it goes. And... the world needs more unconditional love!

If we exceed out goal we will be able to print physical copies of the book and/or CD. Selling them will, in turn, give us some funds to start doing the next album. It’s all up to you how far this goes! 

Cost Breakdown for the Change My Mind Project 

Here is the breakdown of the costs in a diagram form: and this can be obtained through email. Just drop me a line! This covers it in detail.

How your Help is needed & Why YOU are the most important part of this project:

Social media: Tell the world about the Change My Mind project by using the share tools on the Indiegogo page! Share it on Twitter, send the song or poster you get in the perk to a friend along with a link to the campaign. Post it on Facebook. Call and tell your in-laws….use you imagination!

It’s through YOU that the world gets to know about this great project. If you share this with all your friends and they share with all their friends and so on, this will go viral and the chances of reaching our goal increase dramatically. This is the most important part of your support.

The “fuzzy love effect”: Knowing that you support me and believe in us is a great feeling!  It makes me all warm inside and keeps me going! Every encouraging email, every like on Facebook, every time you share the campaign with your friends, relatives … I get soaked in “fuzz”. 

Your financial help will make it possible for us to save valuable time and get this done more professionally than we are able to without you! Prayers are always welcome!

What’s in it for You?

Perks: You get great tools and great music. You even get to see some beautiful and inspiring videos before they go public, depending on the level of your giving. You can get a weapon against stress, The first aid pdf, art and more! check out the various levels and choose the one that fits you! Why not give away a donation as a present to someone you love? 

Fuzz: Helping me & the project forward fills you with “fuzz” (that great feeling that you support a worthy cause, are loving on someone and/or being loved back).

About the Perks

The perks compliment the CD and book and give you a foretaste of what's coming. The perks we offer here work like this: the more you give, the more you get. And they get better and better for every category. 

All we need is that 150 people give us $50 each (or 50 people who give $150) and we’d be home with the total amount. This is doable. And the $50 perk is an amazing bundle. So don’t hesitate to chose that one!

We have digital downloads of instrumental tracks, inspirational posters and previews of music videos among other things. And the Change My Mind First Aid Kit is something you don’t want to miss. It is my #1 method against stress, my strategic weapon of choice when my boat rocks and the pressure is on. (It will be an appendix to the book, Change My Mind coming out next year). We even offer original artwork mailed directly to the ones who give a little more. (And those guys get all the perks available as well when they choose the Artsy Perk!).

Donate

If you want to donate, but don't want anything in return you can do so on the Featherhead Media home page: http://www.featherheadmedia.com Just go to the donate button. Just let me know if you have any problems with that button…..we can work it out another way in that case.

Risks: 

- Lack of funding - will not stop this project, but only postpone it. 

- Loss of digital material - nope, won't happen - I have three secured backups in various places.

Challenges: 

I am in the process of preparing all the necessary music and other data: artwork, music tracks, updating the homepage, Sound Cloud, ReverbNation, Twitter and YouTube regularly. I do this pretty much alone as all indie artists do. I am doing the mixing and I love it. But all of this takes a lot of time and requires long hours of sitting by the computer as it is. 

Finally, I want to say one big “THANK YOU!” for caring, liking, sharing, and giving to this project!  AND, I want to remind you that I don’t love you less if you don’t do a thing. 

It’s all about unconditional love! 

Lets go!

- Elisabeth Kitzing

Every encouraging email, every like on Facebook, every time you share the campaign with your friends, relatives … I get soaked in “fuzz”. Your financial help will make it possible for us to save valuable time and get this done more professionally than we are able to without you! Prayers are always welcome!What’s in it for You?Perks: You get great tools and great music. You even get to see some beautiful and inspiring videos before they go public, depending on the level of your giving. You can get a weapon against stress, The first aid pdf, art and more! check out the various levels and choose the one that fits you! Why not give away a donation as a present to someone you love? Fuzz: Helping me & the project forward fills you with “fuzz” (that great feeling that you support a worthy cause, are loving on someone and/or being loved back).About the PerksThe perks compliment the CD and book and give you a foretaste of what's coming. The perks we offer here work like this: the more you give, the more you get. And they get better and better for every category. All we need is that 150 people give us $50 each (or 50 people who give $150) and we’d be home with the total amount. This is doable. And the $50 perk is an amazing bundle. So don’t hesitate to chose that one!We have digital downloads of instrumental tracks, inspirational posters and previews of music videos among other things. And the Change My Mind First Aid Kit is something you don’t want to miss. It is my #1 method against stress, my strategic weapon of choice when my boat rocks and the pressure is on. (It will be an appendix to the book, Change My Mind coming out next year). We even offer original artwork mailed directly to the ones who give a little more. (And those guys get all the perks available as well when they choose the Artsy Perk!).DonateIf you want to donate, but don't want anything in return you can do so on the Featherhead Media home page: http://www.featherheadmedia.com Just go to the donate button. Just let me know if you have any problems with that button…..we can work it out another way in that case.Risks: - Lack of funding - will not stop this project, but only postpone it. - Loss of digital material - nope, won't happen - I have three secured backups in various places.Challenges: I am in the process of preparing all the necessary music and other data: artwork, music tracks, updating the homepage, Sound Cloud, ReverbNation, Twitter and YouTube regularly. I do this pretty much alone as all indie artists do. I am doing the mixing and I love it. But all of this takes a lot of time and requires long hours of sitting by the computer as it is. Finally, I want to say one big “THANK YOU!” for caring, liking, sharing, and giving to this project!  AND, I want to remind you that I don’t love you less if you don’t do a thing. It’s all about unconditional love! Lets go!- Elisabeth Kitzing

story:
Part of the BIGGER picture.

 

I am currently recording a new EP with 37 Records (Los Angeles) and I need your help!
  • Part of the BIGGER picture is a campaign to raise the funds for the production of my new EP with 37 Records (Los Angeles). 
  • I wanted to create more than just a crowdfunding campaign, I wanted to create a simple, and unique way that you could be involved in an integral part of the project. 
Your picture(s) will become a part of the mosaic that creates my album art, while your contributions will become the reason I am able to release it. 

 

Who am I?

If you've stumble across this page, then you probably already know me; But, on the off chance that you don't, I'd like to introduce myself. 

My name is Joey Clarkson, and I am a singer/songwriter from Vancouver Island, Canada. When I'm not writing, recording and touring my music in Canada/USA/Europe: I can be found teaching choral/songwriting workshops for the Wild heart Music program on North Vancouver Island, and musical theatre workshops through my own company in towns throughout Canada and as far away as the UAE, to hundreds of children and youth. I volunteer for various charities on a regular basis - giving back is a priority, and a huge part of my life. 

Part of the BIGGER picture (continued)

This will be my first release since 2013, and in a way: I feel like it is really the first release that will accurately represent me as an artist. I couldn't feel more emotionally ready or excited to share it with you!

This EP is comprised of songs from the heart - exploring the dynamics of different relationships, and the experiences and feelings that are a result of those relationships. Working with Steven McClintock and Kevin Fisher to bring these songs to life, we have created an intricate collection that is both relatable and honest. Their support and belief in this project means the world to me. 

I have never been more proud of a something before in my life. Every time I think about what we are doing as a team, I feel like I am going to burst. It's like I just fallen in love with music, all over again, and I want to scream it to the world.

About Steven and Kevin:

Steven McClintock is a Los Angeles based singer/songwriter, and a music producer with a handful of top 40 hit songs under his belt. Steven has recorded two solo albums, and he won a BMI Songwriter Award for Tiffany's Billboard Hot 100 #6 hit "All This Time". 

Kevin Fisher is a multi-platinum selling songwriter. Rascal Flatts, Sara Evans, Uncle Kracker and many others have recorded his songs. As an artist himself, and a writer for others, his songs are being played all over the world. 

Steven and Kevin are currently working as a co-producers on my upcoming album

The Perks:

The perks involved in this campaign are all based around the concept of your photograph being a part of the album art for the EP. 

They start at $25 for the basic contribution, to have your photo included in the Mosaic, and move up in price to include other cool things like:

  • Official Poster
  • Thank you in the liner notes
  • Listed as an official sponsor
  • Listed as an executive producer
  • Private Concerts 

They make GREAT gifts, and are truly a unique way to contribute to a musical project!
 

$10,000 - The Break Down.

$10,000 is enough to cover approximately 80% the Studio, Musician, Producer, Mixing and Mastering fees for this project. Please see below for a full breakdown of the expected costs for the entire project, including our stretch goals. 
 
$10,000 is enough to get the ball rolling, so we have a project that is ready to pitch and promote for a release in the late spring of 2017.
 
If we are lucky enough to exceed this goal, we have a stretch goal of $13,400. This would pay for all of the studio, musician, producer, mixing and mastering fees, including the fees incurred using Indiegogo as a fundraising platform.

If we manage to exceed our first stretch goal, we have a DREAM GOAL of $35,000. This number would greatly help to cover costs that will be associated with the planned promotion and preparation surrounding this project's release.
 
Why $35,000, you ask? 
 

$35,000 - The Break Down.

This scares me.

When I look at it, it seems like such a huge number. Because it is. 

The scariest part is being able to break it down and know that it is actually the bare minimum of what we need to release this project, properly. 

  • Studio Fees - $4400
  • Musician Fees - $5000
  • Mixing/Mastering - $1200
  • Production - $1800
  • Travel - $1500
  • 3 Months of Radio Promotion to Canadian radio for 2 singles - $8000
  • Canadian RADIO TOUR fund x2 - $2000
  • Album Photo shoot - $1000
  • Music Videos - $3500
  • CD/Cassette/Vinyl Printing - $4000
  • Indiegogo admin/payment fees - $2600
 
If we do not reach this, or any of our targeted goals: All funds raised will still be put directly towards the production of this project, and we will be exploring alternative methods of funding. This project is my life, and we are prepared to do whatever it takes to make this happen. 

    One last thing...

    To put it simply: your contributions will actually give this release a fighting chance. 

    Your contributions will be the lifeboat in the current sea of sexism, body shaming, low paying streaming websites and declining physical sales that we currently call the music industry. They will be the boat that gives this EP the chance it deserves for survival. I am ready to work my butt off to stay above the water, but I can't do it alone. I need your help!

    In Closing.

    If you've made it this far, I want to thank you for taking the time out of your day to read about this project. Your time and consideration is the greatest gift that you can give an artist like myself, and if that is all you have to give: I want you to know that it is appreciated. Don't ever let your financial standing make you feel like you are not important, or crucial to the success of project like this.

    Thank you for taking the time to read this. Thank you for taking the time to listen to my music. Thank you for taking the time to spread the word! 

    Your support means more than I could ever possibly express.

story:
Summary

Hi hi hello! We're Ship of Fools, a Baton Rouge band trying to get ourselves all the way up the East coast this summer and play a ton of shows along the way. We're made up of pop/r&b vocalist Ashley Monaghan, folk guitarist Michael Blunt, classically trained cellist Raudol Palacios, and jazz drummer Eric Brown. 

Our eclectic sound is currently unsigned and independent, so we are booking the entire tour ourselves #stress

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $8,000 to take us on tour and to help us direct + produce a music video for our single, "Bells," a song featured on our very first EP releasing this May! 

$2,000 will go towards the video—paying for set, props and costumes, the team, food and accommodations for the team, location fees, editing and promotional/PR services. It is going to be a dark, beautiful music video shot like a short film on the grounds of rural Covington. 

The other $6,000 will go towards the tour—paying for the design and production of merchandise for you (some of which will be given away free, like patches/stickers/pins!), gas, the vehicle to take us up the East coast, any food or airb&bs we have to rent in cities where we don't know a soul, and more. 

Risks & Challenges

Going on tour is, honestly, terrifying. Since we are doing this all on our own, there are many risks that go along with it. We've heard so many horror stories—your gear being stolen, car troubles, etc. We're taking the risk even if we don't get the funding we need, but having a cushion of cash would help comfort us as we embark on this journey. You can get us to New York and we are not only humbled, but honored to have your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, sharing this campaign, telling your friends, listening to our music, buying our merch or attending our shows is great help! We so appreciate you taking the time to learn more about us and our challenge. 

Have a great day!

story:
Short Summary

Between equipment for performing, studio time, travel, and merchandise there are many things we can use to bolster our growing enterprise. Support for this campaign will provide us with the tools to accompany our artistic vision. Essentially, you get to help make the music happen!

How Does This Help You?

Crvscxnt Moon cares about our community. There are plenty of philanthropic goals that accompany our music and art. Joining our campaign and movement in general reinforces our accomplishments and grows our fanbase. We will use our growth to solidify relationships with larger artists and companies, which in turn will lead to bigger and better events culminating in a bigger and brighter future. Helping high schoolers find financial aid for higher education, developing events for minority communities, and protecting the rights of immigrant citizens are just some of the issues we hold near and dear to our hearts. 

Our Risks & Challenges 

In 2015 we went to L.A. to perform in the YouBloom Music Festival. Not only were there performing and networking opportunities, but invaluable advice came from the conferences held that weekend. Gurus and super producers like Daryl Swann, Matt Linsky, and Tom Sturges shared invaluable information in a city that hosts many movers and shakers. We took it upon ourselves to provide travel and board (they were unable to fly us out due to distance) expenses that exceeded well over 2,000.00. 
Despite the large amount of money, we were performing in the festival of a lifetime. The stage experience and new fans were a true blessing. We could do more shows like these with the growing opportunities surrounding us, if we could just find the most important parts of the journey.

Finding new ways to market and promote ourselves will always pose new challenges. Crvscxnt Moon is constantly striving to put our music in front of the best, and most influential figures in the music, photography, and film industry. 

The best way to ensure that our art is spread is by using to social media to share what we've made to friends, family, and aspiring artists everywhere. 

What We Need 

There are many ways to use the funds we collect. We want to maximize our reach and improve the overall quality of the art we make for you! Essentials include:

  1. Microphones & In-Ear Buds (For live performances, with our own private ones we can reduce chances of sound malfunctions) 
  2. Studio Time (Currently all of us are at the end of our projects, but to make sure that we execute the most perfect sound we need a few more sessions.Yet with everything else we are doing, we may not be able to pull this off at the end.)
  3. Crvscxnt Moon Apparel ( We are working at the moment with many talented individuals to bring you the first line of Crvscxnt Moon Apparel) 
  4. Travel Expense's (Flights, Gas, Hospitality) 
  5.  Instruments (From time to time things needs to be replaced, anything from guitar strings or a whole drum set) 
  6. Application Fees For National Festivals (Many Applications require fees in order to apply, these fees tend to add up. At the moment we have over 100 applications pending for various things.) 
  7. Visuals (As fun as it can be to provide you guys with updates via text, we want to provide you guys with endless visuals such as music videos, images for singles and albums and EP to even tour date schedules. This also includes photos done by many talented photographers, including your favorite Crvscxnt photographer kwayzar of Electric Eye Inc.)

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Leon and I am a Violin teacher. I've been playing Violin for the past 14 years and teaching for the past 7. I am launching this campaign now to raise funds for the production of a Violin Scales & Arpeggios fingering method book for Grade 6-8. Your generous contribution will fund the designing, printing and marketing costs to get this book out to the world; to make violin learning easier and help students achieve. I have also written the same book for lower grades 1-5 and it has sold over 500 copies till date. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $3500 for this campaign to fund: 

1) Designing Costs for the book cover - $300 

2) Printing Costs for this 60 pages book in premium cream coloured paper friendly to the eyes and good for music reading. - $2000

3) Marketing Costs to promote the book locally, regionally and hopefully globally, customers will be reached out via internet marketing, trade exhibitions and personal outreaches - $1200   

The Impact

This project is my life work and its main purpose it to reduce the pain of the technical parts of Violin learning. Your contribution is for the greater good of furthering music education and though it may look small, the impact to society in the educational aspect is great. Through Violin learning, students can learn to be more refined, have better focus and increased attention span. 

Violin Scales & Arpeggios with fingering Grades 1-5 is well received, though not on a big scale yet, has encouraged the learning of Violin to many young children and adults alike. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help to get the word out to music lovers, educators, parents of students so that more people can contribute and share the love. 

Thank You Very Much!

story:
Short Summary

Dear Friends,

The New Division is my biggest passion. I vividly remember sitting in my college dorm in Riverside, CA, nearly 8 years ago, after purchasing my first synth, an Alesis Micron. What began as a few experimental songs later developed into a record named "The Rookie." Shortly thereafter, I wrote "Shadows," and the rest is history.

I made a decision early on that I wanted this project to be completely DIY, and fortunately, The New Division continues to remain vibrant all these years later. That, is all because of YOU. Every time you've purchased a record on iTunes, streamed it on Spotify, purchased a CD/Vinyl, or even shared it with a friend, YOU are the reason The New Division has made it this far.

I started The New Division all those years back with a very clear objective--one that remains true today --If The New Division is to ever succeed, it would have to do so in a DIY fashion. As many of you are aware, over the past few years, the music industry has taken a significant hit, and for artists like myself, it has become nearly impossible to make ends meet solely from putting out records.

This campaign is my way asking you, the loyal fan, for help. I need you to help me release this next EP, Precision. If The New Division is to move forward, it will be because of your contribution.

What I Need & What You Get

Here's the deal. On average, every record I've released over the past 7 years has cost roughly around $10,000-$15,000+ (out of my own pocket) per release. Some records, like Gemini, cost even more than that!

If you're wondering how on earth it costs that much to put out a record, here is a breakdown of typical expenses I've encountered over the course of the past few years:

  • Marketing ­- Average cost $7,000 - This one should be pretty self-explanatory. From social to digital marketing, this is a crucial area of promotion that goes in hand with any release. Of course, the amount I've budgeted could always be higher, but the resources aren't always available.
  • CD/Vinyl Printing - Average cost $3,000 - People always ask, "why no vinyl?" The simple answer is vinyl is incredibly expensive to print, about 8x the amount of CDs. They also don't sell nearly as well, given vinyl's tend to appeal more to Americans (versus the rest of the world!). Regardless of sales or cost, I've always printed CDs and have plans to press The Rookie, Shadows, Night Escape, etc.
  • Mastering - Average cost $1,200. Mastering is the final stage in the production process. While in the "old" days I used to master my own records, I stopped during the production of Night Escape, as I realized it was better to leave it to a professional, in an actual mastering house, with proper mastering techniques.
  • Music Videos - Average cost $3,000. This is an area I haven't spent a great deal on, and if anyone wonders why The New Division doesn't have a large amount of music videos, it is because they are quite expensive to make and few are willing to do them for free. With that said, Precision will feature two awesome videos that will hopefully be pleasing to you.
     
  • Radio Play - Average cost $2,300 - It's odd to think that one has to pay to get played on the radio, but it is a fact, unless you happen to write a summer anthem that charts incredibly well.
  • Production - Average cost: Unknown - This is the area that many take for granted, but actually to likely the highest bracket. I typically spend anywhere from 30 to 120 hours on each New Division song you've ever heard. If you don't believe me, I would be happy to send you a screen shot from one of my many project files that I’ve worked on.

Now, enough with all the boring stuff. Let's talk about what YOU GET when you help support my next release.

There are a number of prizes in this campaign. Please refer to them on them sidebar.

The Impact

I've always hoped, that The New Division extended beyond my ambitions, and actually meant something to you. Over the years I've received so many awesome letters from several of you, sharing your experiences with how you've interpreted or digested the music, and it's made me realize that what has kept me going all these years has been the immense support you've all given me.

Risks & Challenges

The question is, "What happens if we don't reach the goal?" It's a simple answer, but essentially Precision will not be available in CD/Vinyl format for quite some time (until I can recuperate other, pending expenses), the release will have to get delayed probably until Summer of 2017 (instead of January, 2017), and quite honestly, will probably have to be my last releases for quite some time. It also means that Shadows, The Rookie, and several other releases, will not receive re-issues anytime soon.

While this sounds quite depressing, I'm not worried about it as I'm confident that you can help me reach this goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

It makes complete sense to me that some of you cannot contribute financially, and that is perfectly okay. I only ask that you spread the word, and share this campaign with everyone in your life if you are not in a financial position to make a contribution. Literally, all you need to do is spread the word, and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools that are provided in this campaign. Set a goal, share it with 5 friends! Who knows, maybe they'll become fans as well!

Perks

New Division Tee (W)

New Division T (B)

New Division Tee (G)

 

TND Logo - Enamel Pins

1" x 1"

TND Button Pins 

1" x 1"

Signed Classic Bundle

Night Escape, Together We Shine, and Gemini - Signed in gold color.

Shadows Gold Edition (CD) Front & Back Cover

TND Beanie Black

TND Beanie Grey

 

Precision EP Credits:

D87037: A Division 87 Recording: Written, Programmed, Performed and Produced by John Glenn Kunkel. Mastered by Walter Coelho at Finyl Tweek. Bass Guitar by Charles M. LaBarbara. Electric Guitars By John Glenn Kunkel. "Vicious" Electric Guitars by Brandt Gassman 

Published by Quapaw Music Publishing (BMI) F.J. DeSanto Appears Courtesy of MOG Productions/Custom Made Music/Hypefactor

Album Art by Colson Knight
story_txt:
Short Summary
Dear Friends,
The New Division is my biggest passion. I vividly remember sitting in my college dorm in Riverside, CA, nearly 8 years ago, after purchasing my first synth, an Alesis Micron. What began as a few experimental songs later developed into a record named "The Rookie." Shortly thereafter, I wrote "Shadows," and the rest is history.
I made a decision early on that I wanted this project to be completely DIY, and fortunately, The New Division continues to remain vibrant all these years later. That, is all because of YOU. Every time you've purchased a record on iTunes, streamed it on Spotify, purchased a CD/Vinyl, or even shared it with a friend, YOU are the reason The New Division has made it this far.
I started The New Division all those years back with a very clear objective--one that remains true today --If The New Division is to ever succeed, it would have to do so in a DIY fashion. As many of you are aware, over the past few years, the music industry has taken a significant hit, and for artists like myself, it has become nearly impossible to make ends meet solely from putting out records.
This campaign is my way asking you, the loyal fan, for help. I need you to help me release this next EP, Precision. If The New Division is to move forward, it will be because of your contribution.
What I Need & What You Get
Here's the deal. On average, every record I've released over the past 7 years has cost roughly around $10,000-$15,000+ (out of my own pocket) per release. Some records, like Gemini, cost even more than that!
If you're wondering how on earth it costs that much to put out a record, here is a breakdown of typical expenses I've encountered over the course of the past few years:


Marketing ­- Average cost $7,000 - This one should be pretty self-explanatory. From social to digital marketing, this is a crucial area of promotion that goes in hand with any release. Of course, the amount I've budgeted could always be higher, but the resources aren't always available.

CD/Vinyl Printing - Average cost $3,000 - People always ask, "why no vinyl?" The simple answer is vinyl is incredibly expensive to print, about 8x the amount of CDs. They also don't sell nearly as well, given vinyl's tend to appeal more to Americans (versus the rest of the world!). Regardless of sales or cost, I've always printed CDs and have plans to press The Rookie, Shadows, Night Escape, etc.

Mastering - Average cost $1,200. Mastering is the final stage in the production process. While in the "old" days I used to master my own records, I stopped during the production of Night Escape, as I realized it was better to leave it to a professional, in an actual mastering house, with proper mastering techniques.

Music Videos - Average cost $3,000. This is an area I haven't spent a great deal on, and if anyone wonders why The New Division doesn't have a large amount of music videos, it is because they are quite expensive to make and few are willing to do them for free. With that said, Precision will feature two awesome videos that will hopefully be pleasing to you. 

Radio Play - Average cost $2,300 - It's odd to think that one has to pay to get played on the radio, but it is a fact, unless you happen to write a summer anthem that charts incredibly well.


Production - Average cost: Unknown - This is the area that many take for granted, but actually to likely the highest bracket. I typically spend anywhere from 30 to 120 hours on each New Division song you've ever heard. If you don't believe me, I would be happy to send you a screen shot from one of my many project files that I’ve worked on.

Now, enough with all the boring stuff. Let's talk about what YOU GET when you help support my next release.
There are a number of prizes in this campaign. Please refer to them on them sidebar.
The Impact
I've always hoped, that The New Division extended beyond my ambitions, and actually meant something to you. Over the years I've received so many awesome letters from several of you, sharing your experiences with how you've interpreted or digested the music, and it's made me realize that what has kept me going all these years has been the immense support you've all given me.
Risks & Challenges
The question is, "What happens if we don't reach the goal?" It's a simple answer, but essentially Precision will not be available in CD/Vinyl format for quite some time (until I can recuperate other, pending expenses), the release will have to get delayed probably until Summer of 2017 (instead of January, 2017), and quite honestly, will probably have to be my last releases for quite some time. It also means that Shadows, The Rookie, and several other releases, will not receive re-issues anytime soon.
While this sounds quite depressing, I'm not worried about it as I'm confident that you can help me reach this goal!
Other Ways You Can Help
It makes complete sense to me that some of you cannot contribute financially, and that is perfectly okay. I only ask that you spread the word, and share this campaign with everyone in your life if you are not in a financial position to make a contribution. Literally, all you need to do is spread the word, and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools that are provided in this campaign. Set a goal, share it with 5 friends! Who knows, maybe they'll become fans as well!

story:
DISASTA!

Over the past 9 months an Experiment in Musical Exploration has been incubating here in the Studios at Vacation Land. It is called DISASTA and it is the first Chainsaw Red album! DISASTA is an old Country/Folk album, the likes of which hasn't been seen in Nashville in a long long time. We call it Jimmie Rodgers' Velvet Nihilism and Narcotic Ragtime and I feel confident if you get all of that you will love this record. If not... Well you will probably still like it you just don't know it yet! Check out the video for 'Little Brown Stain', the first track on the Album, posted above to get a good idea of what we are talking about.

What We Need & What You Get

We have the Album Recorded, Mixed, and Mastered. 13 Beautiful Tracks are ready to go! We have the Digital Release date set for June 30th and everything is in order for the iTunes, Spotify, etc. to happen on that day (digital pre-sale begins June 23rd). Now we want to make some Physical Media!

  • CD's are expensive if you want them done right. We don't want CD-R's that won't work in your Playstation or your 94' Corrola. We want real deal, glass master, Compact Discs... And the minimum cost for that is just under $800 for 300 copies (the minimum quantity order amount).
  • So we want you to buy a copy now! $10 gets you your very own copy of the CD mailed to you at your home or dwelling; once the Campaign is completed and the CD Order is made. So when we get them you get yours mailed to you!
  • IF we don't make the full amount to print real CDs we will sell what we need to make up the difference. Just watch for our Kidney Sale on the Black Market. Seriously. We will get this done by hook or crook but it would be a lot better to just do it with advance sales to you!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't purchase a CD today help us by sharing this link and the video. Or better yet buy it on pre-sale from iTunes starting June 23rd!

story:
I am currently pursuing a B.F.A. in Audio Arts & Production at the Santa Fe University of Art and Design. When Melinda Russial, an instructor at SFUAD and founder of Wanderlust Edventures, announced that she was taking a group to Ghana to study abroad I knew I had to go. Why? As many of you know, I participated in Model United Nations for nearly 10 years and travel has always been a component of my education in some form or another. But I have never done an extended trip to another country and study abroad programs have never seemed to coincide exactly with my interests until now.


As a sound artist it’s my responsibility to listen to and understand music from all kinds of genres—imagine a chef who can only cook grilled cheese—so I can accommodate any artist who walks into my studio (but if you are an expert grilled cheese chef, call me). I truly believe the only way to understand music is to immerse myself in it. West African music is a big part of our education here at SFUAD and I have only scratched the surface – which is why I am going to the Dagara Music Center to study with Bernard Woma from May 29-June 19, 2016.


The three-week immersion program includes music, dance, drumming, and visual art. We will explore the culture, traditions, and landscape of West Africa, and participate in cross-cultural exchanges with Ghanaian musicians and dancers. We also aim to bring our experiences back to our own communities through performance events and interdisciplinary curriculum modules for public school students.

The cost of travel and program fees is approximately $6,000. All contributions will directly support my trip.

Additionally, we hope to support regional economic initiatives in environmental and cultural sustainability with donations for community projects, school supplies, and other means of support for the communities we will visit in Ghana.


Graceless Series

You read Graceless, right? Of course you do. When I decided to study abroad, I learned that there are many important women who help facilitate this program and work in and around the center. Editor-in-Chief Carla Cook and I cooked up a plan for me to bring back a multi-part series on these women. Their stories, and how their daily lives differ from ours, is something that interests me and I want to bring them back to you. Donating at any level will get you access to a special email newsletter written by yours truly, which will include information on this series as it unfolds.

Have questions about the program or campaign? Email me at Lopez.Martinez@email.com and I’ll be happy to answer any questions or provide more information.

story:
First Album!

The time has come for the Northerly Gales to make their very first album!  We've been playing around the Twin Cities for over a year now, and we think it's high time we head into the studio to record some of our hottest tracks, tunes, and jams.  Why should the fun stop when the bar closes?

What We Need & What You Get

So here's how it works.  In order to make this album, we need funds for:

  • Studio time
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Album artwork
  • Physical albums
This adds up pretty quick, and frankly, we're not able to do it all on our own.  That's where you come in!
But we wouldn't dream of asking so much of you without offering something in return!  By simply funding us and helping us reach our goal, you unlock a world of perks, gifts, and thank yous.  T-shirts, flasks, stickers, artwork, even a personal concert from the Gales!  All of these are available to you through just a few clicks of a button (okay, and a financial contribution as well).  Oh, and I guess the album, too.

Please, Help Us!

This album isn't going to happen without you!  Yes, you!  Whether you help fund our campaign or share it through the vast tangles of social media and the internet, we greatly appreciate your contribution!


*A quick note: for any level that allows you to claim the album itself, you will have the option of a digital or physical copy.  We'll take care of that with you at a later date.

story:
The Who and the Why

My name is Joel Procter and I am a Christian worship songwriter from Australia with a passion to see people experience Jesus in a profound way through music.

My wife Tamika and I, along with our children, have a goal to raise $6000 to fund and release my second Christmas EP.

In 2015 I recorded 'Let Us Sing - Christmas', a dynamic and fresh compilation of 5 classic Christmas carols. The purpose of the project was to record Christmas songs that contain the message of Jesus. The encouragement and support I received from this release has birthed a new desire to release part 2 of this Christmas project.

Christmas carols are incredibly powerful in that they are a natural and accepted part of the Christmas season. For this reason, I have specifically chosen songs for this new project that speak about Jesus and His birth. This EP is an opportunity to spread the message of Jesus to people that do not yet know Him.

The Songs

This year I need your help to record 5 brand new versions of these classic carols:

Angels we Have Heard on High
Away in a Manger
O Holy Night
Mary Did You Know
Hark the Heralds Angels Sing

*Remember that this project does not get recorded if we do not reach our fundraising goal*

 

What We Need & What You Get

To create an excellent and incredible project we need to raise $6000.

These funds go towards:

  • Studio costs - $3450
  • Musician Hire - $1200
  • Physical CD Printing - $1200
  • Graphic Design and Video - $150

What You Get!

To thank each and every contributor we have some exciting and unique perks for those who give at every level.

  • Every donation over $10 gets a digital pre order of the new Christmas EP.
  • Other great perks on offer are digital and physical copies of the original Christmas EP, signed copies of my worship album 'In The Fire', inclusion in the EP credits, personal phone and skype calls, exclusive access to pre-production audio from the EP, cover songs of your choosing and much more. (see to the right for full list)
  • If we do not reach $6000 I will create as many songs as possible to be released at Christmas. Sadly physical CD's and some perks are only available if we reach our total goal.
  • Feel free to donate any amount or claim a unique perk of your choosing.
     

 

Stretch Goals

If we are able to raise more than our initial goal it will enable us to add two extra acoustic carols to the EP and increase our marketing reach as well as releasing funds to record YouTube videos of some of the songs.

Stretch Goal 1: $7000 - 2 additional acoustic songs
Stretch Goal 2: $8000 - 2 additional acoustic songs + YouTube Video

 

Risks & Challenges

In every project there is a risk that it may not be successful. My greatest hope is that this campaign raises all the funds needed to create an incredible recording. If this doesn't happen however, it does not mean the end, but it does mean a change to the project.

If the campaign goal is not reached the achieved funds will be used to record as many single songs as possible that will be released during the Christmas period.

Please share this campaign with your family, friends and networks so that we can achieve something amazing this Christmas.

 

Things to Remember

  • We need $6000 to create 5 incredible Christmas songs that you will love.
  • This project only happens if we reach our goal.
  • This project is designed to reach people that don't hear about Jesus at any other time in the year.
  • Your contribution goes towards helping with the costs of making this EP happen.
  • Tell your friends, family, social networks and everybody else about this project!

story:
Welcome to Yaya’s Kitchen!

Click here to hear our first single:  Gutter Ground  

We are Sarah Cruse and Toby Salciccia, and we met in a Reiki Class in early 2012

There was something...A feeling...A curiosity…hmmmm what was it?

We discovered that both of us love music. Toby who was signed to a label in the mid 90’s with the band De’Briah, is a guitar and bass guitar player with some good old honky tonk vocals...Mmmhmm.  I am a poet, with roots in the Los Angeles Poetry scene, it is my birth place as an artist.  I later discovered the healing qualities of sound, the power of my voice, and that I could write my own songs and sing!

We first played together at Inner Light Ministries in Soquel California, and it felt like something greater was inviting us to continue.  Yaya’s Kitchen is a container for dynamic, co-creative and inspired music to happen… We are cooking it up and serving it up...and it is delicious.  

 

About the Album

It has been a slow and joyous journey developing the content for this record.  Some of the songs I wrote nearly 10 years ago, and some of the songs are brand new, and co-written with Toby.  The content spans many seasons, yet continues to flow with a voice of honesty, vulnerability and grace.  It is truth dressed up in many garments.  The album is SoulFolk with a Hip Hop twist, it’s dynamic, textured, vulnerable, sexy and heart opening.  I feel it carries my true voice.   We are bringing in wonderful musicians and working with the amazing sound engineer and producer Eric James.  This project is indeed the fruit of many years spent digesting life experiences.  Believe me, I really enjoy being in the deep processes of reflecting upon and integrating life…And, I am thrilled to be entering this next phase of creativity...“Maybe it’s time, Maybe it’s time, time for changin”, echos the celebratory outro of our single Gutter Ground...And so it is~*  We are excited, humbled and a bit giddy to engage this project fully, with all of the resources needed to bring it to life.  Thank you so much for your support, your contributions, and your love.  Community grows us.  Thank you for helping us to grow.

 

Your Funding Will Go Towards:

  • Indigogo Fees: $1600
  • Studio time: $7500
  • Musicians $3000
  • Mixing: $4000
  • Mastering: $1000
  • Album Art Work $300
  • CD’s $500
  • Vinyl $1000
  • Merchandise $500
  • Publicity $600

 

Your Impact:

We get to make an Album and we get to share it with all of you!

We have already begun:  1 song completed and ready for you! Gutter Ground.  And we have 4 songs in production.  It is so exciting, to be witnessing a dream coming to life~*

We have currently invested $2600 into the project.  Our plan is to complete the remaining 4 tracks and start 5 more for a full length 10 song album.  

With your help this can happen.  Each $1, $100, or $1000 that you donate will go towards bringing this vision to life.  Each time you pass on the link or share our campaign with someone we are one step closer to having all of the resources we need to complete this project and share it with all of you!
story_txt:
Welcome to Yaya’s Kitchen!Click here to hear our first single:  Gutter Ground  We are Sarah Cruse and Toby Salciccia, and we met in a Reiki Class in early 2012There was something...A feeling...A curiosity…hmmmm what was it?We discovered that both of us love music. Toby who was signed to a label in the mid 90’s with the band De’Briah, is a guitar and bass guitar player with some good old honky tonk vocals...Mmmhmm.  I am a poet, with roots in the Los Angeles Poetry scene, it is my birth place as an artist.  I later discovered the healing qualities of sound, the power of my voice, and that I could write my own songs and sing!We first played together at Inner Light Ministries in Soquel California, and it felt like something greater was inviting us to continue.  Yaya’s Kitchen is a container for dynamic, co-creative and inspired music to happen… We are cooking it up and serving it up...and it is delicious.   About the AlbumIt has been a slow and joyous journey developing the content for this record.  Some of the songs I wrote nearly 10 years ago, and some of the songs are brand new, and co-written with Toby.  The content spans many seasons, yet continues to flow with a voice of honesty, vulnerability and grace.  It is truth dressed up in many garments.  The album is SoulFolk with a Hip Hop twist, it’s dynamic, textured, vulnerable, sexy and heart opening.  I feel it carries my true voice.   We are bringing in wonderful musicians and working with the amazing sound engineer and producer Eric James.  This project is indeed the fruit of many years spent digesting life experiences.  Believe me, I really enjoy being in the deep processes of reflecting upon and integrating life…And, I am thrilled to be entering this next phase of creativity...“Maybe it’s time, Maybe it’s time, time for changin”, echos the celebratory outro of our single Gutter Ground...And so it is~*  We are excited, humbled and a bit giddy to engage this project fully, with all of the resources needed to bring it to life.  Thank you so much for your support, your contributions, and your love.  Community grows us.  Thank you for helping us to grow. Your Funding Will Go Towards:
Indigogo Fees: $1600
Studio time: $7500
Musicians $3000
Mixing: $4000
Mastering: $1000
Album Art Work $300
CD’s $500
Vinyl $1000
Merchandise $500
Publicity $600
 Your Impact:We get to make an Album and we get to share it with all of you!We have already begun:  1 song completed and ready for you! Gutter Ground.  And we have 4 songs in production.  It is so exciting, to be witnessing a dream coming to life~*We have currently invested $2600 into the project.  Our plan is to complete the remaining 4 tracks and start 5 more for a full length 10 song album.  With your help this can happen.  Each $1, $100, or $1000 that you donate will go towards bringing this vision to life.  Each time you pass on the link or share our campaign with someone we are one step closer to having all of the resources we need to complete this project and share it with all of you!

story:
My name is Hadden Sayers. I play guitar, and sing. I write songs. I record the results. When I’m done, I release a record and drive around the country performing to crowds both large and small. 

 

It is my passion. 

It is my mission. 

 

DOPAMINE MACHINE is more from-the-heart than any of my other releases. It was written and recorded without ANY concern for what genre it may (or may not) fit into, and the end result could be described as “on the Rock side of Blues-Rock.” That lack of concern for how I fit into the world made recording even MORE inspiring than it already is for me….and it shows. 

 

Along with the full-band takes on these songs, I have also created a solo-acoustic version of the album. That’s right; "DOPAMINE MACHINE" has an evil twin: "ACOUSTIC DOPAMINE".

 

Here’s where you come in…. To bring this Blues-Rock creation to its full potential, I need funding for duplication of CD’s AND Vinyl, but more importantly: Advertising and Marketing. In order to get these songs to new ears I need to spread the word.  Would you like to be an "early adopter"?

Here's your chance...and THANK YOU for reading this.

 

WITHOUT you, I’m alone in a van. TOGETHER, WE will carry these songs around the globe. 

 

Thank you, 

HADDEN

www.haddensayers.com

www.bluesisart.com

www.haddeninthehouse.com

www.bluesfortots.org

facebook.com/haddensayers

twitter.com/haddensayers

instagram.com/haddensayers

story:
Short Summary

  • We are a group of beatboxers from Portugal.
  • We need help to revive the Portuguese Beatbox Scene.
  • The contributors help will be essential for the event to happen.

What We Need 

  • We will use the funds to pay for sound and light equipment, prizes for the participants, and licensing.
  • The portuguese beatbox community has so much quality to offer the world of beatboxing that it needs its own event and champion to represent Portugal in the Beatbox Battle World Championship.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will apply the funds where we need them most to make the event happen.

The Impact

  • Beatboxing is such an amazing talent and art! Your help will not only revive the Portuguese Beatbox Community, but will also be crucial for the development and evolution of beatbox in Portugal.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
LETS MAKE THIS MOVE SOMETHING TO ENJOY, NOT AVOID!

I'm doing it! I'm uprooting and planting a garden where my family and I can thrive! Everything is handled on the adulting side... healthcare, apartment, job, recording studio, childcare, school.. all thats left is GETTING THERE!

I do not want Gilbert to be heartbroken about leaving, nor to feel like shooting myself on the way... so I came up with this crowd funder in hopes of making this trip an adventure for the kids...

Gilbert wants to be a blogger.. SOOO he will be GoProing the journey and narrating the whole way, his way! With your support these kids will experience a little magic that I can not provide by myself!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Hotel & lodging for 10 nights.. normally people take like 5 days but with 2 kids, I'm mapping double that,,,I don't care if we stay at creepy shitholes, but I want to make sure I get rest if I'm hiking and backing with these guys all day... 
  • gas money,
  • food
  • park entrances
  • parking
  • extra funds incase something happens

 

CHECK OUT THE PERKS IF YOU DONATE!

If you cant donate, SHARE

sometimes your unable to donate monetarily, but your simple share can get the attention of other contributors!.
