story:
"Reason Why They're Green" by Shining Lion: A Short Summary

Aho and many blessings to all of our loved ones, friends and fans both new and old!  

This crowd funding campaigned has been created to repay and honor all of the people involved with the filming and production who have been working for free for the last four months in order to complete the "Reason Why They're Green" music.  Shining Lion believes that contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and give money to people they trust. The idea that is being highlighted here is a unique and exciting piece; it is the most anticipated, eco-friendly, holistic hip-hop song ever composed!  "Reason Why They're Green" and it's visual representation exceeds expectations in terms of artistic merit, social impact and revolutionary content!  Shining Lion has a proven track record of producing incredible, revolutionary reggae & hip-hop music.  They are now on their fourth album and "Reason Why They're Green" will be the fifth large scale music video produced and by far the most elaborate!  For over fifteen years environmental justice, world peace and universal love have become reoccurring themes in Shining Lion’s musical repertoire. Shining Lion downloads cosmic sounds from the Universe to inspire change and gives a voice to the growing alternative lifestyles, the green energy movement and cross-cultural consciousness. Shining Lion is a transformational reggae, world music and hip hop ensemble influenced by greats like Bob Marley, the Fugees and the Roots.  The group founded by Shine Rilling whose lyrics are paradigm shifting and uplifting and has featured the voices of incredible female vocalist such as Shyla Ray Sunshine and Juno Brown, both recorded and live.  For over ten years environmental justice, world peace and universal love have all been reoccurring themes in Shining Lion’s repertoire. The combination of the male-female vocal dynamic creates a divine swirl of beautiful harmonies paired with revolutionary ideas which paint a gorgeous portrait of musical talent and a creative, sustainable vision for the future.  The mission of Shining Lion is to inspire people to heal and harmonize with the highest good of the earth! 

  • The "Reason Why They're Green" music video is important to the global community because it expresses sentiments of divestment, progression and environmental justice, all topics which are usually discussed in traditional folk music styles,traditionally accompanied by banjos and acoustic guitars, however this song is sharing an eco-friendly message on top of a hiphop beat, crossing over genres, cultural, racial and economic barriers.  The lead character in the video is George Washington, played by Shine, brings a full-circle feeling to the American narrative, an opportunity to create our own future instead of living in the mistakes of our ancestors, giving a moment for the wrongs to be rectified by learning new ways and means to repair the damages of the industrial age and to evolve our modern world. Shine, the band’s lead vocalist and song-writer, dresses up as a time-traveling George Washington who enters 2017 to learn how money (green papers) to heal the earth.  It is a true story of divestment and environmental rehabilitation.
  • The magnitude of what you as a contributor will help us achieve is immense.  Shining Lion isn't a one-trick pony.  The musical multi media empire is in it's incubation phase and with your donation, you can expect to see not only the "Reason Why They're Green" music video, but visuals for at least three more music videos from the "One Love Vibration" album.  With your donations Shining Lion can finally release the earth-shifting music video!  The music video has already been filmed, however in order to complete and release the music video globally, the editors, camera people, casting directors and cast need to be paid. Reaching the initial goal of $11,111 will enable Shining Lion to pay our diligent film and editing crew, casting director and members of the cast.  

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down in more detail:

  • This campaign calls on the power of community to manifest an initial fundraising goal of  $11,111 within only 14 days to pay for the production fees of the music video "Reason Why They're Green". Donations received will go directly to recouping Shining Lion for all up front cost associated with the filming of the music video including camera rentals, costume rentals, editing fees, casting agent, cast, transportation, administrative fees, and everything in between.

    There are three possible tiers to the campaign as mentioned earlier, we are in the seeding phase of a musical multi media empire. With the power of $11,111 one music video “Reason Why They’re Green” will be completed and that would be such a phenomenal achievement.  We would like to stretch our goal when we reach our initial goal of $11,111 the second goal of $22,222 two music videos will be completed.  At the $33,333 there would be more than enough to complete all three music videos and devote a portion of the funds to recording and releasing another EP and album in 2018.

Perks & Prizes

 Shining Lion has unique perks to gift donors.  We want you to feel the joy and excitement we feel about connecting with you and receiving your energy!  You're not just a donor, you are an ally to the Global Green Movement! 

  • $11 ~ Free Download of the "One Love Vibration" album
  • $22~Free Download of the "One Love Vibration" & "BlackFeet" album
  • $55~Free Download of the entire Shining Lion & Black Feet discography
  • $111~One Love Package Mailed to you~ One Love Package Includes Shining Lion & Black Feet discography (physical CDs), a set of Peace Sticks, Shining Lion Stickers
  • $222~One Love Package + Amazonian Medicine Bracelet
  • $444~One Love Package + Amazonian Medicine Bracelet + Shining Lion poster
  • $555~ Nature Music Ceremony with Shine in Ojai, CA for (1-2 people) + One Love Package
  • $777~Nature Music Ceremony with Shine in Ojai, CA for (3-5 people) + One Love Package
  • $888~All of the above + a creative consulting session with Social Media Gurus of Shining Lion
  • $1,111 or more~All of the above + Executive Producer Credits on the "Reason Why They're Green" music video

*If for whatever reason we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will still be split amongst the editors of the music video.  

The Impact

Shining Lion wants you to know as much about this campaign as possible. Your difference their contribution will make a difference, not just in their pocket, but in the Global Green Scene!

  • Shining Lion's project is valuable to the you as a contributor and to the world.  You will not just be contributing to the funding of one music video, you are bringing to fruition the life long dream of the Shining Lion Team, particularly Shine and Juno Brown. It is their Divine Purpose to share their voices, ideas and music with the world.  You have the power to make their creative dreams turn into a reality.  This is something you will not see on your teLIEvision, this is not a music video that would come out of this current system or our modern civiLIEzation, you and the greater transformational community will essentially serve as the executive producers and producers for this music, WE are becoming our own network.  You ARE the change maker in this world!  Making incredible, revolutionary musical content is one of the major career goals of Shining Lion!  This fundraiser exist because Shining Lion and the entire production crew believes that this is possible and you are in control of the future of media; jump in a cast your votes with your money.  Tell the world what you want to see! If you support progressive, positive music for all generations, donate to this campaign.  Independent artist can continue producing amazing content, but only with your help.
  • Shining Lion has a successful track record with projects like this.  I mean, George Washington traveled through time, all the way from 1789, to give this project a thumbs up! Shining Lion has independently funded four independently recorded albums and a handful of powerful music videos including their "Loving the Water (Standing Rock Song)" music video which currently has  147,000 views.  Projected estimates for the viewing of the "Reason Why They're Green" video will be in the millions.  Shining Lion believes that contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Shining Lion has a proven track record of producing incredible revolutionary music.  They are now on their fourth album and "Reason Why They're Green" will be the fourth large scale music video and by far the most elaborate!  For over fifteen years environmental justice, world peace and universal love have become reoccurring themes in Shining Lion’s musical repertoire.
  • To be really real, Shining Lion is a modern day family band composed of adults who hold down entrepreneurial enterprises, day jobs, not to mention raising children; this creative group is composed of individuals, who despite what society says you have to do once you reach a certain age or have a certain amount of responsibilities should or shouldn't do, persisted with their careers as professional recording artist and musicians.  Knowing the full story helps to build trust with you as a donor.  No one in the production crew has a trust fund; this is a campaign by real artist who genuinely request your help to bring this project to fruition. 

Risks & Challenges

You as a donor value transparency. Shining Lion wants to be open and provide insight into the risks and obstacles that may come up on the way to reaching this goal.

  • What qualifies Shining Lion to overcome these hurdles?  Hmm, good question.  Well, for starters the Shining Lion production team is composed of five young, yet experienced and highly dedicated entertainment professionals.  There's a very slim chance that the ball will be dropped. Shining Lion also has elders and experts from the Elevate Conscious Production company/team advising us on how to utilize social media to its highest power.  Among the five individuals, at any juncture of obstacle one of the five people are fully willing to jump in to save the day, whether that means brainstorming or calling in 'special favors'.  Shining Lion anticipates a smooth and successful campaign.  Having more than one person involved in the production and the projection of the fundraiser gives them all a feeling of security and hopefully gives you, as the donor, a feeling of security moving forward. Not to mention, that the product that the money is being raised for has already been shot.  The music video for "Reason Why They're Green" is in the post-production phase, meaning that the video is almost done, and what needs to happen will happen in the editing room.
  • Shining Lion's strategy for solving these challenges entails relying on our human resources team.

Other Ways You Can Help

Shining Lion overstands that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Shining Lion asks folks to get the word out and make some noise about this "Reason Why They're Green" fundraising campaign.  That means re-posting the fundraiser and images from the Shining Lion Facebook page.  Please remember to LIKE the Shining Lion Facebook Page, here's the link: https://www.facebook.com/Shining-Lion-and-Black-Feet-154681726687/
  • Instagram @Peacesticks @shininglion @junobrownmusic are all great ways to tag and share the Shining Lion Team!  The hashtags associated with this campaign are:  #reasonwhytheyregreen #rwtg #greenwashington #washingtongreen #shopgreen #freethedollars 
  • Feel free to Live Stream footage of yourself dancing to the song and post it on the Shining Lion Facebook page or on your personal feed and tag Shining Lion in it.
  • Everything you do will be perfect! Please share as much as you can whenever you can!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

And that's all there is to it.  On behalf of Shining Lion and the Shining Lion Production team, we thank you... may you be divinely guided in your giving and know that this November is FOR GIVING.

And so it is.

Not to mention, that the product that the money is being raised for has already been shot.  The music video for "Reason Why They're Green" is in the post-production phase, meaning that the video is almost done, and what needs to happen will happen in the editing room.
Shining Lion's strategy for solving these challenges entails relying on our human resources team.


Other Ways You Can Help
Shining Lion overstands that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Shining Lion asks folks to get the word out and make some noise about this "Reason Why They're Green" fundraising campaign.  That means re-posting the fundraiser and images from the Shining Lion Facebook page.  Please remember to LIKE the Shining Lion Facebook Page, here's the link: https://www.facebook.com/Shining-Lion-and-Black-Feet-154681726687/

Instagram @Peacesticks @shininglion @junobrownmusic are all great ways to tag and share the Shining Lion Team!  The hashtags associated with this campaign are:  #reasonwhytheyregreen #rwtg #greenwashington #washingtongreen #shopgreen #freethedollars 
Feel free to Live Stream footage of yourself dancing to the song and post it on the Shining Lion Facebook page or on your personal feed and tag Shining Lion in it.
Everything you do will be perfect! Please share as much as you can whenever you can!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

And that's all there is to it.  On behalf of Shining Lion and the Shining Lion Production team, we thank you... may you be divinely guided in your giving and know that this November is FOR GIVING.And so it is.

story:
Descrizione del Progetto

Il progetto Leone si sviluppa all’interno della musica cosiddetta d’autore in cui la tradizione italiana si innesta con gli chansonnier francesi fino ad arrivare all’epicità di Woodkid e al classicismo del piano di Tenco. Il pianoforte infatti diventa lo strumento principe su cui ruotano sperimentazioni sonore o melodie cantabili che fanno del progetto un mix di modernità e passato.
story_txt:

Il progetto Leone si sviluppa all’interno della musica cosiddetta d’autore in cui la tradizione italiana si innesta con gli chansonnier francesi fino ad arrivare all’epicità di Woodkid e al classicismo del piano di Tenco. Il pianoforte infatti diventa lo strumento principe su cui ruotano sperimentazioni sonore o melodie cantabili che fanno del progetto un mix di modernità e passato.

story:
My entire life I've been a musician, yet at some point I transitioned from being a musician... to being a musician who takes odd jobs... to being a working stiff who barely makes time to listen to music, never mind play it. 

Its somewhat ironic in the most serendipitous of ways that becoming a father not just allowed, but forced me to find the musician in me again. With the support of my amazing wife, I've played more shows in the past 8 months than in the past 5 years combined (over 150!!). More importantly, I've written what I feel are some of my most poignant songs. I've also met friends who share my vision and ambition in what the next step could be  -  enter: Heavy Water. 

We will be recording this full length album at a studio here in Charlotte that can hang with any of the music factories in Nashville. The record draws heavily on the lessons I've learned, both musically and emotionally, hopping from city to city for the last decade and, you guessed it, taking the "Long Way Home". Your contribution will go directly towards the the production of the album as well as the manufacturing of the CDs/Vinyl.  We as a group feel confident that this record is going to blindside everyone both in the production quality as well as the unbridled honest and infectious nature of the songs. Ultimately we want each of you to walk away from this record saying "this is what country music is supposed to be".

Check out the perks and help in any way you can. For the price of several cups of coffee, you could be an integral part of this campaign's success.

Can't help financially? Share the link - we need this campaign to spread far and wide!

Without YOUR help, none of this is possible!

Thank you so much,
Matt
MM&HW

story:
Short Summary

 

  • My name is Damian Sage. Singer / Songwriter. I was born and raised in New York. I moved to Hollywood two years ago to continue my journey  in the music business.
  • This is my first crowdfunding campaign for my music. I decided to do it because I have a huge opportunity to record with a major music producer. It's honestly just not something I could do alone. My hope is that people like you decide to support the project. All levels welcome, big or small.
  • What makes this such a big opportunity is not only the producer, but my management . I am managed by Vicky Hamilton. Vicky has worked with everyone from Guns N' Roses to June Carter Cash. The completion of this project will give Vicky something she can shop to her many music industry executive contacts. I'd truly appreciate your support.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The funding goal is $10,000. The majority of that will goto recording, mixing and mastering. The producer is very well known and has worked on many hit records.
  • The Perks! Every level of support will get something. From a download of the completed project, to merchandise, all the way up to a private show at your home. Many more in between. I genuinely appreciate any support and want to make sure I give back to you as well
  • If I can reach the full goal, in addition to the recordings, I will also be able to get some professional photos and do a music video.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and I completely understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools and share on social media.
  • All of it helps and I appreciate it very much.

story:
Who we are and why we will succeed.

  • My name is Robin D. Berg, I'm a 20 year veteran entertainment executive, and I am the CEO of Wildhorse Music Festival Inc.
  • This indiegogo campaign is an important facet of our funding strategy for Wildhorse and all proceeds will go directly to hard costs associated with the festival including production, staging, artists etc.
  • With your help, we can create an enormously successful  brand that will live for decades and your contribution will make a critical difference.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Although most of our funding for hard costs will be raised through corporate sponsorships, We feel our crowdfunding campaign  can add punch to our strategy by allowing us to direct additional funds towards key artists and infrastructure, reduce corporate branding, and build our base of awareness.
  • From invites to our opening night private concert, to Merch, GA and VIP Tickets, to private acoustic concerts in your home by Wildhorse artists, or the chance to meet and have a picture taken with a major artist, the value for our campaign contributors is very real.
  • Wildhorse Music Festival has been in the planning stages for over two years, we are in discussions with a number of corporate sponsors. A successful Indiegogo campaign will allow us the freedom to move rapidly to lock-in  artists, and reserve important infrastructure.  Without a successful crowd fund, we will succeed but our options will be more limited.

The Impact

  • This campaign will break new ground for music festival development, and allow us to create an experience with reduced corporate branding and influence.
  • Our team is comprised of entertainment and festival production professionals with many years of experience.  Our EVP of Operations is a veteran of music festival production, with some of the biggest festivals relying on his production expertise.
  • The perks we are offering are actually discounted tickets and experience levels that would cost the average attendee considerably more, and they will have the satisfaction of knowing they helped make a major music festival brand a reality.

Risks & Challenges

First year music festivals are always a challenge, there are myriad risks involved and many do not survive the first year.  We are reducing this risk by including top festival production professionals who plan and produce some of the biggest and most successful festivals. You can see our digital sponsor deck that includes our team here:  https://www.sponseasy.com/p/wildhorse-music-fes...

  • Our EVP of operations is a 20 year veteran in the music festival industry and has experienced  almost every scenario that might arise and understands how to avoid, and manage them effectively.
  • Careful planning, budgeting, and experience will help us avoid the majority of issues that can arise, and we are up to the task.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Don't feel left out if you are unable to contribute financially at this time, you can still volunteer as an event staff member, or play a vital role in helping get the word out to as many people as possible, tell them about the Indiegogo campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools, and direct them to the festival website. www.wildhorsefest.com

story:
The Vision

 

I have been crafting these songs for years and bringing them near close to perfection (because nothing is really perfect). Some are newer than others, some you’ve never heard before. One thing they all have in common is that they tell my story, because I’ve been through a lot over the years and I want to bare it all. It’s been quite the growing process for me the last few years and I’ve learned a lot. I want to share it all with you through my music.

 

The sound will be pure rock ‘n’ roll mixed with electronic and blues sounds. Heavy guitars, haunting melodies that tell a story, deep gritty bass and drums that make you want to move. The album will include slower, more intimate songs that really make you think about life and hard hitting fast tunes that make you want to throw your hands up in the air. I’ll take you from sultry bedroom songs straight into the mosh pit!

 

When I got sober almost four years ago there was a lot that was unknown to me, but one thing that was clear was that I wanted to reach out and connect with people through my music. Whether you’ve battled addiction or other hardships in life there are two common factors in recovery and those are hope and faith. We tend to shut down and become silent when we are going through really trying times but I decided to do the exact opposite because I wanted to help others by sharing my experiences. We all deal with really hard stuff in life and it’s ok to feel down, but when we can unite and heal one another with love, compassion and honesty the suffering isn’t so bad.

 

This album will tell my story and spread hope to the world. I invite you to come along!

 

The Production

 

After many rehearsals with my amazing band we have everything locked down and are ready to get into the studio. We have already started laying the foundation for some of the tracks. We will be recording most of the album at The Dungeon Recording Studio in North Miami, FL helmed by Fred Freeman. There is a great vibe and great sound in that studio which is exactly what this album needs!

 

I am working with an amazing and well accomplished producer, Francisco Del. Del has written and produced music for: Pitbull, Gloria Estefan, Jon Secada, KC & The Sunshine Band and many more. He is credited with 1 gold and 1 platinum record and during his solo career signed to WEA he landed on the charts in 2005. Billboard R&B at number 52 with the remake of the George Michael classic “Careless Whisper”. That same year, Del performed on Soul Train. He also remixed a number 1 dance single for Kabah in Puerto Rico. In the Latin market, Del has written and produced with artists Thalia, Celia Cruz, Soraya, AB Quintanilla, Yuri, Paulina Rubio to name a few.

 

As an actor and extra, He appeared in several music videos and movies: Ricky Martin’s “She Bangs”, Celine Dion’s “A New Day”, Shakira's "Me Quedes Tu" as her hairstylist, CSI Miami, Bad Boys II, and Out of Time. Del has recorded movie soundtracks for Cellular (Kim Bassinger), Private Lessons, Miami Hustle and Stonerville. Del has also produced a song for the award winning video game “Fight Night 2005”.

 

As an intern, Del has worked for Dallas Austin producing sound libraries as well as an apprentice for Scott Storch. In 2005, he formed the rock band Big Bang Radio and opened for Duran Duran, Modest Mouse, The Strokes, Foreigner, All American Rejects, Ashlee Simpson, Gnarls Barkley, Common, Nine Inch Nails, VHS Or Beta, Brazilian Girls and many more. Del’s band received international and national recognition through the reality T.V. show on FUSE, Bodog Battle of the Bands. 10,000 bands battled and Big Bang Radio placed 3rd and received 3 months of international television time on the show also starring Johnny Rotten and Billy Duffy.

 

Recent projects include La Banda for Univision, music production for Ricky Martin's Vegas Review & One World Tour & La Voz (The Voice) 2019.

 

Something that is very important to me with this project is involving like-minded creatives—people I know and respect as musicians. Tony Alarcon, a well known Miami guitarist and front man, will be providing this album with killer guitar solos and riffs. Sean Bauzay, who played drums for my last project, Revlover, will be taking percussion to the next level. I’ve already had one day in the studio with him and all I can say is “wow”! I knew I had a good drummer, but you don’t REALLY know until you get into the studio. This guy destroys it! Lastly, the newest member of the MORRISON outfit, Jian Beckford, will bring you bass lines so deep and fuzzy you might need to shave after listening. This guy brings it.

 

Once tracking is completed, the songs will be mixed by my dear friend and extraordinary engineer Dave Albert. This guy’s ears are like gold. He mixed my last two singles and brought them to a whole other level. After all the songs are sent out for mastering I’ll be distributing to every major streaming service and then some—making sure you can listen along virtually anywhere you want. In this day it doesn’t make too much sense to distribute CDs because who still buys those? And for the few people that do, I’ll be happy to burn you a CD. By saving money on that I’ll be able to invest in some really cool merch for you. Instead of having a CD that sits on a shelf and collects dust, you’ll be able to rock a really cool t-shirt or hat.

 

The Meaning

 

If you are still reading this then I know you are invested or at least interested in this project. I can’t thank you enough for staying with me thus far. If you are still not sure I will tell you this.

 

I know you can spend your money anywhere and if you’re like me, there is a long list of things you’d like to spend it on. You may have already decided that this is not for you. But I can promise you that if you contribute to this project your money will not be more appreciated or put to a more thought-out, believed-in cause. For you it’s just a few dollars, but for me, it’s my future.

 

I knew when I decided to go to college for music and start a career in it that it wouldn’t be an easy path, but the passion I have for my music is like nothing else in this world. It has been a life long goal to be able to reach out and help people with my music and with your help I can do that.

 

Even if this album doesn’t top charts and get me recognized worldwide I’ll have still done it and put my heart and soul out there. If I can touch just a few people with my music and possibly change their lives for the better then this record will have been a huge success.

 

That being said, it is time to press record.

 

 

With love,

Megan Morrison

story:
Hello there!  I'm Lance Vallis and Special Purpose is my instrumental jazz/rock/funk band, based in Portland, OR.

I've been making music my whole life: as a kid on Long Island, NY, in the Boston area as a student at Berklee College of Music and later in numerous rock bands, jazz groups, and musical theater productions, as well as internationally as a performer onboard cruise ships.  I earned my masters in music at Portland State University a few years ago and regularly perform around the Rose City.  Special Purpose started about two years ago, and this recording is a distillation of my professional and personal experiences. 

The songs have been written and recorded!  This Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward producing the studio album.  I'm working with engineer and producer Steve Strauss at B-Side Studios to bring this music to life.  

I've been able to cover the costs for recording, however, this is only the first step in the process.  Mixing is the next step, which involves blending the instruments together as well as fine-tuning their sound.  Check out an early mix of the song we've spent the most time on so far, Password:  

After mixing is completed, the recording is mastered, which balances the overall sound among the songs, puts a layer of polish on them and makes the whole thing more cohesive.  I'm working with Dana White at Specialized Mastering to complete this process (who I last worked with almost 15 years ago - in Boston!).

After studio production is finished, we'll need to market and promote the final product.  I've lined up amazing local artist Malén Christine from Gem of Niles to create the album artwork and photographer Todd Gee to help with this effort.  

Most importantly, I'd like to compensate the amazing musicians in the band who agreed to go into the studio for two full days to record, Paul Paresa, Hunter Parmentier, and Forest Carter.  

As you know, endeavors in the arts generally don't produce much revenue, and while I would like to have been able to pay for the recording from the earnings received at performances, the reality is I need your help to cover costs.  I am grateful for any support you can give, and in exchange for your generosity, there are several perks available to you, ranging from a download of the entire album to a personal concert from the whole band!

Although I've played with numerous bands throughout the years, I was a collaborator with them. This group is the first I've written all of the material and managed the whole process, and holds great meaning for me.  Your support will help get these songs out into the world, forge a place in the scene, and connect with other like-minded fans to build community around this music.

The songs have been written and recorded!  This Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward producing the studio album.  I'm working with engineer and producer Steve Strauss at B-Side Studios to bring this music to life.  
I've been able to cover the costs for recording, however, this is only the first step in the process.  Mixing is the next step, which involves blending the instruments together as well as fine-tuning their sound.  Check out an early mix of the song we've spent the most time on so far, Password:  

After mixing is completed, the recording is mastered, which balances the overall sound among the songs, puts a layer of polish on them and makes the whole thing more cohesive.  I'm working with Dana White at Specialized Mastering to complete this process (who I last worked with almost 15 years ago - in Boston!).
After studio production is finished, we'll need to market and promote the final product.  I've lined up amazing local artist Malén Christine from Gem of Niles to create the album artwork and photographer Todd Gee to help with this effort.  
Most importantly, I'd like to compensate the amazing musicians in the band who agreed to go into the studio for two full days to record, Paul Paresa, Hunter Parmentier, and Forest Carter.  
As you know, endeavors in the arts generally don't produce much revenue, and while I would like to have been able to pay for the recording from the earnings received at performances, the reality is I need your help to cover costs.  I am grateful for any support you can give, and in exchange for your generosity, there are several perks available to you, ranging from a download of the entire album to a personal concert from the whole band!
Although I've played with numerous bands throughout the years, I was a collaborator with them. This group is the first I've written all of the material and managed the whole process, and holds great meaning for me.  Your support will help get these songs out into the world, forge a place in the scene, and connect with other like-minded fans to build community around this music.

story:
Short Summary

Some of the Greek Gods have left Mount Olympus and taken human vessels to form a new powerful pantheon on Earth in order to bring humanity something that equals the value of Prometheus’ stolen fire. With Kronos (Leader of all Titans) on vocals, HADES (God of the Underworld, Ruler of the Dead) on lead guitar/backup vocals, ARES (God of War & Raw Violence) on drums/percussion, & Dionysus (God of Madness, Ecstasy & Wine) on rhythm guitar they have brought a new revival to the rock music genre.

GODZ is comprised of members that in their former human vessels played in bands like Through Fire, Seasons After, Motograter, Dies Irae / Warganism, Taine, L.O.S.T., Open Mind, Scum of the Earth, The Autumn Offering.

GODZ plays – God Metal, Modern Metal / Hard Rock from the Godz!

The GODZ need your help in order to finalize their debut album, Cultum, get a worthy tour vehicle, procure the required tour gear and stage props, and much more.

Become part of the legends within the divine pantheon and help the GODZ spread their music around the world!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have a base goal of $10,000, a stretch goal of $20,000 and a dream goal of $30,000. Every additional dollar goes a long way.

This will help us get the following:

  • Complete out debut album, Cultum (~ $5,000)

  • Purchase a tour vehicle (~ $15,000)

  • Acquire the needed tour gear and stage props (~ $5,000)

  • Get the first batch of merchandise (~ $5,000)

For helping us achieve our goals you will get a myriad of audio and visual content, unique signed instruments, one of a kind paintings, chances to meet and party with the GODZ and much more. This is a one of a kind chance to get collectable items from the band!

 

10% OF ALL PROCEEDS WILL GO TOWARDS CHARITIES THAT HELP PEOPLE WITH ADDICTIONS AND MENTAL ILLNESS.

 

Funds will be used in order of priority in the following way:

  1. Complete album

  2. Get merchandise

  3. Acquire tour gear and props

  4. Purchase tour vehicle

All funds that would pass the dream goal would go towards creating new content for our valued fans: music videos, tour diary videos, equipment reviews, additional songs recorded and released, etc.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

  • Share this campaign on Facebook and other social media!

  • Come out to a show and buy some merch!

 

THANK YOU!!!

 

Join the Cult & Worship the GODZ:

Website – www.worshipthegodz.com

Facebook – www.facebook.com/worshipthegodz

Youtube  – www.youtube.com/worshipthegodz

Instagram – www.instagram.com/worshipthegodz

Twitter – www.twitter.com/worshipthegodz

 

GODZ Merchandise:

Etsy – www.etsy.com/shop/worshipthegodz

story:
From the #WomenCrush Music Team

#WCM launched in Spring 2017 and since then has put on over 80 events for rising women songwriters across 13 different cities in the USA and Canada. A project that started with Founder Ashley Kervabon's own desire to find a local music community has now become a small but mighty operation powered by 30 volunteers. Now, with a full board of directors including radio hosts, national touring & recording artists, producers, and experienced industry professionals, #WomenCrush Music is ready to take the next leap and file our 501c3 application so that we can be a tax exempt organization. This will allow us to apply for government grants, corporate sponsorships and so much more!

We have already accomplished so much on little to no budget, but with your help, we can continue to build upon our foundation to reach artists and songwriters across the country and soon, across the world...Our goal is  to raise at least $10K in the next six weeks to be able to cover some startup costs as we prepare for our first huge fundraising push for the new year. The money will go towards the tax exemption process, merchandise, marketing, program costs, and staff education.

Check out our "About" video to learn more about our mission, and take a look at the awesome perks we are offering to say “thank you” to our generous donors.  Your support means so much to me, the entire #WCM team, & most importantly, the women in music we are connecting, educating, and inspiring in our current and future chapters

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $10,000 which will go to the following:

Our 501c3 Tax Exemption Status Application

Administrative Costs

#WCM Merchandise

Reserve (Savings/Staff Education)

Program costs (chapter expenses)

If we don’t reach our goal, priority will be given to our tax exemption status application and program costs, followed by administrative costs and merchandise. If we exceed our goal, we will put the rest of the money towards our program costs for 2019 & savings.

The Impact

Since the organization’s launch in Spring 2017, our team has made it their mission to connect, educate and inspire rising women songwriters. The organization has hosted over 80 events across 13 cities in the USA and Canada including showcases, networking events, and educational workshops, landing us local and national features in notable media outlets such as Lenny Letter, SF Station, KGW News, and more!

The aim of this campaign is to raise money for the tax exemption application, program costs, merchandise, and staff education. As with most startup nonprofits, our team has been working out of their passion for the cause, without pay. This crowdfunding campaign, however, will bring #WCM closer to some of its long-term goals which include: providing a salary for the core staff members, stipends for the chapter leaders, competitive base pay for artists and speakers who are a part of ongoing #WCM events, and hiring even more creative women to provide photography/videography services at events.

“This is only the beginning of our ultimate vision  for the organization,” says #WCM Founder Ashley Kervabon. “Longer term, I’d love to be able to get A-list celebrities involved in mentoring our artists and promoting the organization. It is also my ambition to award recording scholarships,  host songwriting retreats, own properties to accommodate touring women artists, and much more!”

#WomenCrush Music has entered the picture at a precise cultural moment when the value of supporting women is being emphasized by individuals and industries stronger than ever. At the same moment, this concern has brought to light the personal challenges and systemic obstacles many women still encounter in their careers. A recent study cited in Billboard reported that in 2017, 83.2% of artists in popular content were men and only 16.8% were women. Of the study’s sample of 2,767 credited songwriters, only 12.3% were female.  Statistics such as these have inspired #WCM to start The Crush blog, where readers can hear stories from women within the music industry; and The #WomenCrush Music Collective, a career-focused Facebook mastermind group. 

With the help of our generous donors, we can continue to spread our mission and create more opportunities & safe spaces for women songwriters everywhere. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks again for supporting #WomenCrush Music.

If you cannot donate to our campaign at this time, here are some other ways to get involved with #WCM:
⚡️Submit to play a showcase: https://goo.gl/forms/5whoXSkSS1qrO0Wj1
⚡️Connect with the community in person by attending our shows and networking events in your city! See all upcoming events here: https://www.womencrushmusic.com/events.html
⚡️#WCM is currently looking for writers for The Crush blog: https://www.womencrushmusic.com/blog
⚡️Other partnership opportunities: https://www.womencrushmusic.com/become-a-sponso...
⚡️Always stay in the loop by signing up for our newsletter: https://www.womencrushmusic.com/sign-up.html  

⚡️Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @womencrushmusic

story:
My name is Malik "The Freq" Moore. I'm a musician, songwriter and producer from Los Angeles, California, and I need your help getting my album across the finish line. I have recorded 9 original tracks that I am extremely excited to share with you. 

I'm asking people like you, who believe in the power of art, to contribute what you can to this endeavor. The funds will be used to mix, master and duplicate CDs for radio and promotional purposes. We will be having a small industry showcase with the goal of trying to get this unique and powerful music heard - these songs that I've poured my heart and soul into.  

The way I grew up in LA was tough and the environment was even more challenging. By the time I was 17, I was basically homeless. I didn't know what was going to happen, and I chose music to heal myself. I hope my music can help others begin to heal too.

I've been a professional musician for just over 20 years. I've had the privilege to be a part of many different projects across numerous stylistic genres. I've played alongside some of LA's best musicians in projects such as The Lions, The Bullets and local favorites, Mobtown and Ocean 11 . I've also had the pleasure of collaborating with Jamaican greats, such as Derek Morgan and Derrek Harriot. Perhaps the greatest highlight of my career was sharing the stage with the legend that is Prince Rogers Nelson. I've worked with many independent and major record labels through the years such as Dap Tone,  MCA and Stones Throw here in Los Angeles. These numerous experiences and opportunities have brought me to this point. Now the time has come for me to focus on my debut solo album.

In today's myopic music business, it is often difficult for artists to develop and follow their true artistic vision. This is why I'm asking you, my friends, family, collaborators and fans to help me get this music out into the world.  

If you can't afford to help financially, I understand. I'd still love to connect with you on Instagram. All the best and thank you. @malikthefreq.

story:
Help us to raise money for the Professional Performing Arts High School Choir as we prepare for our Winter concert featuring Schubert's "Mass in G".

The Professional Performing Arts High School works in partnership with the National Chorale, which provides vocal music instruction to the PPAS Vocal students. These students live throughout New York City and are accepted into the school through a series of competitive auditions.

Students perform throughout the school year in both solo and ensemble performances. In addition to performances at the Professional Performing Arts High School, the Choir has performed at David Geffen Hall, Lincoln Center, The National Arts Club, The Signature Theater and the Manhattan Theater Club; by invitation, for the NYC Department of Education’s School’s Chancellor, at the United Nations and the New York Stock Exchange in collaboration with UNICEF for the #Imagine and #childrenfirst projects, at the Invitational New York City High School Choral Festival at Hunter College/CUNY, and at the Dedication Ceremony of the Space Shuttle Enterprise at the Intrepid Air and Space Museum.   Students completing the PPAS/National Chorale Vocal Program will be qualified to continue their professional training as vocal music majors at a college or conservatory. National Chorale and PPAS are in their 9th year of Vocal Partnership.

The Professional Performing Arts High School has been ranked #2 performing arts high school in the nation.

story:
About Me

I'm Kathryn Mueller. I'm a Grammy-nominated freelance soprano, and I get to travel the United States singing with orchestras, choirs, and chamber ensembles. At concerts people often ask, "do you have an album I can buy?" and hence...

 

Love & Loss

Love & Loss is my first solo album, featuring some of my favorite songs and arias by Purcell, Handel and Bach. It includes Purcell's charming "If music be the food of love" and lovely "Evening Hymn," beloved arias by Bach including "Komm' in mein Herzenshaus" and "Phoebus eilt," Handel's devastating "Per te lasciai la luce," and "Quel fior che all'alba ride," which Handel later recycled into a Messiah chorus!

I recorded in May and September of 2018 in two acoustically beautiful halls: Moeser Auditorium at UNC and Fletcher Recital Hall at ECU. I had a fantastic crew of collaborators: Jennifer Streeter on harpsichord & organ, Brent Wissick on viola da gamba and baroque cello, Nicholas DiEugenio on baroque violin, and Stephanie Vial on baroque cello. Our production team was Nathaniel Yaffee, engineer, and Nathan Leaf, producer. Nathan and I have listened to the first edits on some of the tracks, and they sound GREAT. And the album artwork is by the very talented Rhian Swierat and is stunning.

 

Why I'm Asking You to Help

Love & Loss has been years in the making. I'm so proud of all the work that went into it, and excited to share it with the world. The total production cost of this album will be $6,800, and I am looking to raise the first $5,000 of that (or more!) with this campaign. Help me bring Love & Loss to life! With your contribution you can be a part of this project along with me, and you'll also get a choice of some great perks, from a sticker to a copy of the album, a sung greeting, an invite to the release listening party, or a private concert in your home. And the perks are all cumulative, i.e. with each contribution level you get ALL of the perks of ALL the levels below it!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word on social media, or tell your friends about the album. When you contribute, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you.

story:
Twas six months before Christmas, and all through the cafe

Susan and Graham were writing music to play.

Compositions were hung in the Dropbox sans cheer

For there was no one to hear them, except once a year.

 

When what to their tormented minds should arise

But a clever idea to share with youse guys!

So G in his kerchief and Suze in her cap

Set up a campaign and downloaded an app.

 

That’s right, y’all! We have a ton of new seasonal compositions and arrangements for your listening pleasure, and what better time of year to enjoy them than in the middle of a Texas summer? Furthermore, we are excited to make this a FREE event for all who want to attend!

 

So… if it’s free, why the IndieGoGo campaign? Well, we have some real expenses, namely space rental and musician pay, and we are hoping to convince you that a small investment to back this event will be worth it. And to sweeten the pot, we have some fun perks to offer.

 

The perks! How they sparkle! The verbiage - how witty!

The musicians like angels, the music well-crafted, original and yes, oh so pretty.

The audience, assembled with anticipation,

Will fill up their noggins with jolly creations.

 

Imagine! If you are responsible for picking seasonal repertoire for your church or school, you may hear something at our show that will fit you like your favorite ugly Christmas sweater! Our selections, and others that could not fit on the program, will be made available for purchase on our respective online sheet music stores in a twinkling! So...

 

On trios! On choirs! On ensemble rep!

Add jingle and jangle and joy to your step.

And now we exclaim, as we drive out of sight:

Happy Christmas to all, and to all a good night!

 

DATE

Sunday, July 28, 2019

 

TIME

3 pm

 

LOCATION

Trinity Church of Austin, 4001 Speedway

The audience, assembled with anticipation,
Will fill up their noggins with jolly creations. Imagine! If you are responsible for picking seasonal repertoire for your church or school, you may hear something at our show that will fit you like your favorite ugly Christmas sweater! Our selections, and others that could not fit on the program, will be made available for purchase on our respective online sheet music stores in a twinkling! So... On trios! On choirs! On ensemble rep!
Add jingle and jangle and joy to your step.
And now we exclaim, as we drive out of sight:
Happy Christmas to all, and to all a good night!
 
DATE
Sunday, July 28, 2019
 
TIME
3 pm
 
LOCATION
Trinity Church of Austin, 4001 Speedway

story:
As a tribute to our dear friend and brother, we’re putting together a Dave Lloyd tribute album.

This unique musical project will honor Dave, his music and his legacy, and benefit his daughters.

Dave gave so much to so many. He was such a bright light in this sometimes dark world, and, like him, his music soothed and healed and transported us to better places. This album will be a work of appreciation for him and the lasting impact he continues to have on us, his family and friends.

All proceeds from the album will be split equally between Dave’s four daughters to help them with college and living expenses.

We're trying to raise a minimum of $4,00.00 so we can give each of Dave's daughters $1,000.00. Of course, we'd love to raise much, much more! 

Whether we fall short of our goal or exceed it in a big way, ALL proceeds will go directly to and be split between Dave's 4 daughters. 

For helping us with this meaningful project, you will receive some truly outstanding items.

story:
Keep the flame alive of Pete Seeger & American Folk Music with Spook Handy’s most important CD yet!
 “Pete Woody & Me, Volume I – Keep the Flame Alive”

After playing alongside Pete Seeger more than 50 times from 2003 to 2013, I am   recording a CD and touring throughout the U.S., Canada, and other parts of the globe to share Pete’s songs, stories and message because  I am determined to “KEEP THE FLAME ALIVE."  I need your help!

A Shared Message
It may come as a surprise to those who know me and my mission that I knew very little about Pete Seeger before we met in 2003.  I had heard his name and knew he had written "Where Have All the Flowers Gone?" and "If I Had a Hammer," but I had no idea what an amazing human being he was.  After getting to know him, I agree with Harry Belafonte that Pete's image should be carved into Mount Rushmore.  Pete was as much the embodiment of the American Soul as the others represented there.

What got me most about Pete was his belief that we have all the tools we need to shape ourselves and our world into what we wish them to be.  For some, these tools are within our grasp.  For some, they are at arm’s length.  And for others, they are just beyond arm’s length.  But they are still attainable IF we work together.  That belief - that message - was embedded in all of Pete's songs and stories, all of his actions and in every interaction he had with others.  I share that belief wholeheartedly.  I feel it is so important that it MUST be made more present in our public consciousness.  So, I set out shortly after Pete passed to share that message everywhere I go.  It is the thread that holds the "Keep the Flame Alive" CD and the "Remembering Pete Seeger" World Tour together.

                       "Love Wins" Concert - September 11, 2011, Kimmel Theater, NYC

The Songs and the Artists

Here's what you'll find on “Pete, Woody and Me, Volume I – Keep the Flame Alive.”   It will be a collection of six Pete Seeger songs, two Woody Guthrie songs that influenced Pete, and four of my songs profoundly influenced by Pete.  All of them, in one way or another, sing of the tools available to us and where to find them. 


The dozen songs span the spectrum of old to new; songs sung in their familiar style or closer to Pete’s original style.  Some songs will be sung in a completely new way.  Some are pure fun.  Some are a call to arms.  Some are performed solo or with my band.  Some will feature special guests like:

  • David Amram (the human intersection of folk, jazz, classical, and movie music)
  • Freebo (bass player who played with Bonnie Raitt and many others)
  • Catie Curtis (acclaimed singer-songwriter)
  • The Local 1000 Traveling Musicians Union Singers
  • 23 young singers from Oklahoma
  • Paul Prestopino (who toured and recorded as a backup musician for Peter Paul & Mary and John Denver)
  • Ron Greenstein (bass player for the Chad Mitchell Trio)
  • and Bob Harris (who played on and produced Johnny Cash recordings).


You Can Help Keep the Flame Alive

With your help through this Indiegogo campaign, the CD will be distributed and promoted all over North America and beyond.  It will be supported by my “Remembering Pete Seeger” World Tour of all 50 U.S. states, all 11 Canadian provinces, and as many other countries as possible (and all 21 New Jersey counties) - in arts centers, concert halls and theaters, schools and senior centers, colleges and churches.  You can read all about it at www.spookhandy.com/wp/pete.  You can help Keep the Flame Alive with your support of this campaign.

                       

I will tell you all about How I Met Pete and "Founder’s Disease" in a future video - so stay tuned.


Above is a picture from the very last "Pete Seeger and Friends" concert.  At age 94 with his voice, dexterity and memory barely working anymore, Pete gave a concert of pure love and humanity.  It was the last time I saw Pete and in many ways it was the best concert he ever gave.  David Amram – recipient of the 2nd annual Pete and Toshi Seeger Power of Song Award - said this after Pete passed:

“Spook Handy honors the spirit of Pete Seeger, so excellently, by sharing the music with everyone - on stage and in the audience - in the same way that Pete did.  He makes music the star.  That’s why Pete loved to play with him so often.”  If any of that is true, it is because I learned it from Pete.

What We Need & What You Get

         To make this happen and do it right, I need your help.  Here are the numbers:

                       TOTAL BUDGET: $33,742 - OUR GOAL: Raise $20,000
                     ($30,000 will allow us to promote this CD much better)

$18,000 Recording & Mixing - includes costs for studio, producer and musicians. (Producer Bob Harris has recorded or produced Johnny Cash, Vassar Clements, Si Kahn, Joe Jencks, Girly Man, Mara Levine, and hundreds of others including more than a dozen songs that have charted in the top 10.)
$1,000 Mastering
$1,956 Royalties
$160    Copyright registration
$1,200 Artwork, Graphics, Photography and Layout
$3,426 Duplication of CD plus 12-page booklet of lyrics and stories
$5,000 Radio Promotion, Marketing, and other PR
$3,000 Tour Outreach Fund – allows me to bring the music to Senior Centers, Schools and other venues that bring the flame to those who can’t afford concert tickets.

If we do not reach our goal, all funds raised will go toward the completion of this project. Keeping the Flame Alive is too important for me not to complete, no matter what.

    


You Will be Rewarded With Perks

Your help will not go unappreciated or unrewarded.  Please take a look at the unique Perks listed on the side of the page.  Maybe you want to give CDs to your friends and family.  Everything can be autographed and personalized according to your instructions.

You Can Make a Lasting Impact

What's most important to me is that together we can make a positive impact in this world, however big or small, by helping Keep The Flame Alive of Pete's tradition.  Pete was once asked if he thought his work made the world a better place.  He said, "I don't know the answer to that question, but I know I have met my best friends along the way."  I know many of Pete's friends whose lives are better because of his work. 

How important will the impact be?  Pete also said that if humankind is going to survive another 50 years, it will be because people re-learn how to participate, cooperate, and find consensus on common goals.  One effective way to do this is to eat, work and sing together – starting as kids and all the way through every stage of life.  But we don’t want to just sing any songs.  We need to sing songs that reflect and promote values that build character and build society - not tear them down like so many popular songs today.

These songs need to be taught to audiences – especially children - so they can learn the words and meaning and sing along.  That’s why our CD will come with a 12-page booklet with lyrics and the stories behind them.  Your help can make this happen.

I want as many people around the world as possible to know about Pete Seeger, because so many of the issues he addressed in his songs are still among the hottest issues TODAY.  That’s why, with your help, our CD will be promoted throughout North America and beyond.  And to show that this style of music is alive and well I have updated a word or two in some songs, written new verses about the world we live in TODAY for songs like “Banks of Marble”, and written new songs that everyone can sing. Your help can make this happen.

In support of the CD, the "Remembering Pete Seeger" tour will keep alive Pete’s tradition of gathering, singing, and celebrating our shared values, landscape, history, and culture.  Pete's message and music need to be shared with people all across the world – young, old, black, white, male, female and everywhere in between. It cannot be limited to those who can afford to go to a concert.  Many of the people who need this message the most lack the means to buy a ticket. .  That’s why I put together the “Tour Outreach Fund” to Keep The Flame Alive at schools, churches, and senior centers that are underfunded. You can make this happen, too.


With help from you and enough people like you our project will come to fruition and we will KEEP THE FLAME ALIVE!

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is the best way to get a message out.  
  • You can spread the word by sharing the video and the link to this page. 
  • Post them on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+ and Google groups, and other social media.  
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out.

         

          After our set at the 2012 Corn Festival in Beacon, NY, Pete hightails it behind
          the merch tents to avoid the  crowds - photo by Emily Brady.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! If you have no clue what this page is about or who we are, we’re going to fix that right now. Our name is Pitch Slapped and we are a 14-member co-ed A Cappella group from Berklee College of Music which is located in Boston, Massachusetts. We like to sing, and you can describe our genre as jazz-influenced, contemporary A Cappella music. Since we were founded in 2006, we have done a lot of pretty crazy cool things. We have made appearances on NBC’s The Sing-Off and America’s Got Talent, won the International Championship of Collegiate A Cappella in 2011 and 2014, and this past May, completed a two-week tour through various parts of California (during that tour we also had a video of one of our arrangements go viral, hitting 2 million views in just 3 days).So yeah, with all of that being said, Pitch Slapped wants to do more crazy cool things, and that’s why we have this page! We have been offered a ridiculously amazing opportunity to travel to Xi’an and Beijing, China and perform at different middle schools and high schools in the cities! Who wouldn’t want to travel to a different country to do what they love and help others at the same time? Are we right? During our time in China, we will be performing and working with middle school and high school students on music as well as acting as student ambassadors for Berklee.

 

Though the company that has invited us, our lodging, food, transportation throughout the cities, and attractions are all covered. The only cost we are responsible for is our airfare. That’s pretty great right? Well, with your help, we can do it!

What We Need & What You Get

Pitch Slapped is a self-funded group, meaning that we gig in order to make the money we need to do the activities that we want. This past school year, we saved up all of the money we earned to go on our California tour which took place in May. During our tour in California, we were offered this trip to China and there was no doubt in our minds that we wanted to go. We knew that we would have to figure out how to raise money for China since we used what we had for California. So, we decided to come to Indiegogo and take our chances making some money through donations.

 

In order to make it to Xi’an and Beijing, we need to raise $15,000. This is how it is broken down: One round-trip ticket to Xi’an, China is $1,000. There are 14 members in our group meaning we need $14,000 for plane tickets. You must then include the taxes and fees that are charged for creating this campaign and the stamps and packaging that will be required to send out the perks we are offering you. So, this is why we are asking for $15,000. If we do not meet our $15,000 goal, we will use the money we have raised for our plane tickets and come up with a bunch of ways to raise the rest!

 

What’s in it for you? Oh there’s a plenty! For those that donate, there are a list of perks to choose from including:

A shoutout on our Facebook page

A video of our tenor, Tyler Pinder-Hudson singing his fastest vocal run

A Pitch Slapped goodie basket with t-shirts, CD’s, and stickers

The gift of being an Honorary member of Pitch Slapped.

 

These are only a few of the perks that we have! The rest are on the right side of this page so check them out!

The Impact

Pitch Slapped’s best and most rewarding experiences are the workshops we have done for middle school and high school students. During our time at these schools, we warm-up with the students and listen to some of the songs in their repertoire to give some suggestions and critiques that can better their blend, sound, and overall stage presence. If asked/allowed, we teach them one of our own arrangements to challenge and improve the students sight-reading skills as well as other aspects of music such as dynamics and interpretation of the piece. Lastly, we close out our time in these workshops by singing the arrangement altogether and by answering questions about college and specifically Berklee College of Music. Having the opportunity to work directly with students and give them advice for their music and for their lives is so special because they whole-heartedly listen and appreciate the time and experiences that we share. Watching them learn and receive what we are trying to give them and enjoying each and every moment is what keeps the joy in this group.

 

This is how our workshops have impacted us, and how they have impacted students around the United States. Now, we are ready to take what we have and bring it outside of the U.S. Middle-and high-school students deserve to have mentors and people around their age that truly believe in their talents and their minds. This can only spread a message of love,  encouragement, and positivity which is what we are striving to do because the world is in need of all of these things.

 

We have successfully done workshops and performances at a multitude of high schools in New York, Boston, New Hampshire, Idaho, New Jersey, and most recently, California, where we had a 2-week tour traveling to 12 schools from San Francisco to Los Angeles. Workshops play such an important role in our purpose as a group and to take them international to make a difference in a few children’s lives would be a great moment of accomplishment.

 

Risks & Challenges

Traveling with a student-run group of 14 people to another state is difficult, but traveling to a different country? That is rarely heard of. Most collegiate clubs are happy to host their own events on campus. We have been offered this phenomenal opportunity to travel outside of the United States to share our gift of music to students and their parents in Xi’an and Beijing. This is our shot at breaking the invisible barrier for student-run organizations. This tour to China can not only be a moment of giving back, but a moment of helping others move forward. We as a group are very aware that this tour is a privilege and do not take that for granted, but this trip is not just for us to say we went around the world. This trip is our way of giving back to students, the Berklee community, and the Pitch Slapped members before us. This is our way of proving that we have come so far because of the love and support we have received for the past 10 years, and to show other clubs that it is possible to do what has never been done before. Yes, there are risks taking 14 college kids to China; teaching them to adapt to the Chinese culture, performing in front of a new crowd of people who probably don’t know who they are and may not like what they do, and returning to school and to work. But are these challenges worth going? Apparently, or else we wouldn’t be asking for your help! Pitch Slapped understands all of the potential risks of traveling to China,but they are ready and excited to share their music to the people of Xi’an and Beijing!

 

Pitch Slapped’s overall goal is to bring our jazz-influenced, contemporary A Cappella music to new places and new heights.

Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.

Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute to this Indiegogo, that is perfectly fine! We can still use your help and here’s how! You can share our page on your own social media accounts, follow us on the social media platforms, and spread the word to anywhere and everywhere you can! There is so much power in a simple “share”.

Facebook: @Pitch Slapped https://www.facebook.com/pitchslapped/?fref=ts

Instagram: @pitchslappedacappella https://www.instagram.com/pitchslappedacappella/

Twitter: @PitchSlapped https://twitter.com/PitchSlapped

Snapchat: pitchslapped6

Website: pitchslappedacappella.com

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/SlapThatPitch

Having the opportunity to work directly with students and give them advice for their music and for their lives is so special because they whole-heartedly listen and appreciate the time and experiences that we share. Watching them learn and receive what we are trying to give them and enjoying each and every moment is what keeps the joy in this group. This is how our workshops have impacted us, and how they have impacted students around the United States. Now, we are ready to take what we have and bring it outside of the U.S. Middle-and high-school students deserve to have mentors and people around their age that truly believe in their talents and their minds. This can only spread a message of love,  encouragement, and positivity which is what we are striving to do because the world is in need of all of these things. We have successfully done workshops and performances at a multitude of high schools in New York, Boston, New Hampshire, Idaho, New Jersey, and most recently, California, where we had a 2-week tour traveling to 12 schools from San Francisco to Los Angeles. Workshops play such an important role in our purpose as a group and to take them international to make a difference in a few children’s lives would be a great moment of accomplishment. Risks & ChallengesTraveling with a student-run group of 14 people to another state is difficult, but traveling to a different country? That is rarely heard of. Most collegiate clubs are happy to host their own events on campus. We have been offered this phenomenal opportunity to travel outside of the United States to share our gift of music to students and their parents in Xi’an and Beijing. This is our shot at breaking the invisible barrier for student-run organizations. This tour to China can not only be a moment of giving back, but a moment of helping others move forward. We as a group are very aware that this tour is a privilege and do not take that for granted, but this trip is not just for us to say we went around the world. This trip is our way of giving back to students, the Berklee community, and the Pitch Slapped members before us. This is our way of proving that we have come so far because of the love and support we have received for the past 10 years, and to show other clubs that it is possible to do what has never been done before. Yes, there are risks taking 14 college kids to China; teaching them to adapt to the Chinese culture, performing in front of a new crowd of people who probably don’t know who they are and may not like what they do, and returning to school and to work. But are these challenges worth going? Apparently, or else we wouldn’t be asking for your help! Pitch Slapped understands all of the potential risks of traveling to China,but they are ready and excited to share their music to the people of Xi’an and Beijing!  Pitch Slapped’s overall goal is to bring our jazz-influenced, contemporary A Cappella music to new places and new heights. Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.Describe your plan for solving these challenges.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are not able to contribute to this Indiegogo, that is perfectly fine! We can still use your help and here’s how! You can share our page on your own social media accounts, follow us on the social media platforms, and spread the word to anywhere and everywhere you can! There is so much power in a simple “share”.Facebook: @Pitch Slapped https://www.facebook.com/pitchslapped/?fref=tsInstagram: @pitchslappedacappella https://www.instagram.com/pitchslappedacappella/Twitter: @PitchSlapped https://twitter.com/PitchSlappedSnapchat: pitchslapped6Website: pitchslappedacappella.comYoutube: https://www.youtube.com/user/SlapThatPitch https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/763275565/...

story:
Mantra is Magic!  Welcome to our Sukhagogo campaign to help us fund our second mantra rock album inspired by the Sacral Chakra!

About Sukha:

We are mantra rock band based in beautiful Southern California founded in 2011 by husband and wife team Sukhman and Sukhmani.  We chanted and provided music for over 300 yoga classes and events in the last year alone!  All while recording our first mantra rock album "Rise" with brilliant co-producer Ram Dass Khalsa inspired by the Root Chakra. 

We are so grateful the first album has been so well received by our fans and the community!  We want to keep the momentum going as we received a small window of opportunity to record the core tracks for our second album at an amazing studio in Northern California in May 2016!

We want to continue to share the vibrations in our own Sukha style and help everyone to rock their mantra! We need your help to make this dream a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $27,500 to record 8 songs with Ram Dass Khalsa all of the amazing musicians from our last album with a few new surprises!!  In addition to the core members of Sukha...Ram Dass, Tripp Dudley, Jared May and many more with help up continue to elevate the Sukha vibe!  We also need funds for recording a 3 song video for YouTube.  We also need funds for pressing and marketing the album so the album will be heard!  See the details below!

In return, you will receive some great little perks for any donation (see the details below)!

The Impact

Check out our video to see what some of our fans say!

We love what we do and want to share the love!

We have lifetimes of musical experience in Sukha and want to continue elevating the music to new heights!

Mantra is magic and can change lives...we are living proof!

story:
Project Summary

Hello! My name is Tareq Abuissa, a composer who graduated from Columbia in Music & Mathematics. After creating a demo album, I teamed up with producer Spencer Horstman to bring the 10 songs to top form. We've logged 136 studio hours since March, recorded by Oliver Ignatius at Mama Coco's Funky Kitchen in Brooklyn, NY.  We're now mixing and mastering the album, Echoing Green, featuring the following musicians:

Tareq Abuissa: vocals, cello, bass guitar, acoustic guitar, piano
Jacob Sunshine: electric guitar
Spencer Horstman: synthesizer
Phil McNeal: drums
Diana Flanagan: vocals
Maximillian Zooi: bass clarinet
Corey Dansereau: trumpet
Andy Clausen: trombone

Track Listing

1. Lost & Found
2. We Three Dolphins
3. Black & Blue
4. Fall Through
5. Swan Song
6. Or Not
7. Lucky Sevens
8. You're Broken Too?
9. Snowing in the Spring
10. Perfume Dream

Expense Summary

By contributing to this campaign, you can pre-order Echoing Green. The album may be self-released, though I will also pitch it to labels.

story:
What's The Dealio?

Myself (Joey Glacken), Rob Arnold (Chimaira,Six Feet Under),Greg Burgess (Allegaeon), Mike Heller (Fear Factory, Malignancy) Sean Zatorsky (Sinsaenum, Chimaira, Daath) and Adam Biggs (Rivers Of Nihil) have all combined our musical talent and are currently working on a crushing new album. We are currently going into this independant and financing the project out of our pockets and are offering preorders and perks to all. We will be tracking with Jon Howard (Threat Signal) at his studio and having it mixed by Mark Lewis (Cannibal Corpse, Devildriver, Whitechapel) for an early 2017 release.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $15000 to cover most of the recording, mixing and travel to do so. Anything above and beyond that will be used to produce music videos and an overall better package for you to enjoy. With each perk you will also receive two mp3s the day of the contribution to get you rocking out right away. One for the song The Great Reawakening and another unreleased track called Muhammagedon.

The Impact

This album is currently in the process of being written and will be released regardless. YOU can help us complete it and get it into your hands much sooner than later.  We currently have about 6 songs written and hope to double that soon. Your contribution makes all the difference in the world to us and we can't wait for you to hear what we've been working on.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all of you will have the means to contribute to our campaign but would like to help us out. We hugely encourage everyone to share this campaign to your friends and family or to someone you know who you think would be interested in what we are doing! There are many tools available on this page to help spread the word about us and make some noise about this campaign. We would be so grateful if you used them to help us spread the word!

Thank you so much for your love and support!

-Joey, Rob, Greg, Mike, Sean, Adam

story:
Bishop Lake : The Story!

In 2011 Bishop Lake was founded by vocalist Zane as a studio project, releasing a 4 song EP in 2012.

In 2013 Bishop Lake added guitarist David Prince and began writing new music, later that year they enlisted drummer Scott Prian to drum for live gigs which extended into Scott producing their first full length album " The Meritocracy of Hell". "Meritocracy" was released Halloween night of 2014.

After several successful live shows in 2015 (with drummer Joey Stewart), they enlisted Dave Jackson to pound the skins for 2016 and to write new music. Later in 2016 saw the addition of Sam Abernathy (Uberstout) on guitar alongside David Prince. This leads us to now, the imminent release of "When Lucifer Fell"!

Far from being a mere studio project, this album contains the collective vision of all members in order to bring you the best dark heavy metal rock and roll album of 2017. If you are a fan of Danzig, Ozzy era Black Sabbath, Volbeat or Ghost, then Bishop Lake is the band for you!

We have worked incredibly hard to write the best music we can, and we know this release will become part of your music rotation for years to come. Support indie rock! Support Bishop Lake and make metal great again!
