story:
About this Project

**Thanks everyone for funding me to 50% of the new goal! Macedonia, here we come!**

I've been a passionate fan of the Kushiel series since I first picked up Kushiel's Dart almost a decade ago. 

  • My name is Christy Carew Marshall, and I'm a composer for film, TV and the concert world.
  • Back in 2007, I created The Eglantine Adept Myspace page with music inspired by the series. I was encouraged to create a full length album, but never followed through - better late than never! I have the full support of the amazing Jacqueline Carey on this project. If you're curious about some of the original music I created, here is a Soundcloud link: https://soundcloud.com/christycarew/sets/old-ku...
  • The FAMES Project Orchestra in Macedonia is an absolutely incredible orchestra filled with amazing players. I am so proud they will be bringing the music to life!

THE FIVE TRACKS I WILL BE RECORDING!

Turn And Face Me (1.5 minutes) - Action. Adventure. Battle. A completely new re-write of this epic scene, one of the more popular tracks from the myspace days!

The World Of Kushiel's Legacy/Phedre's Theme (1.5 minutes) - imagine what the Main Title of the movie would sound like. Sweeping, epic, romantic

Escape From La Dolorosa (1.5 minutes) - Suspenseful and thrilling. 

The Journey To Saba (3 minutes) - epic journey! Traveling through many regions, exotic, sweeping, 

Banishing An Angel (3 minutes)- even MORE epic, culminating in the name of G-d being spoken.

What I Need & What You Get

  • Looking to raise $4480 total. Indiegogo doesn't let you change your total. Most goes to the recording session, and Mixing and mastering of the album by Grammy-nominated recording and mixing engineer, Jeremy Underwood. Also, recording and photography during the session.
  • There are numerous award levels and perks, from a $1 contribution to $100. Check them out under perks!
  • I won't be making any money personally off the project - it will all go to the production of the music and you won't be charged for the music. It comes as a reward for helping fund the live players. 

The Impact

We may not have a film or TV series for Kushiel's Legacy, but as fans we can have a score to the books! This is a fun way to participate in the fandom and get some incredible music bringing your favorite characters and scenes off the page and into your ears. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this page with your friends who are fans of the books!

  • Get the word out and make some noise!
  • You can share using the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks again for your help. 

MORE TO THE STORY:

Hi, I'm Christy Carew Marshall and I make music. Or as I sometimes say, I draw little black dots and lines on special paper. I live in beautiful Burbank, CA with my amazing husband and gorgeous children.

I've been a composer and pianist for 26 years. I work full time at a fantastic production music library as their In House Composer, as well as serving as a Music Director and Producer. I also pursue my career in film music and concert music.

Right now, the project I'm pursuing has its roots in a book I discovered 10 years ago! Out and about in LA shortly after moving to this fine city, I went to see a movie at the Arclight Hollywood, and went into the Borders that used to be across the street. In the staff recommendation section, I found Kushiel's Dart by Jacqueline Carey. I devoured this incredible novel in one night and the entire series in a week. I quickly became completely obsessed with the story, the characters, the intricate world building. I was super inspired to start writing music based on the scenes and characters I saw in my mind's eye. 

I created a Myspace page that had thousands of followers/fans at one point (yes, Myspace was once a thing.) Even the incredibly gracious and talented author of the books, Jacqueline Carey,  links to the old Myspace page on her website! The fans encouraged me to make a full length album and release the music commercially. Life intervened - many years, a lot of projects and two babies later, here I am! I always meant to revisit this music and write brand new tracks - better late than never! Obviously, I've grown a great deal as a composer since these initial efforts. I can't wait for fans of the series to hear what I have come up with. 

I have brand new music inspired by five incredible scenes in the series - 10.5 minutes of new music. I'll be recording full orchestra in Macedonia, and that is the first project I am seeking to fund here on Indiegogo. I will not be selling the album or making any financial gains from it - the album will be part of the reward of being a patron and funding the recording session. Thanks for your interest and support and THANK YOU again to Jacqueline Carey.

story:
Hello Everyone

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Jacob Martin formed in early 2011 in Nashville,Tennessee through the underestimated power of Craigslist. Converging from all parts of the country, Jacob Martin (vocals/rhythm guitar), Josh Carlson (drums/background vocals), Mike Guy (bass/background vocals), and Jeff Coggins (lead guitar) came together to form a powerful, melodic band that captivates both country and rock listeners.

 

  • Since forming, the band hit the road and built a following that would later land them opening slots for Keith Urban, Brantley Gilbert, Big and Rich, Kellie Pickler, Lee Brice,  Thomas Rhett, and Dustin Lynch, among many others. JMB's debut single from their 2013 limited edition EP, "Wraparound Porch," peaked at #42 on the Music Row chart after being released to national radio in January of 2013. The follow up EP, 'Look At What You Started,' released on October 21, 2014, with a debut iTunes country album chart position of #26.

  • We are starting this IndieGoGo so we can take things to the next level in our career. We have so much new music to get out to everyone but as we all know everything take money to make things happen. But we cant do it without your help.

 

  • With your help we will able to release our new EP and along with all of the support we have here in Nashville from the music industry. We can take our new EP to radio and have it played all over the country. But to get on radio takes allot of promotion.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we are offering for your help

  • Right now we are looking to raise $12,000 this will enable is to hire a top tier producer to produce and record our new music, mixing and mastering of our new EP, radio promotion and publicist for our new EP. Production cost of a new video and also making CD to send out to out fans

 

  • We are offering some unique perks for your pledges. Special thank you and liner note mention  on our CD, Digital download of our new EP when it is finished, Be first to download our new single before anyone else has it,  Private concerts, signed drum heads, signed guitars....

 

  • If we don't reach our goal we will use what funds we have to do as much as we can but every little bit helps and we really do appreciate it.

The Impact

 

  • Each contribution is essential to everything we are doing. It helps with radio promotion which is one for the biggest parts of getting our music to radio.

 

  • Our first debut single from out 2013 limited edition EP, "Wraparound Porch," peaked at #42 on the Music Row chart after being released to national radio in January of 2013. The follow up EP, 'Look At What You Started,' released on October 21, 2014, with a debut iTunes country album chart position of #26.

 

  • We know with out our fans we would be nothing so we try to keep in touch with everyone we can and keep them updated personally. Country music fans are some of the best in the world and with out you we can't succeed.

Risks & Challenges

Our primary risk and challenge is timing. Finding the right producer and engineer that can work us within a mutually agreeable time frame can be very challenging. Also, mixing and mastering the new album, as well as creating new album artwork and printing CDs takes time. Taking time away from playing shows and working limits us, so we have to plan this just right.

With all of these things taking planning and coordination, we hope we don't run into any issues. Everything is looking great so far.

  • We love to play music and we love to play for the fans we dont ever want to stop.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute we understand. Any sharing of our IndieGoGo campaign is always a great help.

  • Spread the word and hopefully just hopefully we might get nominated as New artist of the year for the CMT Awards
  • And don't forget to use the  Indiegogo share tools!

From the bottom of our hearts we really do appreciate your loyalty, friendship and most of all Love and Support.

Also, mixing and mastering the new album, as well as creating new album artwork and printing CDs takes time. Taking time away from playing shows and working limits us, so we have to plan this just right.
With all of these things taking planning and coordination, we hope we don't run into any issues. Everything is looking great so far.
We love to play music and we love to play for the fans we dont ever want to stop.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute we understand. Any sharing of our IndieGoGo campaign is always a great help.

Spread the word and hopefully just hopefully we might get nominated as New artist of the year for the CMT Awards
And don't forget to use the  Indiegogo share tools!

From the bottom of our hearts we really do appreciate your loyalty, friendship and most of all Love and Support.

story:
My name is Lavender Fields,

I am a singer-songwriter, musician and a music producer. Nature and music are the things I am most passionate about in life. 

 I wrote a song called "7th Generation"  in which I talk about the urgency that our planet Earth is currently facing.  I feel personally responsible for inspiring and initiating a change that can create solutions to help preserve our beautiful planet for the generations to come. 

Combining a compelling visual interpretation with the sonic message, we can create a powerful piece of art that inspires people all over the globe to take action now and to slow down, reverse and stop the process of environmental destruction that is currently taking place on the planet at alarming rates....

My goal is to raise $2000 which will be used for filming a music video for the song "7th Generation". Here is how this amount will be utilized:

$1000 will be used to hire a professional cinematographer who will direct and produce the video

$500 will be used to rent the professional camera equipment and logistic costs

$400  will go towards post-production and color correction of the music video

lastly $100 is the Indie GoGo campaign fee.

In return for your generous donations YOU will receive:

1) A series of piano lessons or an Ableton music production lessons with Lavender Fields either in person or via SKYPE.

2) A free download and a signed hard copy of the upcoming album Lavender Fields Forever" by Lavender Fields, due to be released on February 14th, 2017...

3) Your name in the credits of the music video and your presence during the filming of the video.

AAAAnd a great load of Good Karma for the efforts to preserve out Planet for future generations!

PLEASE HELP me to make some NOISE about this campaign and share it with your friends, family and those who you think truly care about the cause!!!  SHARE SHARE SHARE!!! Together we stand STRONG! Let's protect our BEAUTIFUL PLANET!

SINCERE HUMAN THANK YOU!!!!

Lavender Fields

story:
Making music is what I do since I was three years old.

It is who I am. 

I have had some major upheavals in my life in the last 5 months and I  feel the only way to deal with this is in a positive way is to write,  produce and record my own album.  I need to make this record.

I have a lot to get out of my system.

I am the mother of two amazing children, (Caia is 11 and Xavier is 5) and for various reasons, this July will be the first time in 11 years that I will find myself alone with nothing to do and nowhere to go.

Your funding this will enable me to buy the recording equipment that I need to make it.

It has taken me years of work to be confident enough in my engineering skills to do this.

This album will be me hammering down a wall inside of me.  On my own, in a house in a beautiful landscape in the middle of nowhere.  Well, a ten-minute drive from a village but I don't drive.

It might be a gentle hammer whispering in the dark planting seeds and examining the soil.   It might be a hammer filled with rage charging forward to free myself from these earthly shackles.  It will be raw. It will be me. Alone.  Looking for a chink of light. Looking for something else. Looking to change frequencies. Looking to dream. Looking to have fun, to find a reason to celebrate this life.

The plan is to have it mixed,  mastered and on vinyl by November.

My last album Dancing Suns, Goldmine: http://dancingsuns.bandcamp.com/  was crowd-funded and made possible by the amazing people who supported me and my music. The warmth and support I received absolutely blew my mind and the reviews were amazing too.

I have been trying to figure out how to make a new album for a good while now.  I  applied for Arts funding and didn't get it. I knew that crowdfunding was an option but thought I would look at other possible options first as I felt weird asking people to fund me.

Eventually, I have come around to the idea as I feel wonderfully supported by friends and people who enjoy my music and I thought this is a good way to get the album made.

I have been releasing records independently since 1999.

You can find some of my links here.  www.ninahynesmusic.com and here https://ninahynes.bandcamp.com/
Thank you so much for supporting my music and an independent artist.

story:
The Graveface Museum 

The Graveface Museum is a labor of love and an ode to all things odd. I (Ryan Graveface) moved to Savannah in 2010 and opened Graveface Records & Curiosities in the Starland District in 2011. I also moved my independent record label operation and have started two more labels since being here. I've been collecting morbid historical artifacts, horror sci-fi pinballs, death row artwork from infamous criminals and more basically all of my life. It's always been a dream of mine to have a means of sharing my collection publicly and I couldn't imagine a more perfect city to do this in. 

When I first moved to Savannah the city was genuinely weird. It felt like one of the last remaining authentically strange places in the country which is part of what drew me in. One of the main reasons I left Chicago was to escape the rampant gentrification of unique neighborhoods that I cherished; unfortunately, Savannah is heading down a similar road. The city I adore is losing its character and charming grit to craft cocktails and overpriced food popping up on every corner. My goal with the museum is larger than putting interesting oddities on display; it's to offer something deeper and more impactful than what's currently being offered in the city. My hope with the museum is to get people talking or at least thinking about larger topics like morality, life, death, problems we still face with the criminal justice system, experiencing things of the past, and appreciating history to help reflect on today's culture. Or you can just go look at cool stuff and play spooky pinball. 

What We Need & What You Get

The barebones: $18,500
There are many expenses when you're trying to build a museum out of a giant, historic warehouse. The barebones goal is what we need to completely finish the build-out. The goal with this build-out is to actually keep the aesthetic and all the original components of the building; we're fixing several components to make sure it's safe and installing a few things to appease the city. 

Outfitting and Displays: $29,000
So once the build-out is done all the fun stuff can start going into homes but wait-- what homes? This next goal will go toward building displays, framing artwork, and overall preparing to open and ensuring the experience is as next level as possible. 

Opening: $47,500
The overall goal is $47,500 to open the museum. 

We are trying to open the museum on/around Halloween and with your help, we can make it happen. If the goal is not met whatever funds are raised will still go toward the eventual opening of the museum.

The Impact

Savannah is known as being "America's Most Haunted City." Personally, I find this to be a joke. That phrase was created by the ghost tour industry in conjunction with the board of tourism as a means of getting people here. And golly gee it has worked. I'm sure they didn't realize 30 years ago the city would be completely different in 2019 and thus, not feel even remotely spooky in most parts of the city anymore. That being said I feel it's totally salvageable and we hope to make a MASSIVE impact in regards to all of this with the museum. The Graveface Museum will have authentically spooky stuff (not fake scary garbage the tourist industry sells) presented in an artistic and fun way WITH context. This will NOT be gory for the sake of gory.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're broke as a joke but want to help please consider sharing this campaign, listen to the bands we release records of, listen to the soundtracks we release, come into the shop, spread the word. There are people that come to the shop daily that ask how long we've been around. When I say almost a decade they seem shocked. "How could I have not heard about you sooner?" 

Word of mouth is everything to me. I cannot afford to advertise. Also, follow us and the museum on social media. Those numbers DO oddly help somehow. 

https://www.instagram.com/graveface_museum

story:
Hi and thank you for being here!

Welcome to the crowdfunding campaign for my debut album Lion of Love. My name is Carl Jonas and I’m a Swedish singer songwriter. Music has always been a part of my life, but it wasn’t until I had a spiritual awakening in 2007 that I realized that it was truly my purpose. It was literally like the flipping of a coin where I from one day til the next started to write songs in a way I had never done before.

 

I didn't imagine at the time that it would take more than a decade before I would be ready to fully embody this purpose. However it wasn't until last summer that I wrote the song Lion of Love which turned out to be the key that finally enabled me to embody it. That song established a leap in my ability to both express and personally embody the realisation that broke through in 2007. Since then I’ve written a string of new songs that I’m so eager to share with the world. This album is therefor basically the flowering of the realisation that broke through around 13 years ago. If you choose to contribute to this campaign, you'll therefor help me manifest what I perceive to be the very purpose of my embodied existence.


If you resonate with what I’ve been sharing and want to contribute to my campaign just choose the option that speaks to you and I will be so very grateful for your contribution. Cause you will not only help me generate and align all the aspects needed for recording and spreading my music in the best way possible. You’ll also help me show my inner skeptic that the way of the heart works beautifully as long as I follow it. Another great way to show your support is to share this message wherever you believe it will be appreciated and valued.


What I Need & What You Get

As an emerging and independently empowered artist I rely fully on receiving backing from people that wants to support me. That makes crowd funding a true blessing, cause it enables me to reach out to you and ask for your support. At this stage there are a lot of things that need to be put into place. Apart from the cost for renting a studio, hiring a producer and musicians, there are costs for mastering, artwork, distribution, homepage, campaign gifts, travel expenses. Basically all of these costs can be modified to match an existing budget. However the more funds at my disposal the more resources can be deployed in each step of the project resulting in a greater end result.

 

If you choose to contribute to my campaign you're not only helping me realize my greatest dream. You're also actively making a difference in this world by being part of a community based, co-creative event with the only motive to manifest and spread this music. Being funded this way also gives me a greater freedom to stay true to the vision of my heart without the need to compromise, which is very very valuable.

 

If there are any specific perks that you wish to see being offered, please let me know and I will do what I can to make it available. But honestly I believe that the biggest take away for contributing to my campaign is the fact that you will be part of manifesting these songs so that you can both enjoy them for yourself, help me realise my greatest wish as well as making them available to the rest of the world.

 

The Impact

This album is about embodied self-realization. It’s arising in response to a desire to nourish this realization to unfold where ever it is ready to unfold. By choosing to contribute to this campaign you will therefor not only help me realize my highest wish, to get my music out into the world. You will also play an active part in a co-creation that I believe will be a contribution to the shift in human consciousness that is indicative of our times. For the last 13 years I have, on and off, done my best to share this realization with people by mainly using dialog. My experience is that when I perform these new songs my ability to get people into the vibrational reality of this realization is greatly enhanced compared to when I use dialog alone. And this has barely started


Risks & Challenges

The most prominent challenge is to gather the right team. Apart from myself the most important person for this team is a producer that has the knowledge, the experience and the ability to generate the vision into a well crafted creation. Of course I have my eyes and ears open in every direction and I believe that this campaign may function as a platform from which I can reach and connect with the right people. If you happen to have any ideas or leads for me to check up please let me know.


Other Ways You Can Help

Lastly, if you feel that you want to help but don’t have the resources to make a contribution it’s always highly appreciated if you share this campaign where ever you believe it will be appreciated and valued. Either by using the Indiegogo share tools, or what ever works best for you. Thank you so much for your time!

story:
The time has finally come to produce a full album of my Jewish music. The album will feature the liturgy of the Friday night prayer space with some additional surprise bonus tracks.   

A couple of years ago, I, along with a small team, launched a prayer project called Na’or. Here we would experiment with chanting, meditation, and musical prayer as a way of rediscovering a connection to the text, to ourselves, to the Infinite, and to each other. 

Now, after praying together with nearly a thousand souls, it is time to produce this music and share it with anyone looking for a spiritual uplift to their Shabbat experience.

About Me

I am a rabbi and musician in Los Angeles, CA, with a passion for creating transformative prayer experiences. Over the years of leading prayer gatherings and facilitating spiritual retreats, I have been writing music to awaken connection to the ancient Jewish prayer liturgy. I have rabbinic ordination from the Ziegler School of Rabbinic Students (2018), and hold a BFA in Performance. I run a monthly musical Shabbat called Na'or in Venice Beach, CA, and work as a school rabbi at a Jewish Day School.

My Live Album Project

I'm raising $16,000 to create a high-quality, live-recorded album that will capture the depth of the spiritual experience with a group of musicians and voices. We'll also film the live recording to produce music videos for each track. 

The Impact

My hope is that Jewish prayer becomes more delicious, accessible, and deeply meaningful for us today and in generations to come. Your contribution helps make this dream possible, allowing Jewish prayer music to thrive and inspire us all. 

Use of Funds

Here is a breakdown of how the money will be used:

Audio Equipment Rental   $1200

Engineering, Mixing and Mastering   $4000

Musician Fees   $4000

Venue Rental   $1000

Studio Rental   $1000

Charts   $800

Album Creation and Distribution   $1000

Platform Costs and Other Misc   $1000

Graphic Design   $500

Video Production   $1500

Total:   $16,000

These funds allow me to create a 12 song live-recorded album. If we are able to raise more money, I will use additional funds to record more songs, both live and in studio, to be released throughout the year. If we raise less, we will work with what we have to create the best quality we can. 

Timeline

December - Campaign begins

February - Campaign ends

February/March - Practice with musicians

April/May - Live rehearsal with musicians in LA

May/June - Live recording in LA 

June/July - Editing, mixing, and mastering

July/August - Printing, packaging, promotion and distribution

Sept - Final delivery

 

Thank you so much for your support on making this album happen! This project has taken many years to craft and it is incredibly exciting that we are getting ready to record it now.

Again, thank you for your generous support.  I am so grateful. 

B'tehila (in praise), 

~R' Aviva Funke

story:
About: Julian & VIBES ON THE RUN!

  • Hello from Boston, my name is Julian Loida and I'm a Midwestern boy who slowly made his way to the East Coast over the past 8 years to follow my dream of becoming a great percussionist & artist.  The Arts Fuse generously wrote,"Percussionist, composer, and programmer Loida is easily one of the Boston music scene’s most valuable players."   After years of being in bands, going through conservatory training, and becoming a part of the music community in New England, my dream has come true to release a solo vibraphone album.

  • I have launched this fundraiser 'Vibes on the Run!' to complete the album release including final production costs and expenses behind touring with a vibraphone (a large mallet percussion instrument comparable to size of your dinner table).

  • This campaign is important to me because it's about bringing music to people, to communities, to listeners.  It's about funding an experience so that audiences in folk venues & jazz clubs as well as high schools in St. Louis & colleges in Tennessee will experience a celebration of calm, self-awareness, and introspect through the musical performance of brand new original music.

  • You, the contributor, will receive photo & video updates showing the ways in which your hard earned money was used to give audiences this unique experience.  Depending on your level of contribution, you will receive stickers, the music of Wallflower, posters, sheet music, drum lessons, up to even House Concerts for your generous contributions.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Vibes on the Run! is raising $5,000 to cover final production costs and touring expenses behind the release of Wallflower.
  • The entire recording & promotion budget of Wallflower is over $16,000.  The recording process was launched after Nine Athens Music generously donated $3,000 in the fall of 2018 with the remained $13,000 self-funded. 
  • The fall tour expenses are currently just over $3,000 including tour to North Carolina, Midwest, and development in Paris & London.  

 

​Goals:

    • MAIN GOAL: $5,000 to fund a tour to North Carolina, Midwest, and development in Paris & London, and final production costs.
    • REACH GOAL 1: $8,000 to fund a West Coast Tour in 2020 & attend industry conferences Folk Alliance International in New Orleans & PASIC in Indianapolis.
    • REACH GOAL 2: $10,000 to fund a small European TOUR in 2020
    • REACH GOAL 3: $12,000 to fund a full Midwestern tour down to TX, Alabama, Georgia, FL

     

    ​Let's break this down even further:

    • Studio Cost: $1,200 (including overnight stay for producer & video)
    • Producer Fee: $2,000
    • Mixing: $1,600 (4-days)
    • Sound Manipulation: $900 (2-days)
    • Mastering: $650
    • Travel & Food: $150
    • Album Artwork, Design, Social-Media graphics, Tour Poster: $555
    • Printing 1,000 CDs; $1,570
    • Video Editor: $954
    • Promotion Company: $5,000
    • Social-Media Promotion: $180
    • TuneCore: $200 (tracks album & releases to ALL online streaming services for 5 years)
    • Website Update: $100
    • Album Release Photos: $200
    • Project Manager: $270
    • Spring Tour Expenses: $1,200 (rental car, Lyfts, gas, parking)
    • Summer Tour Expenses: $1,300 (rental car, Lyfts, gas, parking)

     

    Fall Tour Expenses:

    • 1-week Tour to MIDWEST: STL-CHICAGO-NASHVILLE
      • Travel: $500 (flight, gas)
    • 10-Day Tour: BOS-NYC-DC-NC
      • Rental car: $534
      • Gas, Food, Tolls: $300
    • Vermont TOUR: 2 Shows
      • Rental car: $150
      • Gas & Tolls: $50
    • Vibes Upkeep:
      • Restring: $25
      • Travel Bags: $800

     

    2-Week European Development:

    • Flights to Paris/London: $450
    • Trains, taxi: $250

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Would be A-MAZING if you can help get the word out!  By sharing this page to your socials, ISG story, forward to friends, you can help encourage other to support this campaign thus reaching the goal and help share music with the world!!

    Would be A-MAZING to have you at any of the upcoming shows!  See tour & pick up tickets here: JulianLoida.com/shows

    Would be A-MAZING if you can LIKE my artist page on Facebook, FOLLOW me on Instagram, Follow me on Spotify, Subscribe to my Youtube channel & get connected!

     

     

    ABOUT Julian:

    Called a “thought provoker” by Boston Voyager, Julian Loida is a Boston-based percussionist, composer, and producer. Loida’s musical curiosity and open-mindedness has propelled him towards a wide-range of sounds, genres, and artistic endeavors. He’s performed jazz, folk, and classical, collaborating with dancers, visual artists, songwriters/composers, and musicians of all stripes. The thirst to participate in and experience this range of sounds is partly a product of Loida’s synesthesia. Music is a full- body experience for him, with sounds often invoking involuntary sensations of color, texture, or even taste.

    Loida often writes and arranges for his projects and ensembles (the Cuban/Brazilian band INÃ, jazz quintet Mojubá, chamber-folk band Night Tree), and his music has been featured in film. His interdisciplinary projects aim at breaking down artistic barriers. The evening-length solo-project Recital of Dedications incorporates speech, visual media, and music into a series of dedications to individuals, historical moments, and more. In 2018, he released the album Bach LIVE!, featuring J.S. Bach’s music arranged for percussion. Loida’s upcoming 2019 release, Wallflower, marks his solo-album debut, and also provides the clearest distillation of his voice as a composer to date.

    Loida has toured internationally as a featured artist at Korrö, Sweden’s largest folk music festival, and played some of the most prestigious music festivals in the U.S. such as Spoleto, New World Festival, the Exit Zero jazz festival, Caramoor American Roots Festival, and Round Top Music Festival. He has performed with groups such as Alarm Will Sound, the Callithumpian Consort, and the Chautauqua Symphony Orchestra.

    As an educator, Loida shares his scores and deep rhythmic knowledge with students of all ages. In 2017, he received his Master’s Degree in Classical Percussion from New England Conservatory. 

     

    Learn more at JulianLoida.com

story:
Aloha, 

We are a newly formed band of well seasoned troubadours. Each of us individually found a passion and calling for creating music from a young age, and we have all spent years mastering our crafts. Now together with a clear vision and intention, we are The Uprising Movement!

 


We are honored to serve as a catalyst for TRANSFORMATION and awakening and walk this path with you all.  As a band our MUSIC encompasses all that this amazing JOURNEY called life presents. 

"Our call to ACTION and focus is one to INSPIRE. Our tools for teaching are powerful music and lyrics that tell the story of our time. This allows our MESSAGE to come from the HEART and help bring people together to uplift their spirit. We aim these tools as weapons in a battle to EMPOWER all generations to feel PURPOSE, deeper meaning, and to restore CONNECTION with the earth, fellow man, self, and SPIRIT."

-RECOGNITION (Founder)


With this campaign, we aim to raise the funds needed to record the songs we have been performing for the past year.  Our in-home studio and rehearsal space has helped us cultivate the songs that we are now ready to take into a professional studio. Our debut single We Are Love is just an initial taste of the many styles and sounds that we have created.  With your help, we can record, mix, and master the works that we are proud and excited to share.  This record and its story speaks to all and has been a lifetime in the making.

 

(Feat Tim Snider from Medicine For The People)

 

 
    Unable to donate? Here are some...
 
  • If our music and movement resonate with you, please pass this on and share it with your circle.
  • Connect with us on Social Media, the links are on the top of the page!
  • Much love and Appreciation! 

  • THE UPRISING MOVEMENT

story:
I have achieved so many of my dreams. I've traveled and sung on incredible stages but one thing has eluded me... A SOLO ALBUM!!! This is my dream and because I have nurtured and protected it for so long I don't want to release it unless I can do it up to the standards that I have set with my live performances and my all around ethic. This is why I need your help to create an album that is as alive, vital, important, and true as you our I.

I don't fit into the pop machine. I am an outlier in this industry. My success depends on the people that still love real music and want to hear something that makes them think and feel. I write for us. I perform for us. I want this to be a record for us. 

Your support will allow me to maximize this release.  I have so much to share and with your help I will be able to launch my career as a solo artist and do my part to help inspire the world through music.

How the Funds Will be Applied

  • Studio time
  • Session musicians
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Packaging Design
  • CD Pressing
  • Radio Promotion
  • Publishing Administration
  • Hard Drives
  • Website Updates
  • Tour Support
  • Miscellaneous Expenses

story:
Be sure to click "Get This Perk" to get the perk you want, or click "Add Perk" during the checkout process. And, keep tabs on how the campaign is going either by checking back here or by liking my Facebook page

You can also follow me on Twitter

About Me

I'm a guy who grew up in the quiet corner of Connecticut who loves coffee, bacon, Jesus, Boston sports team, and my family. Not always in that order. I chase two young kids around at home and herd about fifteen rogue teenagers in my youth group. I drive all over New England for my day job and down to St. Paul's in Brookfield to lead music. 

I've been playing music since 4th grade. I started out playing horn in the school band, but always wanted to learn to play guitar. One summer while in high school, my dad surprised me with a guitar as a birthday present and I started teaching myself how to play. Within a few weeks I was helping to lead music at church and I've felt called to do that ever since.

About eight years ago I began writing some of my own music for worship. Once I felt I had something worth sharing, I began playing my song at the church where I currently serve as a worship leader. It turned out that people actually connected with it and that encouraged me to keep writing. 

 

Over the next couple of years I continued to write songs, and slowly introduced them to my church. Soon after, I began seeking out opportunities to share my music, but kept running into road blocks. It seemed like my music wasn't meant to go anywhere outside my home church.

From time to time, someone at church would ask me about one of my songs and where they could find it to listen to again. Sadly, the songs didn't 'exist' outside of our Sunday morning services. It made me think that maybe I should write more songs and try to record an album. 

But it was during this time that my family went through a difficult season with the loss of two pregnancies.  I nearly gave up writing music. It was difficult to continue to write songs of praise when it was the last thing I felt like doing. It was a long struggle to get back to a place where I wanted to write songs again.

Then God's light broke into my darkness and I decided it was time to get back into songwriting. I dusted off some old ideas and even signed up for a songwriter's retreat. It was there that I met the guys from the band Brothers McClurg. I had to opportunity to get fresh ears on my songs and it inspired me to begin writing again.

Earlier this year, I had several people ask me again about my songs, all within a matter of a few weeks. My wife suggested that maybe it was God trying to tell me something. I didn't believe it.

 

Eventually, God broke through my stubbornness and a plan began to come together for recording my songs. Chris and Anthony from Brothers McClurg have a studio up in Batavia, NY called Old Bear Studio. I'll be partnering with them on this project. They're going to help me finish up the songs for the EP, produce & record the album. I can't wait to get to work with them.

The studio is a little outside Buffalo, NY and I'm headed there at the end of January to spend a week recording the album. After that, the good folks at Old Bear will work their magic and send me the completed songs. From there I'll be making the CD's and getting ready to release the album in May 2018.

 

What I Need & What You Get

Getting a project like this going is a lot of work, and costs a bit of money. I'm looking to raise $8500. The funding from this campaign will go towards the cost of producing, recording, & mastering the album. There are travel expenses to the studio in Batavia, NY, costs involved with producing the actual CD, plus some administrative costs involved in producing the album and running this campaign. Finally, there are some costs in making the album available for purchase. 

I've put together a number of different ways you can support the album - from a basic pre-order of the EP, either in digital form or a physical CD, to getting some personalized memorabilia or a t-shirt. There will be an album premiere concert next May, you can have me write a song just for you, or I can come lead worship at your church or home event. Check out all the perks listed on the right hand side of this page.

You might be concerned with what will happen if you contribute and the project isn't fully funded, which is completely understandable. I believe that I am answering a clear call that God has placed in front of me and I trust that He will find a way to make this happen. I plan to see this project through to the end. If I'm not 100% funded at the end of the campaign, I'll continue to move forward as far as I can. It might take longer than I plan right now, but I do believe by God's grace that this project will get completed one way or another.

 

The Impact

These are songs that I lead at my church regularly; songs that people in my church use to worship and connect with God. I've also been asked by folks outside my faith community about using these songs in their churches. I want to equip my congregation, and others around me, to have these songs to take with them to worship our Savior throughout their week.  With your support of this project, I'll be able to finally put these songs into a form that can be used by others - and who knows what plans God has for this project beyond that.

 

Risks & Challenges

This project is my top priority - right after my wife, my kids, my full time job, my job as a worship leader, and my job as a youth leader. There's a lot to accomplish over the next few months and many challenges ahead, but I have a great team supporting me on this project, mainly my amazing wife and kids. I also have those at my home church, St. Paul's in Brookfield and others within my community who are backing me with their prayer and support throughout this project. 

The studio time is booked and the concert date is set. I will be faithful to the call given to me and get the job done. I know that with your support, both financial and in prayer, that this album will be completed for God's glory.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If after all this, you'd love to support me, but can't afford a financial contribution right now - you can still help! Please share this with family and friends who might be able to support this project. You can click the links above to share via email or on Facebook. While you're there, you can like my page. I'd love to connect with you there. 

Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Joshua's first LIVE ALBUM in almost 10 years at the Tower of David, Jerusalem

2009 is when it all began for me. It was the year I was moving to Israel. My dream was to move to my mother's home country (my inheritance!)and be a light unto my people. I knew MUSIC was my tool so we recorded a very low-budget live album, called "Bo Yeshua". That's what started it all! Now over 9 years later, 4 studio albums later and with over 30 MILLION YouTube views on our page... it's time to do a LIVE album again. THIS TIME in the old city of Jerusalem!

Although three years ago I began a great relationship as a songwriter with integrity music, I'm still an independent artist. That means, I still don't have a record company to back this album. BUT WAIT, I have you! I've always had you. In fact almost every one of my albums have been crowdfunded right here on Indiegogo. But this is the biggest project we've ever done. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP! This event is the first of its kind. To our knowledge, never has a Messianic-Jewish gathering like this happened before within the Old City Walls! Imagine folks from all over the country and the world coming to the City of David worshiping in one accord. Sounds pretty biblical to me! I know this is the year, and time to hold this event and I thank you for helping us accomplish such a holy, for-such-a-time-as-this event. 

Please note, contributions are not tax deductible. Thank you for investing in us and helping reach across the world from Jerusalem.

Praise awaits you, our God, in Zion; to you our vows will be fulfilled. Psalm 65:1 

He put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God; Many will see and fear and will trust in the Lord. Psalm 40:3 

You Can Help Us Hit Level 3

  • Level 1: $100,000 Funds the full live video & audio production, budget for the full band, helps us fly in our artists, to rent/purchase the best equipment and helps us turn the City of David (and the old city) into a House of Worship! 
  • Level 2: $120,000 Allows us to hire the best audio and video engineers/producers to take this live album to Disc, DVD & YouTube to share with the world! Helps print our first run of discs & DVD's. 
  • Level 3: $150,000 This is reaching high! BUT we'll be recording a shabbat album next spring and will not be crowd-funding again. *IF our funds exceed our Level 2 goal during these fall feasts, all addition funds will be directed to complete the classic "Shabbat Album" featuring my sweet Messianic Singer friends from Israel and the nations. 

Peace and Chag Sameach (Happy fall feasts) from the Galilee of the Nations, Israel

Check out some music that YOU'VE helped us make!

 
 
​

story:
A little bit about me...

I'm a solo acoustic blues/roots artist from Melbourne, Australia. I've been playing guitar for 27 years, and have also been singing & writing songs for 20 years. During this time, I've recorded & released 8 albums, played thousands of shows all over the world, and have been fortunate enough work with some incredible producers, engineers & musicians over the course of my recording career. In addition to this, I've also been fortunate enough to do some extra cool things like open up for & sing with The Doobie Brothers, and win the Singer/Songwriter Of The Year title at the most recent Australian Independent Music Awards.

I'm extremely pleased to be working on my next studio album, which will be followed by a 20-date national release tour covering metro & regional centres all over Australia. For this project, I will be making every effort possible to push the creative envelope further than I've ever done before as an artist. As the things that inspire me the most at the moment is the attempt of creating some completely new & innovative sounds for modern-day blues/roots music, and also the acoustic guitar in general.

Yes, I'm fully aware that these ambitions are incredibly lofty, so therefore I am asking for your help to assist me with bringing these ultimate visions to life.

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $20,000 all up from this campaign, which will go towards the costs of making the album to the absolute best of my ability, and also taking it on the road around the country to present it in a live setting. This will equate to around half of the total desired expenditure, as I am planning on covering the rest of these costs myself.

Here's a breakdown of estimated costs-

Recording/Mixing-$8,000

Session Musician Fees-$2,000

Mastering-$1,500

Artwork/Graphic Design-$1,000

CD Pressing x 1000 Units-$1,800

Limited Edition 12-inch Vinyl Pressing x 100 Units-$3,000

Music Videos x 3 Singles - $3,000

T-Shirt Printing x 100 Units-$2,000

Album Release/Tour Publicity-$8,000

Tour Travel Costs-$4,000

Digital Marketing(Spotify/Apple Music etc)-$5,000

TOTAL ESTIMATED EXPENDITURE - $39,300

If I can achieve this target, I'll be able to deliver all of these things to the highest level of quality possible. However if I do fall short with hitting it, I'll still do my absolute best to deliver as many of these things as feasibly possible.

And now to the fun stuff, what are you gonna get? I've thought long & hard about the types of rewards I could include as part of this campaign, and have even asked many of my existing fans already about the types of things they would like to receive. So I'll be including a wide range of things like digital downloads, signed CD's, signed vinyl, signed T-Shirts, house concerts, intimate dinner table performances, guitar/singing lessons, in-depth music career consultations(for aspiring artists/musicians), studio session sit-ins, your name in the album artwork liner notes, live video performances of your favorite song, me writing & recording a song just for you(preferably with your lyrics), handwritten signed lyric sheets, golden ticket(which gives lifetime free entry to any/every show anywhere in the world), and last but not least, I am EVEN offering to shave off my beard(this is at extreme resistance & reluctance...).

The Impact

As an artist, it has always been of upmost importance to me to attempt the practice of presenting records & live shows that are deeply engaging, emotional, passionate, inspiring, thought-provoking & ground-breaking for listeners/receivers. I certainly don't think I'm anywhere near close to achieving my full potential with any of this, but with this particular project, I will make every endeavor possible to bring this vision one step closer to life in a way that I've never done before.

Naturally, breaking new ground in the blues/roots genre and also with how the acoustic guitar can sound & be played is extremely important to me. It'll never be up to me to decide if I achieve this or not, however with your assistance on this project, I truly feel that I'll have the greatest possible chance of realising this vision & sharing it with as many folks throughout the world as possible.

Risks & Challenges

Beyond the obvious financial challenges with making a record of this magnitude, the greatest risk with this project I face from a creative/musical perspective is to create something that is too grandiose & lacks musical direction & purpose. This often happens when artists attempt to break new ground with genre-bending ideas etc. It's an incredibly challenging undertaking to make bold & new statements in music, especially in genres that have been around for long periods of time, and where there's the obvious thought process of "it's all been done before". I am of the belief that with my experience, passion, tenacity & great interest in musical growth & diversity, I'll be able to overcome this challenge.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this campaign financially by purchasing one of the many rewards, all good! One way you can help is by spreading the word about this campaign with shares on your social networks, and telling a few of your friends about it that might be at all interested. Of course I'll appreciate any type of assistance possible in relation to getting the word out about this campaign!

story:
My name is Ryan Flores, and I'm an independent singer-songwriter based in Toronto, very inspired by the pop and R&B music world, but also heavily rooted in acoustic guitar. As a songwriter, I like to take complex things we experience in life, such as love, friendship, and overthinking to create captivating melodies. 

 

 

Introspective: characterized by examination of one's own thoughts and feelings.

Introspective is a collection of 10 songs that I've written over the years, each holding their own special place in my heart. All of these songs were a result of silent and solo introspection over the highs and lows, the simple and complex, the laughs and cries, and the satisfaction and stresses of life. My hope is that if I make my thoughts and feelings vulnerable to the world, you see yourself in these songs. Whatever it is that you're feeling or going through, just know that you aren't alone.

The team supporting this project consists of a group of highly talented individuals that I have hand-picked. The collective contribution of these individuals will take these songs from their demo beginnings to a record.

But it doesn't end there. You! Yes, all of you can make a huge impact and help make this project a reality. To make this possible, I need your support. I made it as far as I am now as an artist because of the people that believe in my music. I would forever be grateful if you joined me on this journey in making this project happen. Your gift to me will be my gift to you.

 

 

Introspective will serve as a new foundation for me as a singer-songwriter, and you could play a big part in helping me build that foundation.

As an independent artist and singer-songwriter, there are three things I want to achieve with my music. I want to inspire people to pursue their passions, whatever they may be against whatever obstacles may stand in their way. I want to encourage people to share how they feel and not to bottle their emotions. I powered through difficult situations by writing about them, and I hope you somehow see yourselves in these songs as well. Lastly, I want to represent the cultural minorities. It was all those Fil-Am YouTube artists that inspired me to become a singer-songwriter. They played a big part in representing minorities in the YouTube music community and the music industry as a whole, and I want to continue that movement.

This album goes much further than the collection of songs that it is. Your support and generosity will go a long way in helping Introspective reach its full potential and fulfill its purpose.

 

 

Recording a full-length album isn't an inexpensive endeavour. There are so many components and associated fees that go into making an album. I want to make sure that I put out my best work. To give you an idea of the costs that go into making an album, and to be fully transparent as to where your donations will go, I've attached a pie chart that summarizes the budget for this album.

 

Any contribution you make to this campaign is so greatly appreciated. My gift to you revolves around exclusive merch, early content release, and other personable perks! If you aren't able to donate, you can still make an impact on the success of this project by sharing this Indiegogo campaign and making others aware of it. Increasing this project's awareness and reach will only help to fuel its success. Share it via social media, by phone, by e-mail, or good ol' word of mouth!

For your support, for listening, and for being part of this journey, thank you so much! Now, let's make this record!

 

 

YouTube (Music): http://www.youtube.com/ryanflores/
YouTube (Vlog): http://www.youtube.com/rfloresvlogs/
Facebook Page: http://www.facebook.com/ryanfloresmusic/
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/ryanrgflores/
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/ryanrgflores/

story:
Short Summary

Thanks for supporting us.  We love you

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $5,000. This goes towards getting us back in the studio and finish recording the 2nd half of the record. Then we will use the other half of the money for mixing and mastering to make this record up to the standards of our previous material
  • Check out our perks, there's something for everyone.  The "Pre Sale Love" is just good ole fashion donation, but I mean...  work with us in a session, buy our vinyl package, get a signed CD - there's so much you can do.  Know that we appreciate it all very much
  • If we exceed our goal, there's a few things that the band will use the money towards.  We need new stage lights and Steve needs a new bass head.  

Please spread the word on this one

We get it if you're poor, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Click that share button to let everyone know what we're working towards achieving.  ?

story:
Ninichi and Xelafish is a collaboration between composer Ninichi and writer & mixed-media creative Xelafish primarily to develop fun and entertaining original instrumental sheet music collections for musicians as well as release recordings and tales from a fictional world where magic and music combine!  

The themes of N&X collections will be based around an online ’Ninichi and Xelafish’ sheet music shop set in an alternate reality 1890 where magic is cast not through spoken word spells or incantations but through Melodic Enchantments played on musical instruments.  You can find out further details about our background and the motivations for the project at www.ninichiandxelafish.com/about2019

The Light And The Dark Indiegogo Campaign will launch:

A full Ninichi and Xelafish online Music Shop

Our first Collection of Sheet Music 'The Light And The Dark' arranged for Piano Solo, Violin and Piano (Also works as Violin Solo + Backing Tracks), and Violin Duet

A Narrated 25 minute Audiostory of The Light And The Dark over 15 Original Pieces

A 4-track Live EP played on Violin & Piano

Thankyou for visiting our page and for all the support!

For full details and images of the perks please see the 'Rewards' section. Though in summary The Light And The Dark campaign perk option are as below:

There is a choice of 3 arrangements for the sheet music PDF or Printed Collections:

 

 

Lottie Greenhow and Eve McGrath play the Violin Duet arrangement of: 

Firedance from The Light And The Dark:

 

The Ninichi and Xelafish store of our alternate reality 1890 is located on Baalzephon Street (now Weston Street), London and is run by Store Manager Zesper!

Zesper runs the N&X Newsletter and the N&X social media accounts and you can follow more of his activities and antics through cartoons by brilliant associate illustrator Plunderbadger via those platforms!

Twitter: @NinichiXelafish

Instagram: @NinichiAndXelafish

Facebook: fb.me/NinichiXelafish

Mailing List: www.ninichiandxelafish.com/subscribe 

Zesper communicates from 1890 through to 2019 via a Violin Melodic Enchantment that he performs on his 1890 Typewriter.  This allows it to connect via a viewing portal to a 2019 laptop.  You can tell messages are sent by Zesper in the newsletter or on social media as they will always appear in typewriter style font! 

Please bear with us as we train him up on the internet!

 

The Light And The Dark is a Fable from the world of N&X set in ancient times where an Object of Power: The Emerald Amulet unleashes unending fog and a Necromancer.  It falls to an unlikely friendship to avert this somewhat undesirable situation!

We will be releasing it as a 25 minute long narrated tale set to 15 original virtual instrument orchestral tracks.  There will also be a LIVE EP of 4 tracks played on violin and piano.

Pianists and Violinists will be able to play these pieces through three different arrangements available in PDF or Printed form:

The list of pieces contained in The Light And The Dark is below that take listeners and musicians on a journey through the fable.  It features Journey Into The Unseen which was chosen as our Campaign Launch Track in the video at the top of the Campaign!

 

 

The campaign is hugely important to us to reach out to anyone interested in encouraging the making of music and supporting a platform that assists this in a creative and engaging way.  Our hope is when learning instruments - the context, mystery and quirkiness of our pieces create an engaging and inspiring world to practice music through.  

Through launching via Indiegogo - it also allows us to assess how much interest there is in the different collections and rewards we offer and plan our initial print runs to reflect this.

 

To achieve the N&X launch and deliver all the elements of The Light And The Dark we would need £25,000.  This covers:

LIVE EP - Studio Hire and Production

AUDIOSTORY - Recording, Arrangements, Sound Effects, mixing and mastering

MUSIC BACKING TRACKS - Virtual Instruments, Mixing and Mastering

REWARDS FULFILLMENT - Producing and delivering Campaign Rewards

BUSINESS SET UP - Company Setup Fees, Operations Software

BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT - Consultant, collaborator and time developing the sheet music, the collections and the world 

WEBSITE - Costs of Website and Domain services and shop construction

INDIEGOGO FEES - Indiegogo percentage from the campaign

MARKETING - Promoting the store and collection on completion

GRAPHICS AND MATERIALS - Materials costs for design and craft element

 

We have a series of Stretch goals if we were to exceed the campaign target.  Each would allow implementation of further ideas to be executed within the world and our websites and social media, the collections, or the audio though we would channel the focus of each into a specific area:

£30,000: STRETCH 1 - UPGRADED SOUND LIBRARIES AND BACKING TRACKS

STRETCH 1 will allow further investment in higher quality instrument samples to provide a higher quality of backing track plus stretch design elements and features within the collections!

£35,000: STRETCH 2 - THE LIGHT AND THE DARK MEDLEY

STRETCH 2 A special 'Light and the Dark Medley' will be created and recorded and released for all arrangements

£40,000: STRETCH 3 - MUSIC VIDEO for 'THE LIGHT AND THE DARK MEDLEY'

STRETCH 3 will allow foremostly an accompanying video to be devised, shot and edited that would be devised specifically for the 'Light And The Dark Medley' track

£47,500: STRETCH 4 - NEW MUSIC COLLECTIONS AND BONUS TRACKS

STRETCH 4 means work commences on arrangements for additional instruments depending on demand, further bonus track ideas and preparations for future collections!

£55,000+: STRETCH 5 - N&X LAUNCH EVENT

- STRETCH 5 would lead to an N&X / The Light and the Dark Launch Event in London! 

 

 

We aim to fulfil all rewards in December 2020 though if unsuccessful on 11th November 2019 in reaching our goal, we will make a decision on whether to:

(a) Apply a one-time extension to the campaign to attempt to reach the goal

(b) Close the campaign and we intend to fulfil all rewards where contributions have been placed. Though we will update with any time extension on reward delivery in case we explore other additional funding approaches to bridge the shortfall to get the best result we can for the project

We will notify anyone who has contributed asap at the end of the campaign on any decisions in this area.

 

Any support to the campaign will have a huge impact in allowing us to deliver this first collection and a supporting online music shop and structure to anchor The Light And The Dark and future collections.

We strongly believe there is potential for a sheet music centred project on a theme of magic to be something fun, imaginative and mischievous and be enjoyable and rewarding for current and future  generations of musicians.

If there is enough interest in the project and the pieces we will continue to evaluate arranging for further instruments and ways we can outreach the music of Ninichi and Xelafish further to promote the magic of friends, families and communities making music together. 

 

Reaching The Music Community

A significant risk with the project, particularly at this stage is whether we can reach enough piano and violin musicians interested in playing this music!  Any help or support in sharing and connecting with musicians who may be interested in supporting the project and giving pieces like Journey Into The Unseen a try is very much appreciated.  We have both been involved in music and the arts for a number of years and have identified key communities we intend to reach out to and are hopeful that we can generate enough interest in the music.

Timescales and Delivery Dates

Although we have planned the work involved from the end of the campaign to the estimated delivery dates of 2020 there is always a chance of unknown unknowns from supplier and collaborator availability to illnesses to any process requiring more time than expected to get as we would like.  We will update on any developments that affect delivery and these will always be in the interest of delivering the best outcome we can.  Considerable time and care has already been taken to create a prototype or a demo of all the rewards so we have taken steps to reduce the amount of unknowns in 2020 to mitigate this.

 

We would absolutely love it if you are able to contribute. Any amount helps and all of your support and encouragement is really appreciated. 

If you do donate, please leave a comment so we know what to improve and to tell others why you’ve participated.

There are also many other ways that you can continue to support us:

SHARE

Share the campaign via social media and email. Tell people why you’re excited about what we’re up to and invite them to be a part of this musical and magical journey.

On social media, use #findthefable #thelightandthedark #ninichiandxelafishand tag us @ninichixelafish on Facebook and Twitter and @NinichiAndXelafish on Instagram

FOLLOW US

Twitter: @NinichiXelafish

Instagram: @NinichiAndXelafish

Facebook: fb.me/NinichiXelafish

Also join our email list, invite others to do so as well and stay in the loop at: 

www.ninichiandxelafish.com/subscribe 

VOLUNTEER

Write to us! If you want to volunteer and help us with the campaign or as we launch and grow do let us know! All helping hands are welcome!
story_txt: Ninichi and Xelafish is a collaboration between composer Ninichi and writer & mixed-media creative Xelafish primarily to develop fun and entertaining original instrumental sheet music collections for musicians as well as release recordings and tales from a fictional world where magic and music combine!  The themes of N&X collections will be based around an online ’Ninichi and Xelafish’ sheet music shop set in an alternate reality 1890 where magic is cast not through spoken word spells or incantations but through Melodic Enchantments played on musical instruments.  You can find out further details about our background and the motivations for the project at www.ninichiandxelafish.com/about2019The Light And The Dark Indiegogo Campaign will launch:A full Ninichi and Xelafish online Music ShopOur first Collection of Sheet Music 'The Light And The Dark' arranged for Piano Solo, Violin and Piano (Also works as Violin Solo + Backing Tracks), and Violin DuetA Narrated 25 minute Audiostory of The Light And The Dark over 15 Original PiecesA 4-track Live EP played on Violin & PianoThankyou for visiting our page and for all the support!For full details and images of the perks please see the 'Rewards' section. Though in summary The Light And The Dark campaign perk option are as below:There is a choice of 3 arrangements for the sheet music PDF or Printed Collections:  Lottie Greenhow and Eve McGrath play the Violin Duet arrangement of: Firedance from The Light And The Dark: The Ninichi and Xelafish store of our alternate reality 1890 is located on Baalzephon Street (now Weston Street), London and is run by Store Manager Zesper!Zesper runs the N&X Newsletter and the N&X social media accounts and you can follow more of his activities and antics through cartoons by brilliant associate illustrator Plunderbadger via those platforms!Twitter: @NinichiXelafishInstagram: @NinichiAndXelafishFacebook: fb.me/NinichiXelafishMailing List: www.ninichiandxelafish.com/subscribe Zesper communicates from 1890 through to 2019 via a Violin Melodic Enchantment that he performs on his 1890 Typewriter.  This allows it to connect via a viewing portal to a 2019 laptop.  You can tell messages are sent by Zesper in the newsletter or on social media as they will always appear in typewriter style font! Please bear with us as we train him up on the internet! The Light And The Dark is a Fable from the world of N&X set in ancient times where an Object of Power: The Emerald Amulet unleashes unending fog and a Necromancer.  It falls to an unlikely friendship to avert this somewhat undesirable situation!We will be releasing it as a 25 minute long narrated tale set to 15 original virtual instrument orchestral tracks.  There will also be a LIVE EP of 4 tracks played on violin and piano.Pianists and Violinists will be able to play these pieces through three different arrangements available in PDF or Printed form:The list of pieces contained in The Light And The Dark is below that take listeners and musicians on a journey through the fable.  It features Journey Into The Unseen which was chosen as our Campaign Launch Track in the video at the top of the Campaign!  The campaign is hugely important to us to reach out to anyone interested in encouraging the making of music and supporting a platform that assists this in a creative and engaging way.  Our hope is when learning instruments - the context, mystery and quirkiness of our pieces create an engaging and inspiring world to practice music through.  Through launching via Indiegogo - it also allows us to assess how much interest there is in the different collections and rewards we offer and plan our initial print runs to reflect this. To achieve the N&X launch and deliver all the elements of The Light And The Dark we would need £25,000.  This covers:LIVE EP - Studio Hire and ProductionAUDIOSTORY - Recording, Arrangements, Sound Effects, mixing and masteringMUSIC BACKING TRACKS - Virtual Instruments, Mixing and MasteringREWARDS FULFILLMENT - Producing and delivering Campaign RewardsBUSINESS SET UP - Company Setup Fees, Operations SoftwareBUSINESS DEVELOPMENT - Consultant, collaborator and time developing the sheet music, the collections and the world WEBSITE - Costs of Website and Domain services and shop constructionINDIEGOGO FEES - Indiegogo percentage from the campaignMARKETING - Promoting the store and collection on completionGRAPHICS AND MATERIALS - Materials costs for design and craft element We have a series of Stretch goals if we were to exceed the campaign target.  Each would allow implementation of further ideas to be executed within the world and our websites and social media, the collections, or the audio though we would channel the focus of each into a specific area:£30,000: STRETCH 1 - UPGRADED SOUND LIBRARIES AND BACKING TRACKSSTRETCH 1 will allow further investment in higher quality instrument samples to provide a higher quality of backing track plus stretch design elements and features within the collections!£35,000: STRETCH 2 - THE LIGHT AND THE DARK MEDLEYSTRETCH 2 A special 'Light and the Dark Medley' will be created and recorded and released for all arrangements£40,000: STRETCH 3 - MUSIC VIDEO for 'THE LIGHT AND THE DARK MEDLEY'STRETCH 3 will allow foremostly an accompanying video to be devised, shot and edited that would be devised specifically for the 'Light And The Dark Medley' track£47,500: STRETCH 4 - NEW MUSIC COLLECTIONS AND BONUS TRACKSSTRETCH 4 means work commences on arrangements for additional instruments depending on demand, further bonus track ideas and preparations for future collections!£55,000+: STRETCH 5 - N&X LAUNCH EVENT- STRETCH 5 would lead to an N&X / The Light and the Dark Launch Event in London!   We aim to fulfil all rewards in December 2020 though if unsuccessful on 11th November 2019 in reaching our goal, we will make a decision on whether to:(a) Apply a one-time extension to the campaign to attempt to reach the goal(b) Close the campaign and we intend to fulfil all rewards where contributions have been placed. Though we will update with any time extension on reward delivery in case we explore other additional funding approaches to bridge the shortfall to get the best result we can for the projectWe will notify anyone who has contributed asap at the end of the campaign on any decisions in this area. Any support to the campaign will have a huge impact in allowing us to deliver this first collection and a supporting online music shop and structure to anchor The Light And The Dark and future collections.We strongly believe there is potential for a sheet music centred project on a theme of magic to be something fun, imaginative and mischievous and be enjoyable and rewarding for current and future  generations of musicians.If there is enough interest in the project and the pieces we will continue to evaluate arranging for further instruments and ways we can outreach the music of Ninichi and Xelafish further to promote the magic of friends, families and communities making music together.  Reaching The Music CommunityA significant risk with the project, story:
Short Summary

Muddy High Heels Entertainment, Inc., is a non-profit company founded by a talented singer/songwriter and the author of the book, Muddy High Heels: 14 Lessons Learned from my Breakdown, Breakup, and Breakthrough. The purpose of this company is to produce performances that cleanse the soul of all women who have experienced abuse at the hands of a male. The performers are low-income, Black, single moms who have experienced physical, emotional, verbal, sexual, financial, and spiritual abuse but no longer want to be defined by it. When the founder dealt with the abuse she experienced as an adolescent, she felt compelled to share with other women how she found healing. The songs these performers share will inspire healing and self-confidence in all women across the globe who also have experienced abuse at the hands of a male. The music video that is produced from the funds of this campaign will help mothers find the internal strength to take back their power, capture resilience, and redefine their worth. With funding from contributors, MHHE will (1) coach and mentor the performers; (2) teach them how to monetize for wealth creation; and, (3) produce a music video for purchase.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding at the level of $13,000. These funds will be used to create and produce our first music video of the six (6) performers we coach, mentor, and train. The song for the music video is an original, Woman of Destiny (available on itunes), that the Executive Director of this non-profit co-wrote and recorded the lead vocals back in 2001. Our performers will be ready to star in this music video after they are coached, mentored, and trained. Exclusive to contributors, they get to: (1) attend the viewing parties of the music video before it goes public for purchase, (2) interact LIVE with the performers in a virtual Q&A format; and (3) learn from our Grammy-nominated music producer how to express your soul through music.

The Impact

Sigmund Freud said, “Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.” 

Every 9 seconds, a woman is assaulted. Yet, too often she keeps silent about the experience and internalizes her emotional pain. She “keeps it moving”, as they say. However, the experience creates "ugliness" like bitterness, haunting memories, and beliefs about not being good enough. These experiences weigh heavily on her psyche, making single motherhood as a low-income minority even harder. Your contribution offers her an outlet for self-expression, recognition that her pain is real, and that resilience is possible. Redirecting pain into productive expression opens an opportunity to be more successful as a woman, mother, employee, and community contributor.

Risks & Challenges

Although the “Me Too” movement has given voice to abused women, admitting abuse remains a taboo, for many cultural, political, and practical reasons that are too numerous to name here. We recognize that just because we provide a platform for these moms to transform pain into resilience, they may remain silent and in the shadows. This is why the Executive Director will lead with her personal story and the music that she has already written and recorded. She will provide a safe place for these moms to share. We also recognize that we may be looking for a needle in the haystack: low-income, Black, single moms who have talent AND who are willing to be coached, mentored, and trained by us. While we recognize this challenge, we are prepared to look far and wide for her. Our pilot group is a minimum of six moms and a maximum of 8. We are confident that we can identify a sufficient number of prospects from the greater Philadelphia, PA region to yield 6-8 ideal performers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial contributions will help us produce a music video that can "cleanse" the soul of women who have experienced abuse. However, financial contributions are not the only way for contributors to help. Other ways are: (1) share our purpose with women you know who could benefit from what we offer; (2) become a member of the Muddy High Heels Entertainment Family; (3) use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I’m Asher Saiz and this campaign has been created to help fund my first album. I’m an indie alternative musician/ artist. Recently, I released a demo quality cut of my first single, The Traveller.  After it received positive reception, I knew I was on the right track and decided to move forward with recording an album. Many of the songs featured in this cardinal project mean very much and have been waiting to see the light of day. By contributing to this campaign, you’ll not only fund my very first album - you’ll also be investing into me as a recording artist and helping me establish myself as an independent musician.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, where things stand, I’m looking at approximately $1,000 in recording expenses. Base studio costs are currently $500 (approximately three days in the studio). The other $500 would be used for related expenses from potentially including extra studio time to having a limited amount of hard copies of the album being made and shipped. Part of why I created this campaign as opposed to a Go Fund Me is because I want you, the investor, to have a return on your investment!

Everyone who invests a minimum of $10 will get a digital copy of the album upon completion, 1 week prior to the official release date of 12/29/2020. Other perks include signed hard copies of the album and live, private performance of the album! Whether the fundraising goal isn’t met or is completely surpassed, all funds will go to the funding of the album and all related expenses.

 

The Impact

If you’ve heard my single, The Traveller, and thought it was good, then imagine how much better this will be. The Traveller didn’t have a budget - meaning $0 went into it. No studio. No nothing. With your help, I can really polish The Traveller and the other songs going into this project. 7 songs. 7 moments. 1 story. Something as small as having an engineer present when you’re recording can help traverse the fine line between a successful and unsuccessful project.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk being faced right now will be ensuring the tracking process is completed within the initial timeframe planned for. I don’t doubt that recording can be done in 2-3 days. I will take it upon myself to ensure I am adequately prepared for each day in the studio to really make the most of my time. The goal is to track for 2-3 songs per day. By following this estimate, the likelihood that I will need extra recording time is minimal

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you cannot fincancially invest into my project and respect that. These are difficult times. But! There are other ways you can help ^__^

You can follow me on all social media platforms @ashersaiz; and share them so your friends can follow, too! Subscribe to my YouTube channel and follow along with the project’s process in my soon to come vlog, Asher Saiz: The Road to The Album. Lastly, you can share this campaign with your friends. You never know who will take an interest and participate in their own way.
