story:
Support the arts! 

Help me launch my hip-hop project.  Let’s make musical history...

GhettoRi¢ (rhymes with “rhetoric”) is equal parts veteran high school English teacher and hardcore rapper.  The whole concept is couched in layers of irony, a burlesque satire on both education and hip-hop, educators and rappers--while paying homage to great teaching and true MC’s.

I’ve been building the GhettoRi¢ universe and developing content for the last two years.  He’s unlike anything the world has heard, and I’m poised to launch.

Beyond the release of the first singles, videos, and EP, I have plans for five to seven more EP’s--along with singles, videos, and other content to accompany them--over the next five to seven years.

This is where I could use your help.

As an actual teacher, I don’t have the cash on hand to build and promote the GhettoRi¢ brand as I simultaneously create content.  I am seeking $9,000 of seed money.

If you can make any donation, you will support more than my music.  Philanthropy is built into my business plan: 10% of all GhettoRi¢ profits will be donated to education, with EP1 proceeds earmarked for the Newport Harbor Educational Foundation. Any contribution you make will come back to benefit students in public schools. 

Check out GhettoRi¢ and link up.

Visit the website at ghettoric.com to sign up for the mailing list and link up with GhettoRi¢’s social media.

Here’s a preview of the first two singles... 

  • “Distance Learning” - The first single, scheduled for release on December 21, 2020.
  • “To Ensure Student Learning” - from EP1: The Farewell Mixtape, scheduled for release in early 2021.

Thank you!

In hip-hop and education,

Matt Armstrong

story:
10 Reasons why the world needs Jeeni

My name is Mel Croucher. I'm a record producer and computer nerd, and over the years I've worked with a whole bunch of superstars like Prince, Frank Zappa and Eminem, to build smart databases and sell stuff direct to fans. In other words, I've been around successful musicians all my working life.

A few years back I was hearing from more and more artists how unhappy they were with the big streaming services. That's the reason I polled 4,200 of them via social networks about their Top-Ten Problems with Spotify, Apple Music, Soundcloud, Deezer, and the rest. The poll result was a shocker! So I asked a bunch of the best brains in the music business to help me create an ethical alternative. It's taken us two years, and we call our alternative JEENI.

Here's what the artists we polled told us, and here's our Jeeni solution to their problems.

1 - Money. Artists get paid a pittance. Platforms like YouTube pay $0.00069 per view, so even 10,000 views earns us less than the cost of a pizza per month.
Jeeni solution. OK, we get it. You do all the hard work, so you deserve all the rewards. How about a Jeeni deal where you to keep 100% of all music sales, ticketing, and merchandise sold through our platform.

2 - Recognition. We try really hard, but streaming platforms just don't get us more fans or recognition.
Jeeni solution. Right. Let's make Jeeni an artist development platform. Our founder invented viral marketing in 1994. Then he achieved the world's first million-user viral campaign. Now he's designed all the tools you need to grow your fanbase and get recognition: all part of the Jeeni service.

3 - Communication. We don't know the identity of who's streaming our stuff, so we can't get in direct contact with anyone who wants to know more about us.
Jeeni solution. OK. Here's the deal. With Jeeni you get a built-in fan database to contact everyone who votes for you or likes your work, and you communicate direct with them as often as you like. Safely, legally and all opt-in.

4 - B*llsh*t. The big streaming platforms are full of it. We hate the adverts, we hate the artificial likes, we hate the paid-for recommendations, we hate the hype.
Jeeni solution. The answer to this is an ethical alternative. We guarantee that Jeeni will stay advert-free. We pledge our charts are the result of democratic votes by real people. And we promise that all Jeeni content comes from genuine unpaid sources. Oh yeah, we'll also pay our taxes in full, because we believe we should make a positive contribution to the society we live in.

5 - Rip Offs. We just can't break through, and even when we think we're making progress as artists we get ripped off.
Jeeni solution. Yep. The entertainment business has always been full of shysters. Let's be honest here, the people behind Jeeni have all made it to the top somehow, and between us we've made every mistake in the book. Our mission is to help you achieve success and avoid the rip-offs. That's why our Jeeni Mentors, Ambassadors and Masterclasses have joined forces to do exactly that.

6 - Choice. The big streaming services all offer similar content, dominated by the same big star names.
Jeeni solution. Agreed, so let's ignore the content everyone else uses and leave our competitors to fight it out! Jeeni is designed for undiscovered artists to break through, based on talent alone, not ad-spend.

7 - Channels. My work doesn't fit into mainstream channels. For example, what about channels for spoken-word?
Jeeni solution. No problem. Jeeni already has dedicated spoken-word channels for poetry, comedy, and voice actors, plus channels for entertainments ranging from dance to videogame soundtracks. And if we don't already have a channel that suits your need ... we'll sit down and create it!

8 - Visibility. People either don't know about our work, or can't find it even if they do.
Jeeni solution. We've designed the smartest user interface we can. On Jeeni, you can search by name, type of channel, instrumentation, latest uploads, popularity, even by influences and heroes. But above all, our artists have complete control over publicising their own announcements to their specific Jeeni audience.

9 - Fakes. What's the difference between the Jeeni Awards and the fake results dominated by celebrity voting?
Jeeni solution. Simple. Jeeni doesn't have celebrity voting. Our Awards will always be based on one member - one vote. No ifs, no buts.

10 - Live performance. I'd like to stream an event, and charge people to watch it. Can Jeeni do that?
Jeeni solution. Um, not yet, but we're working on it! Come on now, we're not perfect, so we need your help. Please read on ...
 

What We Need

  • All the hard work has been done. Our support networks are in place. Jeeni is up and running. Now we need your help, your feedback, your votes, your talent and your videos, as we scale up globally. And if you're not an artist yourself, then you can gift a Jeeni membership to anyone you like.
  • We need to ramp up the funding for our hosting servers and bandwidth as we grow, and above all we need to fund the cost of outreach to new fans on behalf of Jeeni artists.
  • Our funding goals are really simple. Our user acquisition cost is around £0.18, so for every £5,000 we raise, we grow our fan capacity by around 28,000 - directly targeting audiences from festivals, clubs, educational centres and our huge network of existing fan-bases and partnerships.
  • You need perks? We'll give you perks!


What You Get

SUPERFAN perks - from £5 - including:
  • unlimited access to all Jeeni Channels, including celebrity masterclasses and concerts.
  • the right to vote on any track, create the popularity charts, influence the Awards, and turn new talent into the next generation of stars.
  • direct contact with other artists for all their latest news and special offers.
  • the right to vote on Jeeni policies and topics, including new channels, venues, concerts and superstar appearances.
  • your own Jeeni Personal Spotlight to tell the world about yourself, keep track of all your Jeeni activities and personalise your Jeeni experience.
  • your own Playlists Package to create, share and enjoy.
  • a Jeeni Rewards Package to earn credits for all your Jeeni activities, and spend them how you like.

ARTIST perks include all of the above PLUS:

  • your own dedicated Artist Showcase, to spotlight your showreels, show your images, display your lyrics and publicise your news.
  • a personal Jeeni URL address, for you to lead new fans straight to your Jeeni Showcase.
  • the right to upload and update selected tracks of your original work on any Jeeni main channel for the world to enjoy.
  • your Jeeni Fanbase Builder – fully automatic management system to locate and keep existing and new fans so you can reach out to them.
  • all your tracks automatically listed for Jeeni.radio airtime.
  • all your tracks automatically listed for Jeeni.tv facetime.
  • all your tracks automatically listed for Jeeni.dj remix rights.

PRO perks - include all of the above PLUS:

  • unlimited track uploads o your work.
  • all your tracks automatically put forward for the Jeeni Awards.
  • all your tracks automatically available to feature on soundtracks, advertising and other commercial usage, where of course you keep all the rewards.
  • your professional marketing package, for automatic outreach to communicate with and sell direct to your fan database, and of course to grow that fanbase as much as possible.
  • the guarantee that you keep 100% of profits from sales of your music, ticketing, merchandise and all items you promote and sell via Jeeni.

So, what if you're not a creative artist, or musician, or involved in the entertainment business? Then join in the fun and make someone else happy, like family or friends who'd appreciate some recognition of their talent. You can gift all the Jeeni perks on offer to anyone you like.

And can Jeeni make them happy? Sure we can. But, don't take out word for it, let's hear it from some world-class insiders:


Testimonials

“I work on cool projects with cool people, and Jeeni is very, very cool.” 
(Kelli Richards, A&R Executive EMI Music, Apple Director of Music responsible for the launch of Apple Music)

"The difference with Jeeni is their experience and connections: straight talkers, fully transparent, and an unstoppable attitude to make Jeeni a huge success."
(Steve Salvari, producer, soul legend, Chaka Khan, Robert Palmer, Aswad)

"Jeeni is super cool, I am a massive fan of your work, making great music, as ever."
(Chris Baréz-Brown, father of Jeeni Award Nominee Harvie Joy)

"Jeeni is remarkable, artists get the recognition they deserve and earn cash in the process."
(Teddy Hayes, producer, Quincy Jones, Roberta Flack)

"The main thing missing on Spotify, Amazon & Apple Music is playlisting. Jeeni is a treasure-pot!"
(Noush Anand, Jeeni Pro Member)

"Jeeni is everything Spotify would like to be, but isn't. I'm backing Jeeni."
(Roger Watson, Chrysalis and Arista Records executive, responsible for 500 million record sales)

"I applaud and echo Jeeni's ethical approach."
(Tony Klinger, award-winning movie producer, The Who, Supertramp)

"I'm absolutely blown away by how integral you are to the development of music. Myself and so many of my peers are in so much debt to you and your creative work. Thank you."
(Tess Tyler, Award-winning composer for film, tv and multiple AAA video games)

"The mission is to globally promote equality, unity and education through the gift of music."
(Skyler Jett, Grammy Award Winner, Celine Dion, Jennifer Lopez, Stevie Wonder)

"In one word - Excellent! I'm a Jeeni Ambassador."
(John Altman, conductor, Royal Philharmonic Orchestra)
story_txt:
10 Reasons why the world needs Jeeni
My name is Mel Croucher. I'm a record producer and computer nerd, and over the years I've worked with a whole bunch of superstars like Prince, Frank Zappa and Eminem, to build smart databases and sell stuff direct to fans. In other words, I've been around successful musicians all my working life.
A few years back I was hearing from more and more artists how unhappy they were with the big streaming services. That's the reason I polled 4,200 of them via social networks about their Top-Ten Problems with Spotify, Apple Music, Soundcloud, Deezer, and the rest. The poll result was a shocker! So I asked a bunch of the best brains in the music business to help me create an ethical alternative. It's taken us two years, and we call our alternative JEENI.
Here's what the artists we polled told us, and here's our Jeeni solution to their problems.
1 - Money. Artists get paid a pittance. Platforms like YouTube pay $0.00069 per view, so even 10,000 views earns us less than the cost of a pizza per month.Jeeni solution. OK, we get it. You do all the hard work, so you deserve all the rewards. How about a Jeeni deal where you to keep 100% of all music sales, ticketing, and merchandise sold through our platform.
2 - Recognition. We try really hard, but streaming platforms just don't get us more fans or recognition. Jeeni solution. Right. Let's make Jeeni an artist development platform. Our founder invented viral marketing in 1994. Then he achieved the world's first million-user viral campaign. Now he's designed all the tools you need to grow your fanbase and get recognition: all part of the Jeeni service.
3 - Communication. We don't know the identity of who's streaming our stuff, so we can't get in direct contact with anyone who wants to know more about us.Jeeni solution. OK. Here's the deal. With Jeeni you get a built-in fan database to contact everyone who votes for you or likes your work, and you communicate direct with them as often as you like. Safely, legally and all opt-in.
4 - B*llsh*t. The big streaming platforms are full of it. We hate the adverts, we hate the artificial likes, we hate the paid-for recommendations, we hate the hype.Jeeni solution. The answer to this is an ethical alternative. We guarantee that Jeeni will stay advert-free. We pledge our charts are the result of democratic votes by real people. And we promise that all Jeeni content comes from genuine unpaid sources. Oh yeah, we'll also pay our taxes in full, because we believe we should make a positive contribution to the society we live in.
5 - Rip Offs. We just can't break through, and even when we think we're making progress as artists we get ripped off.Jeeni solution. Yep. The entertainment business has always been full of shysters. Let's be honest here, the people behind Jeeni have all made it to the top somehow, and between us we've made every mistake in the book. Our mission is to help you achieve success and avoid the rip-offs. That's why our Jeeni Mentors, Ambassadors and Masterclasses have joined forces to do exactly that.
6 - Choice. The big streaming services all offer similar content, dominated by the same big star names. Jeeni solution. Agreed, so let's ignore the content everyone else uses and leave our competitors to fight it out! Jeeni is designed for undiscovered artists to break through, based on talent alone, not ad-spend.
7 - Channels. My work doesn't fit into mainstream channels. For example, what about channels for spoken-word?Jeeni solution. No problem. Jeeni already has dedicated spoken-word channels for poetry, comedy, and voice actors, plus channels for entertainments ranging from dance to videogame soundtracks. And if we don't already have a channel that suits your need ... we'll sit down and create it!
8 - Visibility. People either don't know about our work, or can't find it even if they do. Jeeni solution. We've designed the smartest user interface we can. On Jeeni, you can search by name, type of channel, instrumentation, latest uploads, popularity, even by influences and heroes. But above all, our artists have complete control over publicising their own announcements to their specific Jeeni audience.
9 - Fakes. What's the difference between the Jeeni Awards and the fake results dominated by celebrity voting?Jeeni solution. Simple. Jeeni doesn't have celebrity voting. Our Awards will always be based on one member - one vote. No ifs, no buts.
10 - Live performance. I'd like to stream an event, and charge people to watch it. Can Jeeni do that?Jeeni solution. Um, not yet, but we're working on it! Come on now, we're not perfect, so we need your help. Please read on ... 

What We Need

All the hard work has been done. Our support networks are in place. Jeeni is up and running. Now we need your help, your feedback, your votes, your talent and your videos, as we scale up globally. And if you're not an artist yourself, then you can gift a Jeeni membership to anyone you like.
We need to ramp up the funding for our hosting servers and bandwidth as we grow, and above all we need to fund the cost of outreach to new fans on behalf of Jeeni artists.
Our funding goals are really simple. Our user acquisition cost is around £0.18, so for every £5,000 we raise, we grow our fan capacity by around 28,000 - directly targeting audiences from festivals, clubs, educational centres and our huge network of existing fan-bases and partnerships.
You need perks? We'll give you perks!

unlimited access to all Jeeni Channels, including celebrity masterclasses and concerts.
the right to vote on any track, create the popularity charts, influence the Awards, and turn new talent into the next generation of stars.
direct contact with other artists for all their latest news and special offers.
the right to vote on Jeeni policies and topics, including new channels, venues, concerts and superstar appearances.
your own Jeeni Personal Spotlight to tell the world about yourself, keep track of all your Jeeni activities and personalise your Jeeni experience.
your own Playlists Package to create, share and enjoy.
a Jeeni Rewards Package to earn credits for all your Jeeni activities, and spend them how you like.

ARTIST perks include all of the above PLUS:

your own dedicated Artist Showcase, to spotlight your showreels, show your images, display your lyrics and publicise your news.
a personal Jeeni URL address, for you to lead new fans straight to your Jeeni Showcase.
the right to upload and update selected tracks of your original work on any Jeeni main channel for the world to enjoy.
your Jeeni Fanbase Builder – fully automatic management system to locate and keep existing and new fans so you can reach out to them.
all your tracks automatically listed for Jeeni.radio airtime.
all your tracks automatically listed for Jeeni.tv facetime.
all your tracks automatically listed for Jeeni.dj remix rights.

unlimited track uploads o your work.

story:
OM PROJEKTET / ABOUT THIS PROJECT

(**For English, read in between all the Danish paragraphs**)

Hej! Vi hedder Maja Kjær Jacobsen og Søren Vinther Røgen, en violinist og en guitarist fra Midtjylland. Sammen danner vi duoen Maskineri, og spiller traditionsmusik der kommer fra Midtjylland – det er der ikke så mange i Danmark der gør! I juni 2020 udgiver vi vores debutalbum “HOPSA 101″, og vi laver denne publikumsfinanciering for at dække udgifterne til mix, masterering og tryk af cd’en (for det er der faktisk stadig folk der køber ;-) ).

Hi! We are Maja Kjær Jacobsen and Søren Vinther Røgen, a fiddler and a guitarist from Central Jutland in Denmark. Together we form the duo Maskineri, and play traditional folk music from Central Jutland, which is something very few people in Denmark do! In June 2020, we will release our debut album “HOPSA 101″, and we are making this crowdfunding campaign to cover the costs of mixing, mastering and printing the physical CD (because some people actually still buy those ;-) ).


Hvad vi har brug for, og hvad du får til gengæld.

Vi indspiller hos Samuel Lundh i Göteborg, og han får også lov til at mixe! Masterering foregår hos Martin von Schmalensee ved Mackapär Studios i Härnösand i Sverige. Maja designer coveret (den slags er hun super god til!), og vi er glade og stolte over at kunne udgive pladen på det danske selskab GO’Danish Folk Music, som er “the place to be” når du udgiver folkemusik i Danmark. De står for online salg af pladen og distribuerer den til butikker i hele verden.


What we need and what you get.

We will record the music with Samuel Lundh in Gothenburg, and he will be mixing it as well! Mastering will be done by the wonderful Martin von Schmalensee at Mackapär Studios in Härnösand​, Sweden. Maja is designing the cover layout (she is awesome at that sort of thing!) And we are happy and proud to be able to release the record on the Danish label GO’Danish Folk Music, which is “the place to be” when you release folk music in Denmark. They are also in charge of all online sales of the record and they distribute to physical shops all over the world.
 

Hvad er der i pakkerne?

Vi har samlet nogle unikke pakker til jer, så I kan føle jer som en del af vores Maskineri-familie!

I kan bl.a. få MINI-MAZURKA-PAKKEN, som giver dem der ikke har så meget at give af, men stadig gerne vil støtte os, mulighed for det. SURPRISE-POLKA-PAKKEN, som er for alle jer der gerne vil have HOPSA 101 og samtidig gerne vil høre hvad Maja og Søren har udgivet med andre bands. I SERIØS-SVEITRIT-PAKKEN får du et signeret HOPSA 101-album, 2 plader med vores andre bands OG koncertbilletter til vores koncerter i Danmark i 2020 og 2021, og du kan endda få dig en hjemmekoncert – streamet live eksklusivt for dig og dine venner.

Tag et kig i menuen til højre, og find dine favoritter!
 

What's in the packages?

We have made some unique perks for you all, so you can feel like a part of the Maskineri Family!

Among other things, you can get the MINI MAZURKA PACKAGE, which gives a chance for those who don’t have unlimited funds to be able to still take part in the campaign, by purchasing the digital download of one track from HOPSA 101. The SUPRISE POLKA PACKAGE is for everyone who would like to have HOPSA 101 and who are also interested in hearing some of Maja and Søren’s other bands. With THE SERIOUS SVEITRIT PACKAGE you receive a signed copy of HOPSA 101, records with our other bands AND concert tickets for one of our concerts during 2020 or 2021. The grand finale is THE HEFTY HOPSA PACKAGE which, in addition to many of the other packages, gives you a private concert streamed live directly to your livingroom for you and your friends.

Take a look at the menu on the right, and find your favorites! 
 

Lidt mere om MASKINERI og musikken

Pladen har været længe undervejs; Vi begyndte allerede at spille sammen i 2016, men først nu synes vi, vi rigtig har fundet musikken, og at den rigtig har fundet os! Det tager tid at komme ind i, og dybt nok ned i en bestemt type musik. Den fortjener at bliver taget varet på, fortolket og behandlet med omtanke og kærlighed. Ikke mindst fordi denne musik har overlevet i så mange århundreder som den har.

Den musik, vi spiller i Maskineri er fra nodebøger og optagelser som er mellem 50 og 130 år gamle; bl.a. fra “Nodebog efter Kristen Jensen & Anders “Top” Andersen”, som er den midtjyske spillemand Anders Tops eftermæle, og optagelser af Lærer Frank, som kom fra Engesvang. Så er der alle sangerne, hvis smukke gamle viser vi har fra optagelser fra starten af 1900-tallet.

Selvom det lyder gammelt og støvet så er musikken lige så relevant, smuk og tiltalende i dag, fordi den har en lyd der spejler sig i vores folkesjæl. Det er velkendt, og alligevel nyt. Så da vi opdagede musikken og alt det den har på hjerte, var det vigtig for os at spille den, og gennem den udtrykke det, vi selv har på hjerte.

Og bare for at være sikre på, at I ved... at vi ved .....hvad vi laver... Så er vi begge to nogle garvede hoveder på den danske folkemusikscene, og tilsammen har vi udgivet 9 plader med 5 forskellige bands (Maja & David, Fru Skagerrak, Trolska Polska, Trio Svin, Maine Coon trio) indenfor de sidste 7 år!
 

More about MASKINERI's background and the music

The album has been a long time coming; We started playing together 4 years ago, but it wasn’t until a year ago that we really found the music and it really found us! It takes time to get deep enough into a certain type of music. It deserves to be taken care of and interpreted and treated with consideration and love. Not least because this music has survived for as many centuries as it has.

The music we play in Maskineri is from old note books and recordings that are between 50 and 130 years old; Among other things, from “Nodebog efter Kristen Jensen & Anders “Top” Andersen”, which is the legacy of the Central Jutland fiddler Anders Top, and recordings of Frank the Teacher (Lærer Frank), a native of Engesvang. Then comes all the singers whose beautiful old ballads we have from recordings from the early 1900s.

Although it sounds old and dusty, the music is just as relevant, beautiful and appealing today because it has a sound that is a mirror of our people’s soul. It is well known, and yet new. So when we discovered the music and all the things it has to say, it was important for us to play it and with it’s help express what it is we want to say.

Just to make sure you know... that we know ... what we’re doing - We are both well known figures on the Danish folk music scene – within the past 7 years, we’ve released 9 albums in total with 5 different bands (Maja & David, Fru Skagerrak, Trolska Polska, Trio Svin, Maine Coon trio)!
 

Du kan støtte på mange måder!

Uanset størrelsen på din støtte, så er vi ovenud taknemmelige. Vi ved godt, at dette er en hård tid for alle. Men netop derfor er det godt at være sammen om noget og finde fællesskaber hvor man kan, om ikke fysisk så virtuelt og ved at være sammen om noget så dejligt som musik – for musik er og har altid handlet om fællesskab.

Hvis du ikke har midler til rådighed til at støtte økonomisk er der andre måder du kan hjælpe på - du kan sprede rygtet til dit netværk af familie og venner - og vi har gjort det let for dig; bare brug "knapperne" her på siden til at dele på bl.a. de sociale medier. 

Tak for dig! Og tak for din støtte.

Maja & Søren

 

There are many ways to support!

Regardless of the size of your support, we are extremely grateful. We know very well that this is a tough time for everyone. However, that is exactly why it is a good thing to socialize and find communities where we can, if not physically then virtually and by getting together to share something as nice as music – because music is and always has been all about community.

If you don't have funds to support the campaign financially, there are other ways in which you can help - spread the word to your network of family and friends! We've made it easy for you to share - just use the social media icons on this page. 

Thank you for being here, and thank you for your support!

Maja & Søren

Så er vi begge to nogle garvede hoveder på den danske folkemusikscene, og tilsammen har vi udgivet 9 plader med 5 forskellige bands (Maja & David, Fru Skagerrak, Trolska Polska, Trio Svin, Maine Coon trio) indenfor de sidste 7 år! More about MASKINERI's background and the musicThe album has been a long time coming; We started playing together 4 years ago, but it wasn’t until a year ago that we really found the music and it really found us! It takes time to get deep enough into a certain type of music. It deserves to be taken care of and interpreted and treated with consideration and love. Not least because this music has survived for as many centuries as it has.The music we play in Maskineri is from old note books and recordings that are between 50 and 130 years old; Among other things, from “Nodebog efter Kristen Jensen & Anders “Top” Andersen”, which is the legacy of the Central Jutland fiddler Anders Top, and recordings of Frank the Teacher (Lærer Frank), a native of Engesvang. Then comes all the singers whose beautiful old ballads we have from recordings from the early 1900s.Although it sounds old and dusty, the music is just as relevant, beautiful and appealing today because it has a sound that is a mirror of our people’s soul. It is well known, and yet new. So when we discovered the music and all the things it has to say, it was important for us to play it and with it’s help express what it is we want to say.Just to make sure you know... that we know ... what we’re doing - We are both well known figures on the Danish folk music scene – within the past 7 years, we’ve released 9 albums in total with 5 different bands (Maja & David,  Fru Skagerrak, Trolska Polska, Trio Svin, Maine Coon trio)! Du kan støtte på mange måder!Uanset størrelsen på din støtte, så er vi ovenud taknemmelige. Vi ved godt, at dette er en hård tid for alle. Men netop derfor er det godt at være sammen om noget og finde fællesskaber hvor man kan, om ikke fysisk så virtuelt og ved at være sammen om noget så dejligt som musik – for musik er og har altid handlet om fællesskab.Hvis du ikke har midler til rådighed til at støtte økonomisk er der andre måder du kan hjælpe på - du kan sprede rygtet til dit netværk af familie og venner - og vi har gjort det let for dig; bare brug "knapperne" her på siden til at dele på bl.a. de sociale medier. Tak for dig! Og tak for din støtte.Maja & Søren There are many ways to support!Regardless of the size of your support, we are extremely grateful. We know very well that this is a tough time for everyone. However, that is exactly why it is a good thing to socialize and find communities where we can, if not physically then virtually and by getting together to share something as nice as music – because music is and always has been all about community.If you don't have funds to support the campaign financially, there are other ways in which you can help - spread the word to your network of family and friends! We've made it easy for you to share - just use the social media icons on this page. Thank you for being here, and thank you for your support!Maja & Søren

story:
Help Fund BARACUTANGA’s album “Volver Atrás”

*You can always make a donation without picking a perk. Please visit the FAQs section for more information.

** All donors will be able to enjoy exclusive unreleased material through a private space we have in our Website. Further information will be sent by email.

We are so excited to be in the studio again, recording our sophomore album entitled “Volver Atrás”, but unfortunately,  because of the Covid-19 pandemic, our finances have fallen short of the amount needed to produce the record.  In our “Join Baracutanga’s Journey” campaign, we are inviting you - our faithful listeners, followers, audience members, and newcomers - to join us on our journey and become co-producers. What is Volver Atrás, you ask? Simply put, it is Baracutanga’s musical appeal for people to explore their roots; for people to reflect on where and what it is they have come from. As the Aymara people of the Andes would understand it, the past is known, so it lies ahead of you. The future is unknown, so it lies behind you, where you can’t see.“The past lies ahead, and the future lies behind.” Though the scope of this concept is very large, Volver Atrás is shaping up to be something very special. The album’s musical diversity, lyrics, featured musical collaborations with musicians from the Americas, infectious rhythms, blazing brass, and beautiful folkloric sounds blend the old with the new in reverence to what lies in the past. This project is an expensive endeavor - and the cancellation of performances due to the pandemic set us back quite a bit - but, with your help, we will be able to complete Volver Atrás, including mixing, post-production, music videos, and future publicity. 

Baracutanga is a Pan-American Latin musical group that consists of members from Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador, and the United States. Our music is a one-of-a-kind concept that blends the many musical influences of South America together with North American influences as a way to build bridges over the gap that seems to separate those cultures. Our ultimate mission is to create bonds between people that go beyond skin color, borders, and ethnicity; to perform and record music that helps to cause unity between peoples of all types.

story:
Overdose is very common amongst musicians. All musicians are on the frontlines in the battle against overdose, and Musicians for Overdose Prevention is trying to give them the tools to fight. Naloxone is a safe, easy-to-use opioid overdose reversal method, which is enthusiastically recommended by the surgeon general of the United States as something that everyone should carry. Naloxone can prevent an overdose in most cases if administered in time. We’re trying to get musicians to carry Naloxone — whether they think their “scene” contains drugs or not — so that they can become first responders if they encounter someone who needs help. 

 

June Madness is a 30-day online event featuring 64 live concerts in March-Madness style “contest” format. This event will help Musicians for Overdose Prevention to distribute Narcan/Naloxone to our participating bands, but much more importantly, it will be a way for people all over the country and world to talk about how all people can take part in overdose prevention.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

This campaign is to raise $3,500, which will help us to run the shows, and also subsidize the distribution of Narcan to our 64 participating musicians. We want you to join us because we want you on our team. Overdose is an epic problem, and it will feel good to be on the side of the solution. (Musicians for Overdose Prevention, Inc. ("MOP") is a North Carolina non-profit corporation. Please note that your donation may not be tax deductible as MOP is currently in the process of applying for non-profit status with the IRS. Please contact us directly if you have any questions.) Please donate! And check out our perks! They’re good.

 

The Impact

 

In 2019, Jerome M. Adams, the surgeon general of the United States, announced that it is more important for “regular” Americans to carry naloxone than to know CPR. He was not talking just to drug users  — he was talking to everyone. Yet in spite of this clear message from the medical community, most people don’t carry Naloxone, and stigma about it persists. The goals of Musicians for Overdose Prevention are two: to empower musicians to become a part of the solution by carrying Naloxone themselves, and to encourage discussion and discourage stigma about this important drug. 

June Madness is a fun event, but this campaign will save lives. Please help us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by sharing this campaign. We also encourage you to carry Naloxone yourself— whatever your stance about drug use may be. You can obtain it at any pharmacy (may be covered by insurance or you may have to pay). Every state has some version of legislation that allows you to request, obtain, and carry it without an individual prescription.  Keep it in your purse or guitar bag. Please tell people that you carry Naloxone because all lives are important, and because we need to keep musicians, and all people, safe.

story:
Flo Chase and the making of 'Toi'

Flo Chase is an indie pop singer-songwriter inspired by the striking sounds of Sufjan Stevens and Bon Iver, born to French parents and raised mostly in Australia before making the trek to Los Angeles. Since the early age of seven when Chase started learning his first instrument - piano, he felt a connection with music right away. At 12, his family moved to Australia. Not knowing a single word of English, he fully immersed himself in music - a place he could find comfort and express himself. Shortly after, Chase started taking vocal lessons and learning composition, and soon later taught himself to play drums, banjo, harmonica, bass and ukulele. From then, the multi-instrumentalist was all in. 

Chase, now living in Los Angeles, has created a record reflecting that experience of leaving his home, family and friends to start fresh and embrace the unknown. His debut album titled Toi is symbolic of the solitude and feelings that came with saying goodbye and pursuing his dream.

“I feel listeners will still find a ground of resonance from my first EP Le Debut, however this new record feels even more personal to me for multiple reasons,” he says. “Over the years, I believe I have grown as an artist and man in general while the experience of moving to Los Angeles and re-adapting to a new culture and way of life has definitely allowed me to dig deeper into my feelings.”

“I hope my fans will find some sense of relatedness, comfort and cheerfulness in this new record,” says Chase. "I hope it will be one of those records fans will turn to whenever they feel the urge to escape the real world even if it’s for a minute, and also one they will smile and dance to.”

 

Your Impact:

2020 has been a very challenging year with the impact of the pandemic on the live music industry, therefore any contribution makes a huge difference.

What's included in the $10K?

Music production (mixing & mastering)

Music videos

Digital Distribution (to Apple Music, Spotify, etc.)

Hard copies CDs 

PR and social media 

Vinyl Record

Merchandise (t-shirts, stickers, etc.)

 

Packages:

 

$5 - THANK YOU! Every little bit helps. 

 

$15 - GET THE MUSIC BEFORE EVERYONE ELSE: Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$30 - AUTOGRAPHED VINYL & MUSIC FIRST: Autographed  7"vinyl "premieres maquettes" +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$50 - SHOUTOUT & MERCH & VINYL & MUSIC FIRST: Your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$100 - HANDWRITTEN LYRICS + EVERYTHING ELSE: Handwritten lyrics of your song of choice + your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$200 - CUSTOM VIDEO + EVERYTHING ELSE: Custom video for you and your family+ your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$300 - ZOOM CALL + EVERYTHING ELSE: One on one Zoom call+ your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$500 - DINNER WITH YOUR & YOUR FRIENDS + EVERYTHING ELSE: I’ll drive within 300 miles of LA to have dinner with you and your friends (even Thanksgiving!)+ your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$750 - ROAD TRIP WITH ME + EVERYTHING ELSE: Hop in the car with me (in LA) and we’ll take a road trip listening to the entire album while driving along the Pacific Coast Highway where the album photos were shot+ your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$1,000 - JOIN ME ON A PHOTO SHOOT + EVERYTHING ELSE: Attend one of my photoshoots in LA and we'll take time to get a professional shot together+ your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$1,500 - PRIVATE IN PERSON PERFORMANCE + EVERYTHING ELSE: Private performance at your house for you and your friends or via zoom (if you are more than 300 miles out of LA) & choose one song you'd like me to play+ your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$2,000 - RECORD A SONG WITH ME + EVERYTHING ELSE: Come to the studio and sing or play on a live recording with me+ your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$5,000 - BE IN MY MUSIC VIDEO:  Be on set and part of one of my upcoming music videos + your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

$10,000 - SPEND AN ENTIRE WEEKEND AWAY TOGETHER AND BRING A FRIEND ALONG: Be a part of a trip within the US and spend a weekend with me and my team celebrating the new record + your name in the album credits & a shout out on social media + a merch item of your choice + autographed vinyl +Pre-release digital download of the new album the day before it drops + a link to stream the singles in advance.

 

  ___

 

Thank you immensely in advance for your support!

You can stream some of my previous releases here:

https://open.spotify.com/artist/6wCdPDfNu7kWsDT...

And to keep up to date with this project and what I'm up to you can follow me here:

https://www.instagram.com/flochasemusic

Much Love!

story:
Why are there certain songs we return to again and again? Songs are connected to memories - painful, exhilarating, funny, terrifying, joyous memories. Music is the emotional marker that reminds us of “that time when” - sometimes it’s the medicine that gets us through, sometimes it’s the anthem we sang once we made it. There’s no feeling like the one when you hear the opening chords of a track that takes you back.

 

In the first iteration of THIS SONG REMINDS ME OF, I’m singing some of my fav emo songs from middle school and telling stories from that time in my life. For me, no genre holds more loaded stories than this one!! I promise it will be your inner emo kid’s greatest dream!!

 

It is my hope that by singing these songs and telling these stories - and in future iterations of this show, inviting my talented friends to do the same - we can all remember together, and we can all feel less alone. 

 

Why do I need this initial funding? I have a kickass band and I believe in paying artists what they deserve! I also want to have enough money set aside to pay for extra equipment we may need, renting rehearsal space and covering any upfront venue costs. The idea is that eventually our band will require less rehearsal time and that with ticket sales the show will eventually pay for itself. But I need your help to get it off the ground!

story:
Michael Francis McCarthy Album Funding Campaign

My name is Michael Francis McCarthy, I'm an independent American roots musician. I've written an album of great new music and I'm asking you to help me get it out to the world. I work hard to make my way performing many shows a year in numerous states, my operation is as independent as it gets and I take this vocation seriously.

If you pre-order my new album for a minimum $15 today, you buy me 30 minutes of studio time.  To support my project more substantially, please consider becoming an album patron:

Bronze Album Patron - $5 buys me 10 minutes of studio time, enough to pay for one take.

Silver Album Patron - $15 buys 30 minutes of studio time.

Gold Album Patron - $30 funds an hour of studio time

Platinum Album Patron - $240 bankrolls a full day of recording, or roughly an entire song.

Super Insane-O Patron - $480 pays for a whole weekend of crushing this album tracking

My goal is to raise $3000 from supporters to fund enough studio time to track the lion's share of this album, plus mixing, mastering and printing 1000 CDs. All support is appreciated, including sharing this IndieGoGo album fundraising campaign with your friends and fellow music supporters. Thank you for following my work this far. I hope to play these new songs in your town and see you again this year.

Your loyal bard,

Michael Francis McCarthy

www.MichaelFrancisMcCarthyMusic.com

story:
In short

We would like to invite you to be part of the process of making our album reality and support us by choosing one of the 12 rewards/perks listed here. You can also donate any amount you can. Every bit counts! 

 

A bit longer story

Who? What? Why?

 

My name is Pauls Pokratnieks, and I am a drummer, composer and educator from Latvia.

Since I started to play music professionally I have had amazing opportunities to be part of so many great projects as a side-man and visit more than 20 countries. I love to make other people compositions alive and add my interpretation and experience to them. 

In the last few years, I have started to compose more regularly and I find it so fulfilling to express myself through writing songs and lyrics. To share my own music with fellow musicians and audience gives me such satisfaction and meaning. 

 

I want to document a period of my life, period like a rollercoaster - up and down, up and down. A period during which I was lost and in many ways still am, a period I lost my best friend, but also met so many new ones, a period in which I started to live my dream, but at the same time felt like dying.  The period during which I started to shape into new version as a human being, as a man, and as an artist. I think for the better, but who am I to say -  time will tell.

While living in Sweden I have met two truly amazing human beings who happen to be outstanding musicians as well - Swedish pianist Fabian Kallerdahl and Finish double bass player Olli Rantala.  They have helped me to make my compositions more than alive and I am so grateful to learn from them and grow as a band together. On the west coast of Sweden, we are known as "PULSE TRIO". 

 

 

 

I have composed music, through musical interactions we have made it awake and now we are ready to share our debut album "THE END IS THE BEGINNING" with YOU. 

 

Why I want YOU to be part of it?

 

I have paid 15.000 sek (1500 eur) from my savings already for the recording process in the beautiful Epidemin studio, but there are much more expenses to cover - 

  • mixing 
  • mastering
  • original cover artwork
  • creative photo session
  • print of CD's
  • print of LP's
  • print of the T-shirt's

All together future expenses make around 20.000 sek (2000 eur).

 

To make this album reality it would be amazing if YOU could support us and join us in this process. I am determined to finalize this project no matter if we reach our financial goal or not, but your contribution and support would mean so much to do it in the best possible way and to share with you high-quality products what you deserve. 

 

What do YOU get?

 

I deeply appreciate any support, be it a share, thumbs-up, donation or contribution, and in return I will give you:

  • A social shout-out and at every contribution level.
  • Early access to the album. 
  • Physical rewards such as CD's, LP's, T-Shirts.
  • A personalized composition, private lesson.
  • VIP experience during our concert.

 

Other ways YOU can help

 

If you for any reason can't join us for the journey to make this album or have other journeys to take part I would kindly ask you to share this campaign video with your friends on social media and beyond. I would appreciate that a lot and it can make the difference. 

Visit our FB page to see our PROMO video and more info -  https://www.facebook.com/pulsetriomusic

Thank you so much in advance,

PULSE TRIO

story:
About our project:

Hello Everyone!

We are Trio Resonance, comprised of Noé Garcia Jacinto, Zhi Li and Héctor Alfonso Torres González, a classical guitar trio based in the DFW area of North Texas. Since we started playing together in 2016, it was always one of our goals to eventually put out a recording that could represent our sound, ideas and experience, and after touring for 3 years, arranging multiple pieces and exploring different repertoire we finally have come up with a project which we believe in and are hoping that will be to the enjoyment of the public!

This album is a collection of carefully selected pieces which we feel represents us as artistically culturally and emotionally. From the subtle and beautiful melodies of the Chinese traditional landscape pieces to the moving and energetic tangos of Piazzolla and Maximo Diego Pujol, Sound and Motion represents our personal relationship between music, movement and resonance. Sound and Motion directly relates to the debut recording of The Art of Sound and Motion by New Zealand composer Bruce Paine. This is an incredibly unique and beautiful piece which was inspired by the kinetic sculptures from the Len Lye Centre in New Plymouth, New Zealand. As the composer explains, this piece "explores a range of interesting and unusual classical guitar timbral effects entirely in keeping with the subject matter and likely to fascinate audiences." 

Here is our Track Listing:

  • Fin de Siglo - Maximo Diego Pujol
  • O Trio Magico - Roland Dyens
  • Concertino no. 1 - Guido Santorsola
  • Mishima - Philip Glass (arr. Zhi Li)
  • Silver Clouds Chasing the Moon 0 - Guang Ren (arr. Zhi Li)
  • Spring Breeze - Yusian Deng (arr. Zhi Li)
  • Fuga y Misterio - Astor Piazzolla (arr. Héctor Alfonso Torres)
  • Oblivion - Astor Piazzolla (arr. Héctor Alfonso Torres)
  • The Art of Sound and Motion - Bruce Paine *debut recording **arr. for three guitars by Bruce Paine

We are extremely happy to be able to share this project and hope that it will catch your interest. Thanks so much for reading and for your time!

Trio Resonance

About Us:

Trio Resonance is a classical guitar trio comprised of Noé Garcia Jacinto, Li Zhi and Héctor Alfonso Torres González. They started playing together in 2016 while working as Teaching Fellows at the University of North Texas where they were studying towards their Doctor in Musical Arts degree.  From the very beginning they experienced an amazing and fufilling chemistry as a group and decided to explore the guitar trio repertoire, as well as arrange music that they felt could push their artistry and sound. 

They have devoted themselves towards expanding the guitar trio repertoire by arranging works of great composers like Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, Johann Sebastian Bach and Astor Piazzolla, also by playing new works written for guitar trio like the Second Brasileira Suite by composer Sergio Assad, Suite Seattle by Kevin Callahan and Fin de Siglo by Maximo Diego Pujol. Recently, they commissioned composer Bruce Paine to arrange for them his piece The Art of Sound and Motion, originally for guitar quartet, which they will make a recording debut in their upcoming album Sound and Motion. Their vision is to tap into the potential and expressiveness of the guitar trio ensemble in order to generate more "resonance" with their listeners. Apart from playing throughout the U.S, for the past three summers they have toured China playing in cities like Jinan, Suzhou, Dalian, Beijing, Guangzhou, Shenzhen and many others.

Apart from their active ensemble performing career, they have been top prize winners in many solo international guitar competitions, including Classical Minds (Houston), Southern Guitar Music Festival and Competition (South Carolina), Appalachian State Guitar Music Festival (North Carolina), Mountain View Classical Guitar Competition (Texas), Lone Star Guitar Festival (Texas), International Tennessee Guitar Festival (Tennessee), Baldwin Wallace International Guitar Festival and Competition (Ohio) and many others. They have also studied with many world-renowned artist including, Pepe Romero, Roland Dyens, Eliot Fisk, Zoran Dukic, Adam Holzman, Aniello Desiderio, Denis Azabagic, Rene Izquierdo, Marcin Dylla, the LAGQ and many others.

Funding Breakdown:

We are looking to raise $2500 which will help cover the following expense:

  • Recording Engineer (Mixing, Editing, Mastering) http://michaelsterlingsmith.com/
  • Manufacturing (Printing)
  • Royalties, Licensing, Publishing
  • Shipping
  • Album Design
  • Merchandise

We are also planning on making some really cool merchandise, shirts and stickers to go with our campaign, these will be limited so we hope that as many of you grab them!!

Our album has already been recorded and mastered by our great friend and recording engineer Michael Smith, he did some fine work and we are eternally grateful for this! We started recording this album at the end of February and it was our original plan to finish early in March for a summer release, but as March came by COVID hit hard in Texas, and we had to delay the recording. Thankfully we got a super tight window to go into the studio for a couple of hours in June, right before Michael was moving out of state! 

We have 30 days to reach our funding, if we fail to reach our goal it might slow down our production time but no matter what happens this album will eventually come out.

Other Ways To Help:

Of course we understand if some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you cannot help. 

If you want, please help us get the word out by:

  • Sharing on social media
  • Let your friends and family know about the project
  • Visit our social media links for more info!

Website: https://trioresonance.com/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TrioResonance/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqf_4a9Zj0Tco26DkP9ePDg

Héctor's Website: https://hectoralfonsotorres.com/

Héctor's Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hectoralfonsotorresguitar/

Héctor's Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/hatguitar/

Noé's Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/noegarciaguitar/

Thank you so much for you time looking at this campaign, we hope we have captivated your attention!!

Héctor, Zhi and Noé,

Trio Resonance

story:
For the past few years, I’ve had the honor to work with one of Boston area’s iconic Jazz groups led by tenor saxophonist, Jerry Bergonzi. Jerry and his quartet held a weekly residence at the LilyPad on Monday nights (until early March 2020) where I appeared as a guest several times each year.  

This fundraiser initiative would bring Bergonzi’s music back on the scene, live streaming weekly from PBS studios in Westwood, with phenomenal audio and video quality. It will be available to music lovers, people who are passionate about contemporary Jazz from all around the world, and anyone else who is interested to discover new jazz music each week. Our goal to raise $2400 would help us cover the studio cost of 8 more concerts.

 

Please consider contributing  by donating any amount that you feel comfortable with in order to kickstart and keep these new concert series alive. Please consider also sharing this campaign with your friends.

story:
The Wicc-id Woman (of Wexford)

Over the past 12 months or so, I have  been feverishly spending weekends and every other free day in a rural house in Wexford, writing and recording what has developed into a double album suite of songs under the project name The Wicc. The name just sort of arrived on the back of these strange modern folk tales and murder ballads I started writing down there. That's Wexford for you. It's a modern folk murder ballad sort of place. That or it's me.

Anyway I am now at the point where I need a capital injection to get the project where it needs to go. Stuff is fully written and recorded to a certain standard but the limitations of my set-up are starting to grind and truth is it's just not going to sound as good as it could without some technical investment. Listed below is the gear that would do the business.

I'd love to get both albums out by February 2020, but at very least one of them (Lupercalia) will be released at that time with the other as yet untitled to follow within a short time frame and definitely also next year. Both albums together will comprise The Wolf Chronicles (Parts 1 and 2). Though I won't commit to it, there's always the possibility of a Part 3 birthing itself at a later time. In addition to recording, I've also started making my own short films/videos and I will be looking at setting up a subscription service (which will be free to you funders) to deliver other media and extra audio content.

The Wicc-ar Basket

I need:

  • Full version audio software
  • New audio interface
  • Studio quality near-field monitors
  • A great mic (or two)
  • High quality orchestral samples
  • New plug-ins (production software add-ons)
  • Novation Bass Station
  • Stage electric keys (secondhand is fine)
  • Some gewgaws, accessories and things what none of this will work without
  • Mastering of the double album

Last one is pretty important actually. Where some bobs can be saved on individual items of tech this is a cost that has to be met for me to deliver the goods that you're all paying for. So even though this is a flexible goal, I guess that means I'd need a bottom line of a few thousand even to release the material in its present condition (which I'd rather not do). 

You get:

  • Digital download of Lupercalia for 10 euros

  • Digital download of Lupercalia and limited edition CD of same for 20 euros

  • Digital downloads of both Lupercalia and untitled second half of The Wolf Chronicles for 20 euros

  • Digital downloads of the above (parts 1 AND 2) as well as limited edition CDs of each for 40 euros

  • To support foreseeable future releases with anything additional you can donate

  • To be gratefully remembered by my eternal soul for all time (or at least until I lose my faculties) 

The Wicc-id Truth

My experience of reward-making has been that additional ones beyond the work itself, even if handcrafted to save money, end up being cumbersome, time-consuming and ultimately distracting from the core purpose. So I want to keep it simple this time. I took the trouble to ask some friends and followers for their input on the rewards base. Most people were down with just the album itself and the opportunity to donate above and beyond the asking price. Some would prefer if the digital material was available from streaming platforms. My own instinct on that is to hold off on streaming availability until a more artist-friendly option comes along, though I may decide to use established channels once the material is released. However, in the first instance the digital albums will be downloadable from my Bandcamp page and, since others I consulted said they would like a hard copy, I will also be printing a limited run of CDs for those that want them.

The main challenge for me apart from the obvious financial one which is the reason for this campaign, is time. This is the only reason I'm reluctant to commit to delivering both halves of the double album within a given timeframe. These two factors are also the reasons why I'm not offering a vinyl option at this point. The fact is that vinyl is so expensive to produce that committing to it might raise the premium for the campaign beyond the achievable and also would delay the entire project as I would only be prepared to produce vinyl of the completed double album. So vinyl is something that I will be happy to look at down the line but, unfortunately, it is not for now.

There is no risk that I won't finish this work. However, the ease with which I do this and to some extent the quality of the final product will be dictated by the funds raised.

No Funds for Finance? You Can Still Help

If you are not in a position to buy or donate but still want to support this project, I will be delighted if you just share it as best you can. Indiegogo provides share tools to make this easy for you.

story:
Manifest

Welcome to the fundraising efforts of an indie art-pop siren. I'm Virginia Marcs and I've put together an important story. Five powerful songs and their accompanying videos will comprise my next EP, Reckoning:

  • Reckoning: A self-reflective operatic-in-scope, Portishead-style dreamscape about realizing the gaslighting that has happened in my life and learning to trust my instincts again (demo featured in the video above)
  • Strung: An acceptance of the rage that comes from being a trauma survivor
  • This Time: An anthemic battle cry against misogyny and all of its trappings
  • Good Enough: An anxiety-ridden ode to an ever-plaguing impostor syndrome that turns on its head and ends with hope
  • Dark: "You can sit in the dark my friend, I will hold your hand. I have known darkness too, so I will sit by you." (demo featured at the end of the video above)

I believe these stories will help people heal, connect them to the collective and pull them out of the isolation they may feel, even if for only a moment.

I'm teaming up again with badass, whiskey-drinking, indie-pop producer Katie Buchanan for the recording and production. Then I will work with MTV VMA award-winning editor and director Alexander Hammer to create videos for you to experience each piece of this story.

In order for this project to move forward now, instead of taking 2-3 years longer, I need you. Consider yourselves: The Recording Contract of the People. <3

Quid pro quo

The price of production, recording and mixing for 5 songs (at a negotiated discount to the industry standard) is $7500. Add in the $750 for mastering, $992 for CDs, and additional administrative fees of $475 and we're at a total of $9717 before Indiegogo processing fees and your perks! And THERE ARE PERKS! For example:

  • voice lesson packages
  • CDs
  • access to the demos for the five original songs on Reckoning
  • access to the full demo cover videos that I'll be sharing during the campaign (Brandi Carlile and Billie Eilish are just two of the several artists I'll be covering)
  • songwriting hangs
  • house shows
  • MORE

The additional cost of perks, the marketing materials, PR fees, photography and other miscellaneous costs will come out of my pocket.

On October 1, I applied for the NYC Women's Fund for Media, Music and Theatre and intend to use any additional funds awarded toward music videos. There's no guarantee that I'll receive anything but I'll find out in March of 2020. A lot of time is being donated for the videos, but one person we don't have on my team is a cinematographer (approximately $2.5k per video x 5 videos=$12.5k). Videos also incur costs like: venue rental, props, hair and makeup, post-production effects and color correction. Alex and I (okay, mostly Alex) produced our previous videos out-of-pocket, fitting them into rigorous work schedules - hence why "Wild" took a year from when we started the project to the release this December.

Once the $10k goal is reached, I am shooting for $12.5k to pay for a cinematographer for the first music video. If we make this goal, everyone who has contributed to the campaign will get their name in the credits. 

Destiny

Making my second large recording effort at the (super young) age of 37 and working on video projects like this is a dream. Unfortunately, doing this on my own without industry support means taking many years to finish a project like this. Preorders and crowdfunding from colleagues, neighbors, friends, family, fans in Sarasota, Orlando, Mount Dora, Saint Petersburg, London, New York, Jersey City, Virginia, West Virginia, Arkansas, Missouri, California, Boston, Australia, Chile, and elsewhere, will make this project possible and provide a springboard for my career so that I can share my music with the whole world. 

Why this project needs to be made:

  • This project is unapologetically feminist and addresses the issues of gaslighting, trauma, misogyny, cultural stigmas and more.
  • I'm bringing these powerful songs to life with the help of my badass female producer, Katie Buchanan - collaborating two strong female visions to get this story told in a world of primarily male producers.
  • I've learned the power of adding visual storytelling to the mix and am blessed with the friendships/relationships to make this a reality. There is a reason that Alexander Hammer has made a name for himself in the industry. The work he does is unparalleled. It would be remiss of us to leave this opportunity on the floor.

Risks & Challenges

There's a chance I won't receive any funding from the grant. In that case, the video-making process will take much longer and I need to start releasing videos when the actual song comes out in order to garner proper press and gain capital in the industry. If I do not receive the grant, there are a few ways I will handle it.

  • To prepare for this possibility, I am creating flex goals during the campaign, so that once we've secured funding for recording, production, mixing, mastering and distribution, I will open it up for funding for a cinematographer for the first video.
  • I'll then open up a second goal to add funds for effects and color-correction.
  • If we don't come up with that funding and I am not awarded the grant, Alex and I will take the long road and create 2-3 videos. The story will not be shown in full, but something will be better than nothing. We have discussed some storytelling alternatives as backup plans
  • I have released one record, one single and two videos (well, the second is coming your way in a couple weeks!!) and have the experience to get this done. I learned an invaluable amount from running my first crowdfunding campaign in 2017 and know how to better manage reward delivery, I know what fees are coming that I didn't foresee previously and I have backup plans for my backup plans.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't preorder or contribute financially - I still love you. I promise. Here are some things that can help that cost nothing:

  • Please share this campaign with at least one person, individually, who you think would be interested.
  • Please manifest success for this project in your thoughts over the next 30 days.
  • Let me know if you know an incredible cinematographer who'd like to be a part of this.
  • Are you a makeup artist, photographer, hair stylist? Let's trade some skills! Or if you are really moved to do so, I accept donations in the form of help, for sure. Wanna provide the hair dying, cut and/or styling for a video shoot? Want to come take behind-the-scenes photos? Please contact me: ginya at virginiamarcs dot com.
story_txt:
Manifest
Welcome to the fundraising efforts of an indie art-pop siren. I'm Virginia Marcs and I've put together an important story. Five powerful songs and their accompanying videos will comprise my next EP, Reckoning:

Reckoning: A self-reflective operatic-in-scope, Portishead-style dreamscape about realizing the gaslighting that has happened in my life and learning to trust my instincts again (demo featured in the video above)
Strung: An acceptance of the rage that comes from being a trauma survivor
This Time: An anthemic battle cry against misogyny and all of its trappings
Good Enough: An anxiety-ridden ode to an ever-plaguing impostor syndrome that turns on its head and ends with hope
Dark: "You can sit in the dark my friend, I will hold your hand. I have known darkness too, so I will sit by you." (demo featured at the end of the video above)

I believe these stories will help people heal, connect them to the collective and pull them out of the isolation they may feel, even if for only a moment. 
I'm teaming up again with badass, whiskey-drinking, indie-pop producer Katie Buchanan for the recording and production. Then I will work with MTV VMA award-winning editor and director Alexander Hammer to create videos for you to experience each piece of this story.
In order for this project to move forward now, instead of taking 2-3 years longer, I need you. Consider yourselves: The Recording Contract of the People. <3
Quid pro quo
The price of production, recording and mixing for 5 songs (at a negotiated discount to the industry standard) is $7500. Add in the $750 for mastering, $992 for CDs, and additional administrative fees of $475 and we're at a total of $9717 before Indiegogo processing fees and your perks! And THERE ARE PERKS! For example:


voice lesson packages
CDs
access to the demos for the five original songs on Reckoning

access to the full demo cover videos that I'll be sharing during the campaign (Brandi Carlile and Billie Eilish are just two of the several artists I'll be covering)
songwriting hangs
house shows

story:
Short Summary

"If you like beautiful discoveries, off the trails of show biz, meet Independent Singer/songwriter Annelise. Based in the rolling hills of Northern California, Annelise brings you an eclectic, nomadic, musical mixtape with vocals you can't ignore."  Kamarad Fanch – Journalist;  Brittany, France. 

Hello! Annelise here! I started this Christmas album 13 years ago. I did a soft release of it with the first 7 songs and a year later began 3 more to add to it.  Due to life circumstances, I wasn't able to finish it until now! Every year my fans tell me how much they love the album and how timeless it is! So, it has a proven track record. 

With 3 new unheard songs and a remix of two of the originals, it's a new album!  I am beyond excited to give this Christmas Album the exposure it deserves and to re-invigorate your Christmas rotation with traditional carols like you’ve never heard them before.  My musicians on this record are world class and you are going to LOVE IT!! 

What We Need & What You Get

THE GOAL

  • Raise $20,000 in 2 weeks! 
  • Recoup recording & marketing costs of finishing the album. 
  • Raise funds to make some killer music videos
  • Invest in recording equipment that will allow me to record in my studio, saving money in travel and recording costs for the next project. 
  • Any money raised above my goal will go toward starting my next album that I plan to record in the spring of 2020

THE PERKS

Here are some of the Exclusive Perks I have available just during this campaign! 

  • Signed CDs & Photo cards
  • Shout-outs on Facebook, Instagram and my website
  • Major Contributors get Credits in a special video that will live forever on my website. 
  • Executive Producer level gets credits in all future recordings and a huge, amazing bundle including dinner with me and my husband in San Francisco (transportation and lodging not included)
  • Exclusive Hoodie designed by Annelise
  • Exclusive guitar pick designed by Annelise
  • Printed Song Book
    This 20 Page, full color song book contains lyrics to all the songs as well as hand written chord charts by the legendary Gary Lunn, bass player for Dolly Parton, Idina Menzel, Amy Grant, The Smoking Section, ME and many more. Art and graphic design done by me. 
  • Framed Custom Guitar Pick 
  • Custom Framed Guitar Pick with Both Our Names
    For Major Contributors you will get a Thank You Pick with your name and my name on it framed in a 2x3 or similar sized frame. 
  • Out of Print Show Posters 
  • COLLECTORS ITEM!  I have 4 sets of 3 posters that I used when I released my first two full length albums. These are the last ones I have. Once they're gone, they're gone. 
  • Original Release "Christmas" Album 
    COLLECTORS ITEM! Get the original "Christmas" CD.  I only have a few left.  Once they're gone, they're gone. 
  • Recorded Birthday Song on your Birthday! 
    I will send a professionally produced customized birthday song  to you or the person of your choice on your/their birthday in the year 2020.  If your birthday is in the beginning of January 2020 you will receive it in January of 2021.  What a surprise that will be! Just imagine the look on your loved one’s faces when they hear their name in a fully produced customized birthday song!  It’s going to be an epic moment and you will win major points! 

 

The Impact

I already know the impact this album will make because of its track record.  I hear from people every year how much they love the album.  The new songs are creative, unique, appropriate for the lyrical content!  One fan said, "I've never listened to so much Christmas music in January." Now, that says a lot if they continue to listen to it past New Year! 

 

Risks & Challenges

The good news about this campaign is that the album is done so you don’t have to wait long to get your bundles. My goal is that you have them to put under the tree! The only risks or challenges that might impede shipments is delay in product shipment to me. I have an army of elves ready to wrap your bundles and mail them out!  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute and still want to help that is HUGE! Here are some ways you can help.

  • Make some noise about my album! Tell your friends and family! 
  • Share my Social Media posts! 
  • Use the Indigogo tools to share. They make it easy for you!

 

Thank you so much, from the bottom of my heart! Now go get your bundle!! 

Annelise

story:
Who We Are and What We Do…

Hi Folks!  We are Marcus Baylor and Jean Baylor a.k.a. "The Baylor Project".  We started here on Indiegogo 6 years ago with our first album "The Journey" and it has been just that, a journey.  Starting with one gig at Smoke Jazz Club in New York City we turned a dream filled with music into a reality, with help from our Indiegogo contributors.  In 2017, we released "The Journey" which debuted at #1 on the iTunes jazz chart, #8 on the Billboard chart and received 2 GRAMMY® Nominations for Best Jazz Album and Best Traditional R&B Performance!  And, we spread our wings to perform at national and international music festivals!  Now, it's time to do it all over again.  :) Our second album titled "Generations" is in full tow as we complete production to release it spring, 2020. "Generations" is much more than a collection of songs.  It is a cultural anthology rooted in every day life experiences of love, family, community, faith, the African-American experience and our individual and collective process of self-growth. It's about honoring those who were here before us and how we will impact those who come after us.  "Generations" is the blues, roots, jazz, soul and gospel – it's the sound of who we are.

How You Can Help…

There are many ways you can help!  Of course, you can contribute to our campaign by selecting the category and perk that best suits you.  But, you can also help by sharing our campaign with your family and friends.  The more people that know about us, the better!  If you like our music, tell someone you think might like it too!  And, if you follow us on social media (please follow us) share and re-post what we post.  Sharing is the gift that keeps on giving.  Help us get the word out to as many people as possible.  All of these and more help us to reach our goal.  So, let your creative juices flow!

What Your Giving Means to Us….

When you contribute to our Indiegogo campaign, you help us fund the production and marketing that is necessary to create the finished product and spread the word that ultimately increases our audience.  Everything from studio sessions and photo shoots to publicity, music videos and social media are just some of the moving parts of this process.  Larger audiences translate into increased touring, music and merchandise sales, and our ultimate goal which is building that bridge to our fans!

story:
Hi! I am a songwriter and performer from Virginia. I have been writing and performing in various bands since around 2006. A few years ago I became a mother and decided to take a huge step back to focus on my family.  Now I am returning to music with my very first SOLO ALBUM!

  • Most of the songs and ideas for this record have spent YEARS on the back burner and I am so very excited to have finally brought it to life.  
  • This album has given voice to my humanity, my desires, my hurts and is incredibly meaningful to me. I have placed my full self into it and have been extremely fortuitous to have gotten to create it with the help of some tremendously prolific voices, instrumentalists, and minds. I also had the pleasure (and terror!) of producing it myself while leaning heavily on some very creative and generous makers.
  • Words fail to express the depth of my gratitude for my supporters and contributors. This is a truly massive undertaking, and it would be impossible for me to complete this without the gift of your help and financial backing. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $35,000 to complete this album with excellence and get it into your ears ASAP. These funds cover travel, photographs, stylists, website and branding, studio time, compensating personnel (musicians, singers, recording engineers, co-producers, and even childcare (so mama can actually work), paying for mixing and mastering, pressing vinyl, creating merch, etc.
  • We are devoted to experiencing music to the warmest and fullest extent so we will be pressing vinyl and gifting this (along with a free digital copy and some other perks) to all backers. 
  • Up to this point everything has been self-funded. If we do not reach our goal, we will GRATEFULLY allocate the funds gifted to the most important matters first. :)

The Impact

  • This is a very special project for me and one I have been moving toward and developing for years. I  am beyond elated to be finally bringing it to fruition.
  • I am extremely grateful for the creative and loving support of my listeners, my family, and my friends.   

Risks & Challenges

  • Making a record as an independent musician is artful and emotional, but also expensive. Please help us meet our goal so that this beautiful album can be heard. 
  • It takes a village to complete such an undertaking, but we are grateful to have an incredibly strong and capable network of friends and supporters. Your financial backing gives this project legs.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE! You may not be able to contribute financially, but your emotional support and excitement to share with your personal network are also an invaluable gift!
  • PRO TIP: use the Indiegogo share tools!
