story:
Short Summary

THE CATHOLIC GIRLS aren't done yet! We want to record, press and release a 45 with two brand new songs on real old school vinyl. We've been asked lately a lot about putting something out on vinyl and on new material. Yes, you asked for it and we want to give it to you. Here's the perfect answer. With your help we can make this happen. Two brand new songs recorded professionally and pressed onto real vinyl (maybe even colored vinyl) and available for the first time ever!

But we need to money to both record and press this one of a kind, collector's item. That's where you come in. You can make a contribution as low as $25 and get a copy plus your name on the record sleeve and as high as $500 and get super fan status and all the rewards that come with it! Check out all of our offerings. With your help we can get this done and pressed and put out by the Summer of 2021! It's new music in a collector's package from THE CATHOLIC GIRLS and you can be part of it! We hope to reach our full goal but if we don't, but at least come close, we will put it out anyway. We don't have a name for this project yet - it will probably be the name of one of the songs on the single - but we'll have a name as soon as we decided which of the many songs we want to release now! So sign up today and be there as THE CATHOLIC GIRLS explore new territory and conquer the world. We still have music left in us and want to get it out. We just need you! In addition to contributing, please spread the word about this new project for the band on all of the social media that you can. Make some noise so we can make some music. And we'll love you for it!

Please note - Our perks start at $20 for a pre-ordered copy of the 45! If you contribute any lower than $20 - there is no perk. And if we don't make it up to our goal of $2,500 - we will not be able to make the 45. Studio time is expensive as is pressing the vinyl copy. So contribute as much as you can! Thank you!!!

With your help we can make this happen. Two brand new songs recorded professionally and pressed onto real vinyl (maybe even colored vinyl) and available for the first time ever!
But we need to money to both record and press this one of a kind, collector's item. That's where you come in. You can make a contribution as low as $25 and get a copy plus your name on the record sleeve and as high as $500 and get super fan status and all the rewards that come with it! Check out all of our offerings. With your help we can get this done and pressed and put out by the Summer of 2021! It's new music in a collector's package from THE CATHOLIC GIRLS and you can be part of it! We hope to reach our full goal but if we don't, but at least come close, we will put it out anyway. We don't have a name for this project yet - it will probably be the name of one of the songs on the single - but we'll have a name as soon as we decided which of the many songs we want to release now! So sign up today and be there as THE CATHOLIC GIRLS explore new territory and conquer the world. We still have music left in us and want to get it out. We just need you! In addition to contributing, please spread the word about this new project for the band on all of the social media that you can. Make some noise so we can make some music. And we'll love you for it!
Please note - Our perks start at $20 for a pre-ordered copy of the 45! If you contribute any lower than $20 - there is no perk. And if we don't make it up to our goal of $2,500 - we will not be able to make the 45. Studio time is expensive as is pressing the vinyl copy. So contribute as much as you can! Thank you!!!

story:
My Story

Hi! My name is Jon Hendrix. I'm a 21-year-old Phoenix-based singer, songwriter, and producer who creates music that aims to evoke the full range of human emotion. My upcoming debut concept album, which paints a profoundly beautiful yet heartbreaking portrait of an individual experiencing immense loss and grief, is due out in May 2022.

6 years ago, I lost one of my closest friends to suicide, and I immediately went to music as a way to process the emotions I was experiencing. Music has always been such an important aspect of my life, but never has the call to create been so loud as it is now. I wish to tell my story of grief in the hopes that it may help others struggling with similar tragedies. With the help of this Indiegogo campaign, I will be able to do so.

 

Why Contribute?

As an independent artist, I don't have a label to help me finance the creation and distribution of my music. With your help, I will be able to fund time in the studio, physical copies, visual album, and so much more.

 

What You’ll Get

Here are some of the perks you’ll receive.

  • Handwritten Thank You Note
  • Sheet Music
  • Signed CD
  • Signed Vinyl
  • Handwritten Lyrics
  • Virtual Concert

 

About the Album

The album explores the 5 stages of grief: Denial, Anger, Bargaining, Depression, and Acceptance. Following an intro, each track coincides with each of these stages (e.g. my debut single "Nylon" encapsulates denial).

My work has been crafted over the course of 6 years as every song was created during a time where I was experiencing each stage. In doing so, I was able to paint a clear picture of what I was feeling as I moved through the emotions.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute money to my campaign, that's okay! You can support me by streaming my music on all streaming platforms, following me on social media, or by sharing this campaign and my music with others.

story:
Who is MilArt?

Milana has been playing piano and singing since her early childhood, it really ran in her family: her first teachers were her grandma and her dad. Arty has been an audiophile for two decades, also following his dad's footsteps. Five years ago we started our shared musical journey: from the first shy recordings of Milana's improvisations on a digital piano to the fully equipped home studio with an acoustic grand piano and recording equipment. We released eight original albums and participated in several collaborative ones, performed on radio and TV shows, festivals and solo concerts, gained thousands of followers on social platforms. We are proud of making it the indie way, without any label to back it all up, while also being able to support other artists too.

We are dreamers and what do they say? Dream BIG? So, we tried to and now we need your help to make the Dream happen!!

A Prelude to the Dream

On one Canadian wintry day, back in December 2016, Milana wrote a new song. It was a wintry song, a wondrous theatrical blend of Waltz and Tango, Jazz and Classical. Arty immediately fell in love with it. We both felt like this song is way bigger than any song we ever wrote before.

So, we started this project by arranging the song, inviting a vocal coach to shape Milana's singing and then recording it in our home studio - all this was done this Spring of 2017. In May, we wrote the video script together, it turned into a musical story, a story about magic and a dream, a fantasy and the reality.

The following month we spent scouting for different locations and designing the decorations. In August we hired a friend to improve the orchestration we did ourselves and then we hired a remote sax player to record the sax solo. We also found a professional cinematographer to work on the video and had the first session with him, recording the intro and the finale of the video.

Intermezzo

These days we are working with a choreographer to create a dance for her dancers - they will play the role of Snow Queen's court. We are also working with a theatrical makeup artist to design the look of the Queen.

The big day of filming the main part is approaching - 28th of October is when we are going to make the Dream happen on the stage of Kailash Mital Theater in Carleton University of Ottawa!

Crescendo

So, what is going to happen on 28th of October. Below is the plan:

  • 7:30am - wake up and have the first coffee;
  • 8:30am - head out to the theatre;
  • 9:00am - unload all the rented decorations, do the makeup for Milana, set up the lighting for filming the first scenes on an empty stage;
  • 10:20am - have the second coffee;
  • 10:30am - film ~40 seconds of the video script involving the scenes on the empty stage;
  • 12:30pm - have the third coffee and a lunch for the entire crew.
  • 13:00pm - set up the decorations, change costumes, work on the theatrical makeup for Milana and dancers.
  • 4:00pm - have the fourth coffee (yes, we will need it!);
  • 4:10pm - film ~1:30 of the video script in the setting of Snow Queen's Ice Castle, including dancers who will play the role of Queen's court;
  • 6:30pm - move the decorations to change the setting to a new scene;
  • 7:30pm - film ~30 seconds of scenes with a sax player;
  • 9:00pm - take off the decorations;
  • 10:00pm - go home;

It's going to be a long-long day, involving 8 actors on the stage and 12-15 more people to run the production: a video director, camera and light assistants, stage decor director, stage assistants, makeup artists, behind-the-scenes video operator, sound operator etc etc. Milana is going to be the main actor, Arty will manage the whole production.

This day is the most challenging part of the project, both scheduling and budget-wise (half of the project's budget is invested into this single day!). This is where your help and funding will be greatly appreciated:

  • Cinematographer services (including camera and light assistants) - $3000;
  • Choreographer and dancers (including the creation of the dance and rehearsals) - $1500;
  • Second half of theatre rental fees (the first half is already paid) - $800;
  • Makeup artist services (two different makeups for Milana and dancers) - $600;
  • Decor and additional lighting rental - $800;
  • Lunch for the entire crew - $300;

This is where YOUR HELP is MUCH NEEDED! And if you happen to live in Ottawa, we'll gladly accept any assistance on the filming day (you will be credited in the video, for sure!).

Snow Queen's Court

We have had (and will have!) a great honor of working with incredibly talented people to make this project happen. Below is the list of the current and some of the future participants (in the chronological order) with their roles in "The Snow Queen Waltz" project.

Diana Sharp - Voice Teacher

Diana's studied bel canto as well as contemporary singing techniques and worked as an opera singer in the UK. She worked with singers whose styles vary from opera to pop and a lot in between. As a singer Diana has worked with some wonderful teachers, coaches and conductors over 20 years of performing opera, comedy and in orchestral concerts in a wide range of musical styles. Her students were performing in musical theatre, rock bands, choirs and opera as well as successfully auditioning for Oxford University Music, Ottawa U Music and Acadia U for Music Therapy.

Ben Hoskyn  - Cinematographer

Born and raised in Vancouver, it was during teenage years spent in Hong Kong that Ben Hoskyn's love of music and film truly blossomed into a passion. After graduating from the renowned Broadcast & Media Communications program at BCIT he was recruited to direct a talk show and documentary series in Ottawa.. Recently Ben directed his first feature film, where he conducted multiple shoots on two continents, and production right across Canada in order to complete "8 Minutes Ahead".

Evgeniya Selifanova - Makeup Artist

Evgeniya is a Pro Makeup Artist, working with Ottawa and Montreal best photographers, designers and stylists. She studied in Chicago (Makeup First School of Makeup Artistry), specializing in fashion, beauty and bridal makeup. She was also published in Krowd Magazine.

Jeff Torres - Orchestral Arranger

Majored in theory and composition at Wisconsin Conservatory of Music, Jeff developed a keen interest in orchestral conducting as well as composing and arranging music. Jeff spent 15 years serving as Choir Director of various church choirs.

Gdaliy Garmiza - Alto-Saxophone

Gdaliy has played the saxophone for over 20 years and won several local and international competitions. He gained a university degree in music recording production in 2007 and published various articles on the art of music recording production. Gdaliy has huge experience in both live and studio work: as a session musician, he took part in many international projects and has worldwide clients from the USA, the UK, Germany, Norway, Spain, China, Turkey, India, New Zealand and other countries.

Don Nafe (TMR Productions) - Mix Engineer

Don Nafe has been a professional touring / studio drummer since 1980. He has played on, written or produced several CD's over the years. Presently he works out of his home studio known as TMR Productions, mixing music for Artists right around the planet.

Jason Fee (Conduction Mastering) - Mastering Engineer

Jason started interning in recording studios in 1999. In 2005 he assumed co-ownership of Sound of One Hand Recording Studios, the largest commercial recording facility in Ottawa. He was owner for two years, grew the mastering business, and eventually branched off to create Conduction Mastering. He now splits his time between Conduction and electronics design work for boutique guitar effects company Empress Effects.

Ludmila Kashkovar - Choreographer

Ph.D. in Art History and an international judge, Ludmila has been a professional choreographer for 30 years. She was in charge of the Chair of Contemporary Choreography at the Kiev (Ukraine) Municipal Dance Academy and founded "A Pearl" - a dance school for children, one of the best in Ukraine. In 2011, after moving to Canada, she founded Ottawa Dance Academy. Her students win overall first places at regional and national dance competitions.

Dema Silverwings - Theatrical makeup

Dema is a self-taught body painter and makeup artist as well as an acrylic canvass painter. Her work was published in yearly calendars in Europe since 2015 and she competed in a bodypainting competition in Atlanta, USA where she met Craig Tracy (a judge on the show Skin wars). She’s also an aspiring photographer and a lover of arts. She is a member of Art Fashion Studio, a collaborative group of artists and photographers. She works with awesome photographers in the Ottawa area and she offers bodypainting services for many different occasions like bridal showers, Halloween, Christmas, private shoots, Comic Con…etc. She’ll be doing the theatrical makeup for Milana and the young dancers in The Snow Queen Waltz!

Jarrod Goldsmith - Sax Player Actor

Jarrod has been featured in dozens of television, video and audio segments. He founded Sax Appeal, a unique professional saxophone ensemble (comprised of a Soprano, Alto, Tenor and Baritone saxophone) who performed at the Ottawa Jazz Festival and the Gatineau Hot Air Balloon Festival.

Bronson Townsend - Film Editor

Graduated from the prestigious Canadian Film Centre, Bronson was recognized as a fresh new voice and talented feature director, which won him an invitation to join the Directors Guild of Canada in late 2015 as part of a select new wave and up-and-coming independent directors. Bronson's feature debut was released in April 2015, garnering a theatrical run as well as TV distribution.

Snow Queen's Dream

Following the Big Filming Day, we'll have another busy month of editing the video, distributing the audio to major stores and streaming services (iTunes, Amazon, Spotify and so on), preparing the release party on 16th of December. You are most welcome to join us (the venue is still TBD) here in Ottawa and we'll try our best to stream it live for everyone who cannot attend in person.

Let's make this Dream Happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you very much for being a part of our project! We are doing everything for making this music video happen and you can do a few things to help us! 

  • Tell your friends about "The Snow Queen Waltz" and this IndieGoGo campaign.
  • Share photos and posts from our musical page on Facebook, Twitter and so on.
  • If you live in Ottawa, come to help us with setting up the decorations on 28th of October in Kailash Mital Theater (Carleton University).
    • And of course come over to the release party on 16th of December (TBD)

story:
Good morning, campers, and thanks for checking out The Sound Field's fundraiser page.

Who We Are

The Sound Field is a three-piece electric band in San Francisco, performing entirely original music. Singer and guitarist Deborah Grabien, who's responsible for all the songs, has been playing guitar since age 10 (a very, very long time ago) and songwriting since her teens. Deb and her husband, bassist Nic Grabien, have been making music together since 1976. (I did say a long, long time ago, yes?)

She's also co-written songs performed and recorded by guitarist Mark Karan with his own band https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n9Zp4tKQFaI, and with Lansdale Station founder Lauren Murphy (http://www.laurenmurphymusic.com/) . 

The band in its current form came together entirely because of ace drummer Larry Luthi. Larry heard Deb and Nic jamming, really liked the songs, and leaned on the others to put a band together. So, in late Autumn of 2013, The Sound Field began rehearsing.

A Little History

Shortly after we started, we played an hour-long fundraiser for South Bay radio station KKUP. Not long after that, we decided we had it together enough to try the waters at the Monday night open mic night at Mill Valley's Sweetwater, hosted by local keyboard legend Austin DeLone. Since then we've become the house band on Monday nights, playing a handful of our own songs, usually with Austin on keys https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVdhjxy0dig, and then backing some of the guests. 

Gigging Locally

The Sound Field is settling into a once-a-month regular gig at Second Act, on San Francisco's legendary Haight Street. We can also be found playing the second Tuesday of every month for a song or two at El Rio, San Francisco's best dive bar, playing with the fabulous Los Train Wreck.

Now That We Hopefully Have Your Attention...

We're looking to raise $10,000 to get ourselves into the studio and cut an EP of completely original songs. One song in particular "Fearless", will be cut separately. All proceeds from that one will go directly to our friend Tracy, who is battling late stage disseminated Lyme disease. No medical insurance covers any treatment for this, and Lyme patients must pay for it out of their own pockets. We're hoping this will put a little money into her fund. Let us know if you specifically want your contribution to go to this part of the project.

The EP will be recorded locally, with Mark Karan producing. 

A large chunk of that $10k will go primarily to the costs of producing the EP: studio time for tracking, mixing and mastering, plus Mark's guidance as producer. Another chunk will go to hire guests such as Austin DeLone (we love his keyboard work and he likes playing with us, so it's Austin for the win), and hopefully a couple of other local and national giants.

If we come up short, we'll scale back a little, but still produce as much of a project as we can afford. If we raise more than the above-mentioned $10K, we'll happily stretch it out to an LP.

Take a Look and a Listen

For a very good idea of who we are, what we play and what we sound like, click the Gallery link up above. We've uploaded a few videos from various shows, and a handful of photos and logos and so forth.

Perks!

Please have a look at the perks offered, and see what rocks your socks. You'll notice all the usual perks (tee-shirts, downloads, CDs) with a few slightly more unusual ones (handmade hula hoops, hour-long massages by a master, and some killer desserts).

Thanks for reading this far!

And there you go: what we're doing and what we're offering. Please share this on your social media - we really want to get into the studio, get it together, get it on, and get it out!

A large chunk of that $10k will go primarily to the costs of producing the EP: studio time for tracking, mixing and mastering, plus Mark's guidance as producer. Another chunk will go to hire guests such as Austin DeLone (we love his keyboard work and he likes playing with us, so it's Austin for the win), and hopefully a couple of other local and national giants.
If we come up short, we'll scale back a little, but still produce as much of a project as we can afford. If we raise more than the above-mentioned $10K, we'll happily stretch it out to an LP.Take a Look and a ListenFor a very good idea of who we are, what we play and what we sound like, click the Gallery link up above. We've uploaded a few videos from various shows, and a handful of photos and logos and so forth.
Perks!Please have a look at the perks offered, and see what rocks your socks. You'll notice all the usual perks (tee-shirts, downloads, CDs) with a few slightly more unusual ones (handmade hula hoops, hour-long massages by a master, and some killer desserts).
Thanks for reading this far!

And there you go: what we're doing and what we're offering.
Please share this on your social media - we really want to get into the studio,
get it together, get it on, and get it out!

story:
The Skinny:

Are you disappointed with the state of Rock n' Roll? Do you miss when plaid was in and rock bands actually rocked? Us too. We got together four years ago to do something about it. 

After three successful EP's and tirelessly touring the Southeast, we've been writing, rehearsing, and recording our first full length album Grown Man Rock n' Roll. With your help, we can release it to the masses so your kids won't have to live on pop music alone. Remember, it's all for the kids. 

What We Need & What You Get

To take RWH to the next level we've joined forces with two Grammy award winners: Recording Engineer Chad Brown (Mike Farris, Shine For all the People) and Mixing Engineer Warren Riker (Sublime, Santana, Lauren Hill) But Grammy's ain't cheap! We're asking for your help to raise $10,000 to finish recording, mixing and mastering our first full length album, Grown Man Rock n Roll. We're saying "Thank You" to every one that donates, from free records, to a free Red Wine Hangover rock show @ YOUR HOUSE!

Your Impact

Our last single "Blue as your eyes" was added to NINE major radio stations in the U.S. including Nashville (102.9 The Buzz), Destin (103.1 The Blaze),  & Biloxi/Gulf Port (97.9 CPR Rocks) . Your donations will not only allow us to finish recording, mixing, & mastering Grown Man Rock N' Roll but will also allow us to release our new upcoming single "Hitchhiker" to every rock radio station in the United States and Canada. This is crucial to build on our current radio success. With your help, we can turn 9 radio stations into 25 radio markets filled with Red Wine Hangover fans that request our songs, play our records, wear our t-shirts, and buy tickets to see us play. Twenty five markets would allow us to do what God put us on this earth to do...ROCK FULL TIME! But we can only make this a reality with your help.


Other Ways You Can Help

Got too much month at the end of your money? Are you as broke as we are? No worries. Please help us get the word out and share our video with people you love that love Rock n Roll. You can also like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, request our song at your local rock radio station, and stay up on everything that is Red Wine Hangover @ redwinehangovermusic.com. We love you all and thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

UPDATE 5/4/15: Thanks to everyone who has donated so far! We are grateful for all of you. Here is a brand new song and video we recorded for you LAST week! We hope you enjoy it and see what your donations have helped with!

story:
Short Summary

As young musicians passionate about opera and about the city they grew up in, Emily Nelson and Bethany Schweitzer Goshorn thought to themselves one day, why don't we have an opera on tap chapter in a city known for it's microbrews and amazing wines and spirits? After some contemplation, they decided if anyone should make it happen, it might as well be them! So they contacted the national organization and got a charter for a Portland chapter. 
Why be so passionate about opera? Because it speaks to the human condition. It expresses human emotion and relationship in a very unique and profound way. The human voice in all its glory has an almost visceral effect on us. In a culture that is so focused on instant gratification and short attention spans, opera demands your full attention and expects you to think and feel.
Chances are, 9 out of 10 people who say they don't like opera have never heard it live. Opera on tap seeks to change this by bringing the genre to people where they already spend their time: in the bar. It seeks to educate and to enlighten an audience that would never be exposed to the art form otherwise.  
For opera on tap to get started, we need to purchase a few pieces of equipment such as a keyboard, a microphone, and various odds and ends. Your contribution will give us the tools to sing in any venue regardless of the logistics. It will also help us be able to hire musicians with the best quality of singing and accompaniment.

What We Need & What You Get

To get started we estimate that we will need around $5000. This money would help us purchase or hire: 
  • a keyboard
  • an amplifier
  • a microphone
  • promotional materials (posters, website, business cards, etc...)
  • singers
  • an accompanist
WHAT YOU GET??? Private concert for donations over $x? T-shirts?
All of the money we earn from this campaign will go towards these items regardless of whether or not we reach our goal. Every little bit helps!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't help with a financial contribution, you can still help us find people who can! Share our campaign with your friends! Use the share tools for Facebook, pinterest, twitter, etc... If you know an opera lover that isn't computer savvy but might want to help us? Help them make a donation by navigating the site for them.

story:
Going into 2015 Immaunel "Mannie" Payne has decided to go further with his musical brand . He currently plays for Empowerment Temple AME Church's Teen Temple along side L.A. artist Tommi J. He is also the drummer for the renowned  Kortneigh McCoy Ensemble. Kortneigh McCoy was a young woman who was killed while breaking up a fight at Frostburg State University. This group of young people are on fire for God and devoted to keeping the memory of Kortneigh McCoy alive.

Immanuel is also the head Drum Coordinator at Parkville High school and has began composing music. Since being a little boy Mannie has dreamed of going to Berklee College of Music in  Boston, MA.  His parents want to start now with making this dream a reality. So they have stepped out on faith and enrolled him for Berklee's Five Week Summer Performance Program, "the largest and most comprehensive pre-college program anywhere"! His family is excited about how this experience could change Immanuel's life forever. Program details are as follows:

Start Date:
July 11, 2015

End Date:
August 14, 2015

Program Cost:
Tuition: $5,078.00
Housing: $3,460.00

His family is dedicated to make this dream a reality but need help with covering the cost of his tuition.

This is where we need YOU! Please hit the button to contribute to enhancing this young aspiring musicians education and making  one of his BIGGEST DREAMS come true. No amount is to big or too small...Thank you in advance! And please check back weekly to see his newest videos...they are guaranteed to be a treat!!

 Ways You Can Help

  • Contribute as Much as you can!
  • Check out Youtube videos {help raise veiws}
  • Check out his Website & Fan Page

story:
My name is Krimson, I am an 18 year singer/songwriter from Kodiak, Alaska. I have been traveling to Los Angeles to write & record songs with Davy Nathan, to not only create music that I love but to follow my dreams and share my message with the world. My goal is to become a well know singer and to influence people to find true happiness in what they love, to stay true to themselves, to follow their dreams and to enjoy the very short journey of life that we have.

I have been working on this dream of mine for a few years, giving it everything that I have mentally, physically & financially. I am asking for funding to gain $15,000. This money will be directly going to recording & traveling expenses. My goal is to get a music video out for everyone in May 2015, to my original song "Harbor Lights" that I wrote about commercial fishing in Alaska. Thank you all for you time and contribution . 

Krimson

story:
UPDATE:

Check out the BRAND NEW single going to radio in the next week which will form part of this album project!


What’s the point of having a beautiful record if no one gets to hear it? This has always been the independent artist’s Achille’s heel. I'm raising funds to get the album HEARD around the world, because now as ever, marketing is everything and how you get your voice out there makes all the difference. That difference is marketing, and marketing requires budget.

My name is Ard Matthews. I'm the lead singer for a band called Just Jinjer. We have made and continue to make quite a mark in the South African music landscape being the first rock band to sell a double platinum debut album and having gone on to sell more than 250 000 records to date. We've recently (Nov 2014) enjoyed yet another number one song on Algoa FM (a big regional station in SA) Anyway, the Jinjer machine continues to roll but I also did a solo album in 2012 and it's time for another.


Within all the success with Just Jinjer, I have really enjoyed the new found musical freedom of just doing everything myself when it comes to songs that I am always writing, without having to ask too much opinion.

I pledge to you that I will transparently use every cent raised on marketing and PR to get the word out there about the album.

Why the crowdfunding route? 

Having been involved in record deals in the past with Just Jinjer, I can safely testify that the best way to still have absolute control of your art is to own every aspect of it.  By going at it alone, everyone can be assured that everything put out there is an honest representation of who Ard Matthews is.

Other Ways You Can Get Involved...

We have some options for you to get involved on the business side of this album by becoming a shareholder - please send us a mail to info@ardmatthews.com and we'll get back to you with what we have in mind.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Become a cheerleader for us by telling all your friends about the campaign and sharing the IndieGogo link wherever you can! We'll notice and it won't be forgotten. 

Use any of the links at the bottom of this page, or just copy the link in your URL address bar at the top.

Original 'All Comes Round' album -
https://itunes.apple.com/za/album/all-comes-round/id580942227
Check out my last album 'First Offerings' - https://itunes.apple.com/za/album/first-offerings/id900529944

**NB - Please be sure to select a perk and not just contribute only - we want you to get something out of it :-)

story:
Dear fans, friends and family,

We are Han & The Radio Flyers and we need your help!!

Through our booking / management company Two B Entertainment, we have recently been squeezed into the line up to perform at The Spring Scream Music festival in Kenting Taiwan! Spring Scream is one of the largest festivals in all of Asia spanning over a 3 day weekend with over 10,000 international music fans in attendance.

This is a musicians dream and our opportunity to finally hit the big stage and perform in front of thousands of people. The only problem is that this is such a last minute opportunity that we don't have the budget on such short notice to get the whole band all the way to Taiwan for the festival. The Festival is just a little over a month away and this is our Hail Mary attempt to catch this possibly career launching opportunity!

I'm Han from BK, NY and the Radio Flyers are; Michael Kirchoffer on the drums from Long Island, Cedric Diaz on the keys from France, Kenny Johnson on the bass from Boulder, Colorado and our artist manager Brandon Bailey from Two B entertainment based out of Orlando, FL.

In order to fly all of us over there, we will need to raise at least $8000 in the next 30 days to pay for our flights, hotel and accommodations. In exchange for your generosity, we are offering our humble rewards ranging from autographed CDs to private live performances! If we don't raise the total amount of money in 30 days, we won't keep a penny of your donations.

We finally have a shot at the big stage. We just need a little help from our friends. Thank you so much for all your continued support!!

story:
There is a small monastery in the north of Serbia where I visit occasionally. It’s the home to two dozen monks who begin their days with a 4am service, work in the monastery during the day producing candles and honey, cook meatless meals, and keep the rare and ancient musical tradition of Byzantine chanting in their services and choir practice. Over the years I made friends there and had been invited to join in the evening service and stay for their simple meals. During one of the visits two years ago, I recorded a Byzantine chant in the small monastery chapel.

I incorporated that recording in Beyond Zero, a piece with music and film that Bill Morrison and I made for Kronos Quartet for the centennial of World War One.  Beyond Zero ends with fragments of a Byzantine hymn, “Eternal Memory to the Virtuous,” chanted by the monks in remembrance to all who lost their lives in the Great War and every single war since then.  When Kronos Quartet came to perform Beyond Zero in Serbia this fall, I invited my friends from the monastery to the concert. To my surprise, they not only accepted to come to the concert, but offered to perform their part live! It was an amazing, emotionally charged event, with several distant worlds merging on the stage.

Kronos Quartet will perform Beyond Zero in Carnegie Hall on March 7th. Your generous contribution will enable the Kovilj monastery monks perform live at this event, and three days later at a concert in Urbana, IL.

Please contribute!  We are grateful for any amount - and please forward the link to your friends! These funds are to support the travel, lodging, visa expenses, and meals for five persons.

And please plan to come to the concerts and hear live the sound of an ancient chant that has survived in only several monasteries in Serbia - sung by the very people who dedicated their lives to preserving that tradition.

If you would want to contribute but cannot access the online payment system, please email me at avrebalov@yahoo.com, or skype me at avrebalov.

Check the photo gallery on top of this page!

THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

We work our butts off. We played over 150 dates in 2014, and we already have 98 booked for 2015! Every place we go, people ask us when new music is coming. We don't have an answer for them. The fact is, we travel down the road, play shows, and do it all over again.  Between wear and tear on the vehicle, inevitable gear breakdowns, food, hotels, etc, it becomes impossible to save enough to record a full project. We have tons of music to put out there, and if you have been to a live show, we've been lucky enough to share some of it with you. When we were thinking about how we could afford to get new music out we realized the best place we could go is to you, the fan. 

Every day we are writing songs and working on our craft. We want to be able to share our hearts with you through our music.  Help us by donating to this project! We can't wait for y'all to hear what we have in store for you!


What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000 to be able to bring you this project. The costs include:

  • Studio Time
  • Session Musicians
  • Producer Costs
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Duplication Costs
  • Artwork
  • Photography
  • Come to lunch with us and we'll give you the entire layout of the project :)
What's in it for you?! Check out all the awesome perks along the right side of the page!
Plus, all donations come with an entry for a signed guitar from the band!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the project on Facebook, Twitter, email your friends and coworkers, tell you rich uncle to go ahead and cut a check! There are so many ways for you to help us. Just ask how and we would be grateful for you help!

Come to lunch with us and we'll give you the entire layout of the project :)

What's in it for you?! Check out all the awesome perks along the right side of the page!
Plus, all donations come with an entry for a signed guitar from the band!

    Other Ways You Can Help Share the project on Facebook, Twitter, email your friends and coworkers, tell you rich uncle to go ahead and cut a check! There are so many ways for you to help us. Just ask how and we would be grateful for you help!

story:
Night Idea Story

We've been together for 5 years now and released 2 albums independently.  We've played hundreds of shows and been to 13 states.  We plan on using this album as the strongest representation of us and playing significantly more. We are doing a  DIY approach using friends and an art space for recording as opposed to a studio.  

We need $6000 and you get our music 

This time around we are very cost conscious and getting the most bang for the bucks:

  • $3000- Tracking/Mixing/Mastering/Studio Space
  • $2100- 350 Vinyl Press (didn't include on video)
  • $200- Album Design/Artwork for physical copy
  • $100- Hired sting section
  • $600- Digital and Physical Promotion to support release

The Impact

We have made changes in our professional careers to make more music because we simply love doing it.  This further enables us to create and share our music with you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Come to a show.  Share the video.  Tell your friends about what we intend to accomplish.  


We best buds and we rox

story:
Si de una semilla se puede cultivar una flor. Y si de un pensamiento
Se puede componer una cancion.  Y si de una semilla
Se pudiera componer una canción  pues eso seria una maravilla.

Short Summary of our "Sembrando Semilla" (Planting Seeds) Project

Jeff and I need your help.  We are organizing a project helping support the musical needs for the people of Cuba.  Cuba's music organizations and related school programs need instruments and music accessories. Our objective is bringing musically related items to help them continue their musical interest with up-to-date equipment and accessories. We spent the last 2 years planning a way to get to Cuba and it's finally becoming a reality.

Our original plans included taking an industrial container full of instruments to Cuba and distributing them to school systems with a shortage of music items. Our dreams met reality when we discovered a great idea is not as simple as it sounds. We realize starting small is the best way to approach our music instrument drive.  This April we will donate music accessories to a Cuban orchestra while also building relations with other music organizations to learn about their music needs.

Milton's thoughts:

On April 5th we venture on our mission "Sembrando Semilla" (Planting Seeds). Our current goals are downsized to reflect reality. Jeff and I will meet with organizations in Cuba, visiting schools and getting to know the people we hope to help.  Furthermore there are current discussions in the media about the embargo and how our government is easing restrictions on Cuba relations. Does this mean we should not go forth with our dreams and goals?  I don’t think so. That’s why on April 5th, approaching quickly, we will be on our way! It may take years to undo what over 50 years of the embargo has done to the progress of Cuba and we are not waiting any longer - the time is now! I have always taken an interest in music and Cuba.  Latin music has been an inspiration to me; it’s instilled in my heart and culture. Planting this seed in Cuba and in our local community will guarantee us the development of future artists and exceptional music.

Our concept for this project is to plant seeds, not actual seeds, but a seed of hope, enjoyment, and opportunity that will last a lifetime for many. Our message is with the right tools and education there is nothing a child cannot accomplish. I had a seed planted in me growing up in the city of Philadelphia. I had several seeds planted in me my whole life; from Aspira that taught me how to find my first job, to a father who taught me the value of hard work.  As a child I was exposed to music but never had the opportunity to take lessons and grow.  It took 30 years but I finally enrolled in ALMA (Artístas y Músicos Latino Americanos). The instructors took a seed of music that was dormant and brought it to life. In the short period of time I was there I came to realize that I must be involved in the arts one way or another. I am continuing my education Studying Digital Video Production at CCP (Community College Of Philadelphia) and now I hope to plant seeds in others to help them grow their musical talents. So planting seeds in Cuba is our first stop.  Wow I’m excited about this project to be able to help a student become the musician of tomorrow by planting this seed and I hope you are also.

Jeff's thoughts: 

 Cuba has so many genres of music including Son Montuno, rhumba, Afro-Cuban jazz and salsa; all of these have influenced so many new styles in our society throughout history. We wish to support the next generation of Cuban musicians and you can be a part of this experience.  A little over 2 years ago Milton and I met with my friend Pamela Martin to discuss Cuba where she has traveled in excess of 65 trips. She expressed the desperate need for music instruments and accessories from her personal experience with the Cuban people. Pamela has a close relationship with a Cuban orchestra called Camerata Romeu (this is our first recipient of our donated strings and accessories) in addition to many others in the related arts field. I have known Pamela's family for over 15 years and it's great to be visiting Cuba with her. My background includes working in music related fields such as composing, recording and music licensing. I current live in the Philadelphia suburbs and have known Milton for over 5 years; it's a great pleasure to be working Pamela and Milton on this Cuba venture.

What We Need & What You Get

We are very excited about this project but it will not be successful without your financial support. Our main goal is to purchases musical supplies (violin, viola, cello and bass stings, rosin, blank sheet music, pencils and anything else) and to transport to those most in need.   Your financial support is critical to our success.  Should funding exceed our goals than even more supplies will make it to Cuba on our initial trip.

We will document our activities through still images and video recording to share with our donors. See Perks for Details.

Thank you for your help in supporting our project!

The Impact

What impact will your donations make? As our instrument drive develops, students in Cuba will have the tools they need to learn to play a musical instrument and continue to fill our future with new artistry. Not every one of these students will become great musicians, but we believe music makes an impact in all of our live. “Learning music facilitates learning other subjects and enhances skills that children inevitably use in other areas. A music-rich experience for children of singing, listening and moving is really bringing a very serious benefit to children as they progress into more formal learning,” says Mary Luehrisen, executive director of the National Association of Music Merchants (NAMM) Foundation, a not-for-profit association that promotes the benefits of making music.

We have both seen the impact music plays in people’s lives and without the proper tools it’s just a little more difficult to achieve. We can only imagine what the music future holds when you pair music skills with basic music necessities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can help fund this project but there is still something you can do. If you have a new or used small instrument or accessory that are not being used consider donating it to our cause. Please share this worthwhile cause with friends and family. So make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! It’s just a little click away to begin Planting Seeds /Sembrando Semillas.

Feel free to contact Milton at mitlons123@gmail.com if interested in sending a physical donation.

story:
About me:

 Delisha Doakes is a gospel artist on the rise .  She has an eclectic sound that many have and will take notice of.
"I sing Jesus music. That's what I was created to do and God has given me the ability to produce and present fresh music that is relatable, relevant and real. This music is not only for God's people but for those who are living outside the body of Christ as well. My job is to draw people closer to Him, and to put Him on their mind.  I plan on drawing people closer with every song I sing."

 Delisha has shared the stage with many local artists in San Diego. She has performed at the San Diego County Fair, the San Diego Prestige Awards and Poetic Praise 2013 in Illinois. Delisha also serves as a praise and worship leader over Lakeview Community Church music ministry.  Her debut album entitled" So Grateful" is scheduled to be released this summer 2015. "I am excited about how God will move concerning this album! Will you help me reach my goal? If so, please click 'Donate Now!'" 

What I need and What you Get:

My goal is to raise $3500. This money will go towards the costs of completing the rest of my album, duplication, packaging and minor distribution. It will also help me cover the cost of cover art, photography sessions, website construction and other artist related merchandise. What you will get is ongoing communication and updates from me about the project. You will also have a chance to receive rewards based on the dollar amount you give. 

 Other Ways You Can Help

 Please spread the word! Share this page with your social media friends and family.
